review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: First class location for fishermans wharf plus street cars.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, cannery, ghardelli square, street cars etc

review.title: Overpriced property
review.reviewText: This hotel charges as though it is a luxury hotel.  It isn't!  I haven't paid that much for a room that small since the Shinjuku Hilton in Tokyo.  The room was small and ordinary and what I would expect at a roadside motel.  The bath soap were the small bars like you find in cheap motels.  The towels were small and of low quality.  The internal rooms have a lovely view of the pool roof.  The finish of the rooms is shabby.  The Marriott is on the adjacent corner, and the Holiday Inn Express is in front.  Both are far better properties.  The hotel has a nice location but other properties in the same area provide more value for you dollar.  I'm a frequent World traveler and have been to San Francisco many times but not to this property.  I will never stay there again and I don't recommend this hotel to anyone.
review.negativeRemarks: The quality of the towels and bath supplies.  The overall finish of the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: A WWII Liberty ship, a Balao class submarine, a 19th century square rigged ship and schooner are a few blocks away.  A colony of sea lions nearby.

review.title: Reasonable quality and price
review.reviewText:
Convenient location , away from "bad part" of city
Shower is not nice. Wonder if it's SF wide coz of drought 
Mattress too soft, no good for 6-days stay

review.title: Great customer service
review.reviewText: Arrived about 4pm with two rooms booked. Only one room was available so had to wait for approximately 40 minutes for the second room and having had a 6 hour flight from new york was not very impressed.  However the hyatt excelled in customer service and as a way of apologising both rooms were given complementary breakfasts for the entire stay which were excellent. Well done hyatt that's what I call customer service
review.positiveRemarks: Location for fishermans wharf and street car stops plus bay area
review.negativeRemarks: Outdoor pool only 3ft deep making it difficult to swim perhaps deepening part of it
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39 on fishermans wharf, refurbished ferry building. Both street car terminals close by powel/hyde & powel/mason. Sourdough bakery,  cannery, etc

review.reviewText: very good hotel and excellent location for all the sights

review.title: Nice hotel.
review.reviewText: The only bad thing about the hotel is that they charge $60 per day for parking.

review.title: Goodall location to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel is close to the piers, its quiet and safe. But doesn't have vending machines, and the towels and bathtub were stained. Room doesn't have microwave and if you have small children it's important to prepare their breakfast or bottles.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Easy walk to Fishermans Wharf and Pier 39, Cable Car stop just out the door and tram stop short walk making it easy to travel city. Staff friendly, clean and spacious rooms.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Located close to the water front. Helpful staff.

review.title: Shower mat and bed sheets had holes .
review.reviewText: Unbelievable at the Hyatt centric hotel with 300+ dollar rates

review.title: Wonderful!
review.reviewText: The air conditioner went out during our stay. There was a delay but the managers did everything to correct the problem! The air conditioner was fixed, the managers delivered a complimentary tray with all types of goodies. They also called to make sure the air conditioner was working and also gave us a free breakfast for my entire family!!! Excellent service! This is my third time staying in California. When I go back I will be staying at the this hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!
review.locationRemarks: Great location walking distance. Close to everything!

review.title: Good location to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Were not aware that they had a place to purchase sodas, milk, etc to make our stay more convenient.  Would have been nice to know.  Outdoor pool is not helpful in August, evening are too cold to swim.  Bathrooms needed more storage such as shelves for personal belongings or hooks to dry towels, hang a robe, etc.  Our view was of the roof top - that sucked - felt we should get a discount for that.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Fisherman's Wharf.  Lots of restaurants around
review.negativeRemarks: See Bathrooms above.
review.locationRemarks: See above.

review.reviewText: I truly enjoyed my stay.  The hotel is located within walking distance of many activities.

Excellent location.walking distance to Pier 39.Public transportation  very convinient.Nice pool and spa to relax after a day visiting the City and the surrounding.classy staff.Brunch and continental breakfast are very good but a little expansive .negative point..the mattress.,not the quality we should expect from. this h√¥tel.Danielle,Quebec.

Over the years I've stayed in this Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf for many times, but my last stay gave me a very bad impression! The bathtub was greasy and clogged, the toilet wasn't clean, the bed sheet had a stain, the sink was clogged too. My wife was very upset about the cleaness of the room and said she rather stay at the Holiday Inn across the street. We agreed not to stay in this hotel again!
review.negativeRemarks: THE BATHROOM SHOULD BE MORE CLEAN

review.title: This is where you want to be..
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel for 8 nights, and it was lovely. The staff is incredibly nice, the rooms are immaculate, and most importantly it's location is perfect. You are 2 blocks away from the Wharf. Their restaurant had excellent food, and their concierges were very helpful. The only complaint would be the price of parking, but parking is expensive at all hotels in San Francisco. This is one of the more pricey hotels, but believe me it is worth it. I'm going back to San Francisco, and I will be staying here again.

review.title: Do not arrive early
review.reviewText: Nice hotel - but we arrived two hours early and had to wait (after a 9 hour trip) - said they would text when room was ready but did not. Also when we got our room - dead on check in time 3pm - it did not have a city view (see pic) - was too tied to complain.

review.title: All good but the wifi
review.reviewText: This was my second stay at this hotel. The location was great, the room was clean, staff were all very helpful. The wifi signal in our room was not strong enough to allow us to connect our devices. I called the front desk and they offered to send up an technician, I declined. It's just wifi so I can live without it but if I had needed it for work it could have been a bigger deal. I'd stay here again.

review.title: Dated hotel that is overpriced.
review.reviewText: Rooms and beds are small. Valet parking is mandatory and costs $60. Pool is incredibly small and shallow. Food was quite good. Personally, I would either spend more money for more comfort somewhere else, or spend less money for the same elsewhere.

review.title: Excellent well done job
review.reviewText: Was a great vacation people at the hotel were very helpful will recommend for future visits very clean and hospitable esp front desk help were awesome thank you very much will defenitely be back and bring the family and tell all my friends to visit this Hayatt in their future stay at San Francisco

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Walking distance to Fishermans Wharf, great restaurants and tour locations.  The room was comfortable.

review.title: Nice hotel walked to Pier 39 in minutes
review.reviewText: Great hotel and nice helpful staff. Had lunch in restaurant was good food that came out quick.

review.title: Horrible Beds
review.reviewText: Everything was good about the hotel but the terrible bed killed the whole experience. I was there for three days and did not sleep the entire time which ruined my trip.  The bed was so sunken in, in the middle, it felt like I was sleeping on a hammock.  It really hurt my back.  There were two beds in my room and they were both exactly the same.  Hyatt PLEASE update your beds!  They must be 30 years old with worn out springs!  :(

review.title: Great location, quiet rooms but no air circulation
review.reviewText: great location close to bus, ferry and trolley stops. Room was clean and quiet. For some reason, however, there were no vents/fans in the room/restroom and the windows did not open, leaving no method of bringing in fresh air or removing steam from the shower.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide bathroom fans for air circulation. Double beds were also quite small for 2 adults. Not a queen size bed in double rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Tons of stuff - Trolley rides, ferry/boat rides, Madam Tussaud's, Rain Forest Cafe, Ripley's Believe it or not,5 min from Ghiradelli square & beach

review.title: Very convenient location
review.reviewText: Many restaurants, shopping and tour bus stops within walking distance.

The hotel was clean and convenient to downtown activities.  Our room was always cleaned when we got back from our sightseeing.  The staff was very helpful and friendly.  If I were to go to San Francisco again, I would definitely stay there.

review.title: Nice hotel in fishermans wharf area
review.reviewText: Hotel is conveniently located near fishermans wharf. Very close to trolley and cable car lines and pier 39. Staff was mostly very helpful and pleasant. We have small children and appreciated having a quiet room at night. The rooms were recently updated and clean.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: The room we were given was noisy and right next to thepool. This room would be more appropriate for a family than a couple celebrating a fortieth anniversary. Maid service would show up to clean the room after we were trying to rest in the afternoon. We had to keep leaving trying to get them to service our room. The showerhead comes out of the ceiling and gets hair wet. It can't be adjusted because of the height. I expected much more for a Hyatt!

review.title: Very nice area, close to restaurants and shopping
review.reviewText: Great service and care , friendly , caring people

review.title: Nice hotel close to resturants. Shoppoing
review.reviewText: Hotel is Nice place. Expensive $$$$ the fishermans wharf is now a dirty place the city needs to review what needs to be done to clean up this area  trash every where  smelly. Over crowded. Homeless everywhere   Down by federal building and pier 23 are nice areas. Over all the San Fran city very disappointing dirty

review.title: Nice hotel and perfect location
review.reviewText: Very nice location that is very close to Fisherman's Wharf and transportation around the city. Jasmine was great in assisting us with transportation and day trips. Would not recommend the Yosimite trip with Incredible Adventures. It was a 15 passenger van that packed us in like sardines. The front three rows were taken, when they picked us up, and we had to sit in the back where there was no air condition. We continuously asked the driver to keep the blower on high so we could get some air, but he kept turning it down complaining that it was getting too cold in the front. I told him that he needed to have his company correct this, but I am sure it fell on deaf ears. Other than that, he was a decent guide.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was great, it was very clean and serviced daily. Staff was friendly, except for one of the Concierges. He was arrogant.
review.negativeRemarks: Go on tours so you know what you are selling.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location and plenty to do in the Fisherman's Wharf area. Close to transportation.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: Excellent staff, lovely and comfy accomendations, and extremely convenient location!

review.title: Comfortable hotel on Fisherman's Warf
review.reviewText: Great location within easy walking distance to tour lines, public transportation, cable cars, restaurants, shops and all the excitement on Fisherman's Warf. The hotel was clean and comfortable with a great staff. I would stay there again.

review.title: Nice hotel, good location but ........
review.reviewText: Watch was left in hotel room while away for the day. Wasn't sure as I often misplace things as living out of a suitcase but since back home watch appears to have been taken along with food left in room. Too late to do anything about it now!!!!!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great week . Nice hotel and great location to everything San Francisco !!!
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: within walking distance to everything shower area by pool needs work hotel polite but not informative about hotel extras or area compared to other hotels we have stayed at. Room was good everything clean and serviced every day. no gift shop which most large hotel chains have but not a real concern but over all ok but not great.
review.negativeRemarks: more friendly and informative
review.locationRemarks: everything close cable car fishermans wharf and boudin resturant really good

review.title: Nice hotel, close to the wharf
review.reviewText: As someone who often stays at Hyatts, this hotel does not have the Hyatt Grand beds I'm used too. The beds were terrible, but location was perfect for our trip. The bathtub was stained and could have used a new shower liner without mold at the bottom. They do provide a shower mat to put down, so at least you don't have to stand in the stained area. For the nightly price, I would expect a little more. Hotel staff was friendly.

review.title: Location to Pier 39, trolley, Alcatraz is great.
review.reviewText: Parking rate is high, room size is adequate, restaurant/lounge is really good...gluten free bread available. Overall is good for area.

review.title: Nice hotel to enjoy SF
review.reviewText: The location could not be better to feel Wharf area. Facilities and room were excellent and staffs were perfect.

review.title: Nice close to the Wharf area
review.reviewText: Great location.  Very friendly staff.  Clean.  Overall a very nice hotel

review.title: close to everything
review.reviewText: rust in Tub. needs upgrade, but overall hotel great. could never get the room cold enough but location can't be beat!
The shower head smelt like mildew when you used it so it stunk up the entire bathroom.

Hotel and facilities were very nice. 
All attractions were within walking distance!

kind staff and close hot spot
if I visit in san francisco again I will stay

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location, just blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and Ghirardeli Square. The staff was friendly and helpful, and helped us book some of our tours. Rooms were clean and spacious.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Ghirardeli square and the tram lines up Russian Hill are all within walking distance.

review.title: We loved this place!!!
review.reviewText:
Great location!!! Friendly, responsive staff. They had delicious fruit infused water every day you could help yourself to. The beds were comfortable. My daughter liked the peppermint taffy at the front desk.  
Great breakfast buffet with top notch service. Nice workout room and pool/hot tub area.
review.locationRemarks: Very close walk to the wharf, Ghiradelli's, Pier 39, etc.

review.title: Best location!! Clean  and quite
review.reviewText: Excellent!! The best location , good staff. Clean and quite

review.title: Great hotel in a superb location
review.reviewText: First time visiting San Francisco and we were welcomed to the Grand Hyatt with complimentary wine and fruit to start off our anniversary getaway. The room was a good size, the king size bed was so so comfortable and the cleanliness was to a high standard. The only minor issue is that instead of porcelain mugs to make tea and coffee - they use paper mugs. The following morning there was a protest outside the Hyatt - I think they were part of the Union and they were circling the Hyatt disrupting the guests and I think they were trying to sway the guests to get upset and ask for a refund or work us up due to the disruption. The Hyatt had security there and when a protestor approached me - I gave him a decent mouthful of my thoughts on a selfish protest that could have been dealt with management directly as opposed to innocent guests. A Hyatt staff member overheard this and offered sincere apologies about this protest, explained the situation then organised to have complimentary wine and food brought up to our hotel room with a hand written letter. We couldn't fault the staff or the hotel - the overall stay was exceptional and we would gladly return. The location is perfect, it is a safe area with lots of local attractions within walking distance like pier 39 and Ghirardelli Chocolate Factory. Lombard street is also around the corner. Just prepare yourself for the hills!

review.title: Clean and quiet. Great location.
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and quiet.  Great location.  Able to easily walk to Pier 39, Alcatraz Landing, Ghiradelli Square, and Boudin Bakery.
review.locationRemarks: Able to easily walk to Pier 39, Alcatraz Landing, Ghiradelli Square, and Boudin Bakery.  Also close to start of the Big Bus city tour bus.

review.title: Quiet Comfort in a great location
review.reviewText:
We thoroughly enjoyed the restful sleep and pleasant environment of this hotel.
The location was great, just steps away from the Fisherman's wharf and easy access to the cable cars and other sites.

review.title: close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
Well situated hotel, in walking distance of many activities.
The room was clean and the reception staff very friendly, welcoming and helpful.
Small items ie. shower cap, qtips etc. were available but not on hand. So it was down to the bare necessities shampoo, lotion and soap, that was it. Everything else you needed to request. 
There is a saying, if you have to ask for something, they don't want to give it to you in the first place.
That's how it felt to me.
review.negativeRemarks: The food in the restaurant needs improvement.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Staff was very accommodating and friendly.  We were minutes from many attractions.  Short walk to the cable cars.

review.title: The Location Is fantastic.
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly from registration to departure. Particular front desk personnel who were exceptional were Eddie and Lashanna

review.title: Nice Hotel.  Walkable distance to a lot of area.
review.reviewText:
Everything about the hotel is awesome.  But, the air conditioning wasn't working.  Our room was extra warm.  We had the temperature at 62 and it was like high 70's. It was a sleepless night.  We did inform the front desk and they got it fixed.
My kids didn't like the bed.  They said it was uncomfortable.  To me was great.  The pillows tho was like super soft, like flat.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything! Especially the friendly staff.  And had a refrigerator.
review.negativeRemarks: Have a microwave.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.  Ross is in the back side.  You got Starbuck, Trader Joes and Safeway around the corner.  5 minute walk to a lot of eateries.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText:
The location of this hotel made it convenient to visit a wide variety of attractions in SanFrancisco.  It is walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, close to the cable car to access Chinatown and Union Square, and was an inexpensive Uber ride to all other locations.

The only knock I'd had is on the beds......do they still make and sell full size beds?  We'll look for queen sized beds for our next trip out.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
Although this hotel is ideally situated to explore San Francisco our Hotel experience was disappointing. 

We had booked a room with 2 double beds and on checking in mentioned that four would be sharing and requested enough towels, soap, etc. I was assured that this had been noted and communicated to housekeeping.   Not once in 4 days did housekeeping make the room accordingly.  In addition on one of the days one of the beds was not even made!

The toilet tissue dispenser was barely attached to the wall so it was impossible to use.

Walking to our room, immediately after checking in, we passed a tray on the pasage floor with a plate of half eaten pastries, not a concern (room service available)  however when the same plate was still there two days later and had been joined by two trays of half eaten meals even though housekeeping had been up and down the passage two days in a row, we were staring to understand why everything else was below standard.

Travelling internationally we thought sticking to the Hayatt name would be safe but now really regret not staying at the Best Western on the next block

review.title: My wife got sick after the first night
review.reviewText: We were staying at room 551 for the past weekend. The air in the room was very dry and dusty. My wife was feeling uncomfortable after the first night. After the second night she got upper respiratory tract infection. I don't know how and what the hotel uses to clean the room, but we have never had an experience like this before. We will never stay at this hotel again. We should've chosen the holiday inn cross the street.
review.negativeRemarks: The sprinkler in the bathroom is TERRIBLE! Can't believe Hyatt is using shower heads with such bad design. The water spreads so out it's hard to wash.

review.title: Handy
review.reviewText: This Hotel is very close to The Wharf but far enough away not to get caught up in the Hubble. I would stay there again, lots of facilities are within walking distance, great choice in surrounding area.
review.positiveRemarks: Very comfortable and pleasant staff especially the receptionist woman with the curly hair.
review.negativeRemarks: The Air Con..    It goes on and off all night and it could be a lot quieter
review.locationRemarks: Lots, Beach, Boats, Bars and pleasant surroundings.

review.title: Great!!
review.reviewText: Staff was great and the location is perfect for a trip to San Francisco!!
review.locationRemarks: Everything you want to do or see is walking distance!

review.reviewText: It was an ok hotel in an ok location. Nothing special.
review.negativeRemarks: The service was terrible in the sports bar attached to the hotel.

review.title: Small room not many amenities.
review.reviewText: Hotel looked nice from lobby, only parking was valet at 67$ a night. Room was very small, we had a family room and it only had one small chair for seating and one small closet for clothes (we stayed for 5 nights). The bedding and pillows were very poor quality and we kept having to ask for towels, there were only 3 for four people. They left 2 small glasses and the bathroom was tiny and did not have a fan. The on site restaurant was very good. Overall it was very disappointing and very expensive. The location was nice and close to many activities. After 2 nights we started parking on the street and moving the car around.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This Hyatt is located within walking distance to pier 39 and other attractions.  The room was clean, and the staff was friendly.  I would stay at this location again.

review.title: Great Hotel Close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This was a wonderful hotel.  Close to everything.  Rooms were comfortable.  Nice little pool.  It was very nice.  Good for families with teens
review.positiveRemarks: it looked newly remodeled.  Staff was helpful and friendly.  Great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was expensive
review.locationRemarks: Very close to everything in the Fisherman's Wharf area.  Cable Cars behind the hotel.  Close to Starbucks, Safeway, Trader Joes, Walgreens.

review.title: Nice hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our 5 night stay at the Hyatt. Staff was very friendly, rooms were clean and modern. Beds were very comfortable. We could hear conversations of other guest in the nearby rooms, we simply turned the fan on our thermostat to the on position so we could not hear any extra noise. Overall very happy and would come back again.

review.title: Good location to activities and food
review.reviewText:
Room very nice but thin walls

Would recommend this hotel

Parking fees are high, if going again I would opt to rent a car right down the street for the 1 day we needed it and save the hotel feed

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: I loved the location.  It was close to shopping, restaurants and tours. I would stay here again.
Location, location, location!! Clean, helpful, accessible hotel for Fisherman's Wharf. Made out stay in San Fran very convenient.
The staff was friendly--everyone.  The rooms were quiet.  The hotel is walking distance to the pier, neighborhood touring, trollies, and bay.

review.title: My first San Francisco trip
review.reviewText: My first San Francisco trip at registration at the hotel The nicest lady Effie  was there to greet us she is very helpful and friendly and bubbly and made each day enjoyable by greeting us by name the Hyatt was very nice not too far from the fisherman's wharf which was where we spent most of our time

review.title: Nice hotel and good location to transit & pier
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and efficient.  The hotel was clean and located in a good spot by the pier and had public transportation including cable cars easily accessible.  Location close to pier and lots of activities.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was friendly and hotel was clean and the location was good.
review.negativeRemarks: Perhaps a more heated pool if anything.  The whirlpool was good though.
review.locationRemarks: Nice that bus stops and cable car stops near by and places to eat nearby.  Close to the pier for all kinds of activities and places to eat.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: All was in perfect, except we did not realize, there was no shuttle to the hotel from the airport. We took a taxi.

review.title: Not again
review.reviewText: My baby got bug bite from the crip.  Elevators broke so we have to carry baby stroller up on the stairs.  Customer service always busy when you call them.

review.title: Clean! Contemporary! Great location
review.reviewText:
My high compliments to the wonderful staff!

:) 

Excellent food at Brick and Beams

review.title: Location, Location Location
review.reviewText:
This hotel's location is ideal for the visitor to San Francisco.  It's close to the Fisherman's Wharf and is a great place to start a walk to various parts of San Francisco. Staff is very friendly; rooms clean and updated with lots of USB charging ports, outlets for electronics and more.

The only part of the hotel that is a little odd is that the main lobby is one floor down from the entrance.
We were happy to be able to walk and get on the trolley car
review.negativeRemarks: No
review.locationRemarks: It was great

review.title: Very Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: We enjoyed this hotel. We travel a lot around the world. this hotel was in the middle of some really good restaurant's and within walking distance to some great sites. The staff was very pleasant. Check in a breeze. We will be back here when we come to San Francisco again. Thanks for making our holiday a great one!!

The hotel was ok. It probably needs an update, but at least it was clean and the bed was comfortable. There are paper thin walls between the rooms so it was quite noisy, especially at night. The location was good. Being within walking distance of the cable cars was good.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Renovated clean and quite rooms. Close to the pier and tourist attractions. Very comfortable. Will stay here agin.

review.title: Upscale Clean and Convenient
review.reviewText: A very nice hotel in such a beautiful city.  Our room was ready even though we arrived early. Attractive lobby and very nice room.  We didn't have much interaction with staff but the valet parking was very friendly and efficient.  No room view but that's not why we went to Frisco - to look at the city through glass.  Good shower and large room overall.
review.negativeRemarks: Pricey.  Especially parking at $58 a night.  But that's San Francisco; if you're looking for an economical vacation there are some out there.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf (of course) but there is also great dining nearby.  With the help of a friendly nearby merchant we discovered a great restaurant.

review.reviewText: This hotel is conveniently located on the Fisherman's Wharf.  The staff is available for questions, but be patient.  There are just a few of them, and they might be in high demand!
review.positiveRemarks: Can walk to several city attractions.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf.  Short drive to China Town.

review.title: Great hotel centrally located to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Great from arrival to check out.  Rooms were large with lots of convenient outlets and lighting.  Rain head shower was a bonus as was the Starbucks coffee.  Was near the street but heard no noises and slept like a baby.  Good price but it was through Expedia.  They also let us check out late and keep our vehicle in Valet parking for no additional costs.
review.positiveRemarks: Room size, comfort, friendly staff and location.
review.negativeRemarks: Correct information regarding Valet parking.  Expedia and hotel says $50.  However, at checkout they charged $59 plus a tax of $8.59.  Yikes!
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Coit Tower, Little Italy, Lombard street and if your energetic Union Square.  Also cable cars are close by.

review.title: Rooms are very small.
review.reviewText: Overall staff very professional. Facilities was reverently updated but room was very small with two beds. Overnight parking rate was highest in area and highest I have dealt with in 30 years of traveling but you do have limits.

review.title: Not what it was supposed to be.
review.reviewText: I've throne away better beds than what was in this room. Allergenic Free room? I don't think so. I will not be staying here again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Clean, great location, close to pier 39, restaurants, shopping, bike rentals, supermarket, laundry.. Very confortable ...

photos.caption: Best Irish Coffee in the U.S.!

review.title: In town for Dave Matthews on super Thursday
review.reviewText: Everything was fine except the charge for parking at $76 for one night. That was more expensive than my concert ticket. I get that's probably average for the city but I would have preferred knowing that at time of booking AND being able to pay when I paid for room. This was my first time using Expedia, so it kinda made me feel like it was shady not to have that ON the reservation. It was posted on the hotel website. When I booked the room, I didn't look at the website first. I was merely happy to find anything during Super Bowl weekend! I would stay there again as location is perfect!

review.title: Very rude front desk staff
review.reviewText: When I checked in, front desk was very rude. After a long flight that's the last thing I need checking into a hotel. They booked me into a room that was really far from the elevator and I booked "city view" . Once I got to the room, it was overlooking the gas station. I called up front desk and they basically yelled at me for trying to see if there was another room available and she tried to tell me that I was upgraded without being charged for that "view" room. I payed and booked for city view and it was horrible and very loud at the gas station. Front desk did nothing to try to change my room. HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE AND STAFF!

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: I stayed for 2 nights. The staff was very welcoming and the room was clean and comfortable!

review.title: Great hotel, great location!
review.reviewText: We did not use the amenities, however our room was clean, quiet, and comfortable. The location is wonderful! We walked to Starbucks which is directly next to the cable car turn and then walked to Fisherman's Wharf. Ghiradelli Square was walking distance (for healthy groups.). The staff was friendly and helpful.

review.title: Very convenient to fisherman's wharf.
review.reviewText: No real view here but a clean hotel with very friendly staff.  Close walking distance to fisherman's wharf, Giradelli, and the cable car line.
review.negativeRemarks: View but not going to happen.
review.locationRemarks: As above.

review.title: renovated hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is one of the best in the Fisherman¬¥s duarf area, there are many good restaurants and points of interest very close,
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast buffete for the proce could be better.
review.locationRemarks: Crossing the Street there are a very good breakfast restaurant, the Hollywood caf√©, Fisherman duarf and the Pier 39 are in a short walking distance.

review.title: Nice hotel good location very soft beds
review.reviewText: Clean rooms great location to get around the city friendly staff.  Only down was how soft the beds were.

review.title: A let down.
review.reviewText: I was disappointed with the room quality and price. The parking was charged but was not explained very well at booking. It was a disappointment.
review.negativeRemarks: You could let the client know they are getting bombed on parking.
review.locationRemarks: The wharf.

review.reviewText: Front desk staff was Great. Restaurant staff wasn't real friendly.
The hotel was really perfect, but my room key had to be changed a lot of times when I stayed in the hotel.

review.title: Perfect Location!
review.reviewText: The Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf hotel is located perfectly for the tourist!  It is walking distance to all the major pier sightseeing and to both of the cable car turn around stops.  The beds are super comfy and the room is nice and clean.  Courteous staff and easy check in are two more plusses.  I would stay here again on a future trip.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much
review.locationRemarks: See comments above.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Great location for walking too many areas of San Francisco

review.title: Hotel ok, region not so good
review.reviewText: The overall experience in the hotel was good, but there are much better places in San Francisco to choose, unless you like to be in a very touristic place, with crowds all around , cheap shops everywhere and those restaurants that you know will never be that good.

review.title: Great location but not typical Hyatt quality
review.reviewText: Overall a good stay with good location close to both touristy attractions and the rest of the city. Rooms were spacious and clean but mattress was a bit worn (even after they replaced it), no view from room to speak of, staff were helpful but not overly friendly, food at restaurant was quite good but I've had better mixed drinks at a college frat party, and paying $50 per night to park is a bit excessive even for SanFran.
review.negativeRemarks: Cocktails, mattresses, parking fees

review.title: Close to mayor tourist attractions, spacious room.
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hyatt Fishermans Wharf with our son. Nice king bed and rollaway bed was super comfy, very spacious room.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom door is one of those sliding doors that does not shut: privacy issue for us. Plus the shower leaked terribly flodded the entire bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf, Pier 39 (crepes are fabulous)  alcatraz tour, hop on off gray line bus tour. Madamme Toussaud wax museum. Cable car ride.

review.reviewText: I was there to celebrate my birthday.  Best location at Fisherman's Wraf!
Very nice hotel but staff were not the best. Reception was very slow and laundry/ice/vending room not very clean - floor was slippery and dirty. Room itself was very nice. No view - just a tree.

review.title: Great location!!!!
review.reviewText: Great location of the hotel with good  restaurants in walking distance.... And great place to walk and get to know the area! Major attractions very close !
Hotel needs better window  views for guests.  Windows face other windows of opposite hotel rooms.

review.title: Near to the shore
review.reviewText: It¬¥s a good hotel, very conviniently located in Fishermanwarf
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean, staff was very nice
review.negativeRemarks: not to charge for the parking
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to the shore, Girardeli square, and pier 39

managementResponses.response:
Greetings!

I am so pleased to hear your overall stay was great at Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf! We will be sure to thank and recognize our team member's for the awesome customer service. Look forward to having you back to this location.

Warm regards,
Drew D.-Guest Relations Associate

review.title: Great hotel to stay at while in SFO
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff are really nice. We love the location.

managementResponses.response:
Good Evening!

Happy to hear you really enjoyed our location and how convenient is was for your travels. We look forward to welcoming you back to Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf in the future.

Safe travels,
Drew D.-Guest Relations Associate

review.title: Fun Stay on Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel is within walking distance of the wharf and all the fun things to do there.  The concierge was very helpful in booking our bus tour of the city.  The business center was convenient.  It is expensive but for the location and convenience it is worth it for a holiday.

managementResponses.response:
Hello there!

I am so thrilled to hear about the great customer service you received at Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf. Thank you so much for giving us a 5 out of 5 on this review! We truly cannot wait to welcome you back soon!

Safe travels,
Drew D.-Guest Relations Associate

review.title: Beautiful hotel in walking distance of sightseeing
review.reviewText: The staff is very friendly. Rooms are very clean! If you need to workout out there is a great gym located in the hotel. But make sure you're aware that you have to use their valet parking if you bring a vehicle. Overall it's a great place to stay and you're near everything!

review.title: Fisherman Wharf Hyatt
review.reviewText:
Hotel was clean and staff was friendly.
My issue is the bathroom setup. Maybe it was a little too modern for my husband and myself. The bathroom doors were two doors slid together, they did not close all the way. The shower head is located on the ceiling and I could not reach to adjust it. It just came straight down. You had to be inside the shower to the shower to turn it on and adjust the water temp. I prefer adjusting the water before I step in.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was perfect for us
review.negativeRemarks: Redo the bathroom setup
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is in walking distance. Easy to catch a bus to where ever you need

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
Bed was too soft hurt my back , double bed too small get queen size if you are not small children..  great location but no parking. 
Hotel valet 50 per day close to shops and restaurants overall I will come back again but need bigger bed and firm mattress ; valet staff needs better system  to get cars in and out.

review.title: Perfect place to stay.
review.reviewText: This lovely hotel was close to the water and pier 39. Lovely restaurant.  Service was excellent and the rooms were comfortable and extremely clean.  Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: More positives than negatives
review.reviewText: Wonderful staff! From the parking valets to the hosts at registration to the housekeeping staff.  The food at the Ward was great, especially Salmon Frittata and Crab Cake Benedict...the wait staff super fast, but not much personality and the plates are literally flying and clanging onto the table.  The night noise is a little annoying and the adjoining room noise was a slight problem, but nothing that the Hyatt could correct. Overall, great location and good rates.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff made a good reason to want to come back.
review.negativeRemarks: The Ward waitresses are hard working, but not very personable.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to the Ghiradelli and all the wharf activities.  One pleasant, and quirky surprise was the Musee Mecanique...

review.reviewText: Didn't have any issues. It was a nice hotel to stay at.

nice staff; room felt clean & new; fancy smart TV; very close to Fisherman's Wharf; has an outdoor pool on the 3rd floor; ~30 minutes' walk from Montgomery St BART station if one takes Montgomery St and then Columbus Ave -- a good walk (passing by City Light Bookstore, lots of restaurants, the 'Italian Tunnel', and Chinatown).

review.title: One of the best hotels I have stayed in
review.reviewText: Rooms were wonderful and employees great. Valet was quick.

review.title: Nice hotel great location
review.reviewText: Everyone very friendly & helpful. Walked to Fisherman's Wharf. Close to Cable Car.
The staff was extremely accommodating and helpful. I also like the Pure allergen-free rooms. Rooms are very nice and modern. The only downfall was the outrageously expensive parking at $57/day!
review.positiveRemarks: Pure allergen free and modern rooms. Staff extremely helpful and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is outrageously expensive at $57/day.

review.title: Nice hotel next to fisherman wharf and pier 39
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, clean rooms, great bar, bartender,  great food

review.title: nice location by wharf
review.reviewText: we had a nice stay close to wharf and not to far from little Italy and China town. we like to do a little walking (so much easier than driving) the hotel staff was pleasant and helpful. noise was not a problem. Safeway right next door which is nice if you need anything. all in all we had a very pleasant stay
review.negativeRemarks: not anything i noticed
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans wharf, cable cars, not far from anything really if you enjoy being on that side of town. different than Union Square area

review.title: Nice hotel and great staff
review.reviewText: The staff from valet to check in host were very friendly. The manager Charles was great and friendly!

review.title: Nice hotel but wish they had more amenities.
review.reviewText: Positive and great location but wish they had more amenities.

managementResponses.response:
Greetings!

We appreciate you writing a review on Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf. We are thrilled you feel comfortable and find our location so convenient for your travels. Thank you for your feedback, we look forward to welcoming you back on your next trip to San Francisco.

Warm regards,

review.title: Near everything
review.reviewText: I love this hotel, makes you feel confortable about everything, nice valet, nice people at the front desk, two block to fisherman wharf, The valet parking expensive... 50 bucks too much..

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your feedback.   We are glad to hear you had a great stay.

review.reviewText: The location was perfect. We were able to walk to restaurants and shops.

Nice clean hotel.  Staff not really friendly.  Seems to be busy with meetings and events and not focused on the everyday guests. No real concierge only someone from a tour company pushing their tours only.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to attractions
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, close to tourist attractions, transportation and restaurants. Friendly staff with the attitude to HELP.
review.negativeRemarks: Free breakfast.

review.title: Close to Everything
review.reviewText: Within walking distance to the action of San Fran.
Lost my Provape P3, still don't know if it was picked up, in it's box as trash or what, but that was the only negative and I'm not thinking that is really a complaint point regarding the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: It's on the Wharf.

review.title: Great walking distance to wharf
review.reviewText:
Nice modern hotel, good location to fishermans wharf. No view but quiet and convenient. Very friendly staff. 
Only one problem we had was the bath tub had hair stuck in the drain, so that was very gross when I went to give my daughter a bath.

review.title: close to fisherman's Warf
review.reviewText: excellent accommodations!!!!! I left the nasty poorly run devinci hotel to be closer to a beautiful new looking Hyatt hotel and actually paid LESS!! Im very happy I found the hyatt even if i lost 2 days at that other joke of a hotel. The staff was professional and they have a very nice bar on site. I will stay here if i visit the city again.
review.locationRemarks: bars bay and shopping

review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. Amazingly helpful hotel staff and well located.

review.title: Not a good hotel or location.
review.reviewText:
We had drain flies in the shower and we had to move rooms in the middle of the night. After some persuasion we were not charged for our first nights stay.

On the morning of our departure we were woken by hotel employees prote(sting outside the hotel!

Pleasant hotel in Fishermans wharf. I liked being able to walk long the public areas and see the bay, alacatraz, the golden gate bridge and coit tower. Lots of transportation options so a car really is not needed.  Staff were cheerful and helpful. My only issue was with the room itself. The fan for the AC was loud and relentless. The windows did not open. The doors to the bathroom looked as if something had scratched them trying to get out. A nightlight is needed in the bathroom.

review.title: It was the worst $500 hotel I've ever been to.
review.reviewText: It is not worth that much. Diffently not a 4 star hotel. Beds are the worst a 2 star hotel hav better beeding  than them.

review.title: Hop & a Skip from everything.
review.reviewText: You can walk to the ocean, Fisherman's Wharf, bike rentals, sight seeing tours and Lombard Street. Check out the restaurant across the street for breakfast. We found out when we where leaving it is a great place with huge portions for a bowl of fruits. Get there early; was always a line ~~they open at 6:00 am. People protesting come Sat morning to wake you up. It starts at 7:00 am. I was already up but they do not stop yelling and they walk around and around the hotel. It's a small group but they are loud. Their protest was in regards to the Union.
review.positiveRemarks: The pool is great and private and warm. Very clean. Request the 3rd floor and you will be on the same level of the pool.
review.negativeRemarks: Work with the protesters, although we never complained they were loud. Feed the homeless people who were sleeping on the str. across from the Hyatt !!
review.locationRemarks: So many things to do. Rent a bike is a must. We rode to the Ferry building. Thjis is a mall type setting very open and busy. Al the with food and thig

review.title: lovely hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel was clean, comfortable and spacious.
The staff were polite and helpful. 
The beds were super comfy. 
Location was very central and price was good considering the above. 

Loved the fruit infused waters each day in the lobby. 

Good clean gym and pools too.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe keep the pool open a little later?
review.locationRemarks: The wharf is a short walk which has pier 39 close. A little bit further down the road there is the pier for alcatraz. A short walk to lombard street.

review.title: Room Smelled Like Smoke
review.reviewText: First let me say that my hotel review is based on the fact that this was a *very* expensive room.  Had it not cost nearly $500/night I might not be so critical.  The first thing I noticed about the room was that it smelled like smoke.  Heavily like smoke.  So much so that I immediately called the front desk to let them know - just to make sure that we weren't charged for smoking in the room.  The hotel has a good location and the room was clean and the staff was friendly.

As soon as we went in our room, it was very stuffy because the AC wasn't running. We had to call the hotel maintenance to have it fixed. They left with a dirty air filter with dust remains on the floor. No cleaning staff came to vacuum the mess.

Also, it was very noisy ... toilet flushing from upstairs, street noise, and refrigerator noise.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise proof windows.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: stayed one night...was in a good location to walk all over Fisherman's Wharf.
review.locationRemarks: All things Fisherman's Wharf, Ghriardelli Square.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: Very nice staff. They were all very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. They do have coffee in the room. The only thing I wasn't fond of was once they took your car you had to get the valet to get what you wanted out of your vehicle. You also had to pay $57.00 a night to park there but I guess that is the price to pay to keep your car safe! Was a very nice place to stay and I would stay there again. Very convenient location also!

review.title: Great hotel everything in walking distance!
review.reviewText: Loved that we could walk to the wharf, ghirardelli square, pier 39 have a Irish coffee at the Buena Vista and fantastic crab cakes at Scomas. Would stay here again staff was very professional  and courteous .

review.title: Not Relaxing
review.reviewText: We have stayed at the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf several times.  The Hotel is clean and close to many things.  Unfortunately, we had the worst weekend experience (9/25/15-9/27/15).  For starters every morning at 7 AM we were awakened by a group of union picketers with a bull horn telling us to "Boycott the Hyatt" and "No peace for customers".  Next, after a nice evening out, as we are snuggling into bed, the hotel alarm alerted us to a fire emergency- we needed to vacate the hotel through the stairwells. We left our room, followed the other guests in search of the fire exit only to run into a maid who was clueless as to where the stairs were located.  Eventually we made our way to the lobby and told it was a false alarm, return to our room.  We returned to our room (3rd floor) climbed back into bed only to have the alarm go off again 20 minutes later.  This time we were able to get out much faster. We stood outside for another 15-20 minutes before the fire department gave the official "all clear".  Of course the next morning the boycotting bull horn returned at 7 AM.  Upon check out we spoke with the desk manager who was less than sympathetic telling us the Hotel has been picketed for the last 5 years (We have stayed here several times already and never witnessed any picket line).  As a peace offering the desk manager waived our valet parking fee. We were greatly disappointed by the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf.
review.positiveRemarks: The remodeled rooms were very visually pleasing.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff should be familiar with emergency exits, and sympathetic to customers comfort.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf has many things to offer and all within a short walk from the hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: We usually stay at another hotel chain but they were full this past weekend so we stayed at the Hyatt.  From now on, we will be staying at the Hyatt because of the modern rooms.  The hotel is a couple blocks away from the other hotel but is in the same general area.
review.negativeRemarks: More bathrooms in the lobby.  You have to go to the conference area.  There isn't any restrooms in the restaurant/bar.

review.title: AMAZING!!!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the hotel from Sept 24th thru Sept 26th.  This hotel is located at the best spot in Fisherman's Warf.  The Hollywood Cafe across the street is a must have as well.  The Chia Latte and crab omelet are outstanding.  If you are trying to make a decision on where to stay the Hyatt is a great decision.

review.title: Nice Hotel 2 Blocks from Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel but over-priced for its amenities. I'm sure it's because it's close to Fisherman's Wharf, but next time I would stay elsewhere and pay less. We did have a large room and were very comfortable. The a/c worked well considering San Francisco was experiencing unusually hot weather.  The room seemed clean except the comforter on our bed had obviously not been washed since we found makeup on it and a small pen drawing (like graffiti.). However they did replace it our request. There was also obvious mold or grunge buildup in the tile grout in parts of the shower.  Check-in was relatively quick considering there were at least 6 groups ahead of us checking in. Our room was not ready yet since we were an hour ahead of check-in time but we were able to leave our bags there while we walked around and they called us probably 30 mins later to let us know it was ready. Valet parking was quick but when we first pulled up it was confusing since there are no clear signs and cars were filling all the parking spots. Rate was average for a large city but final bill showed additional fees. Be sure to ask what the total rate will be!  I don't recommend this hotel only because of the price.

review.title: Amazing, close to everything
review.reviewText: We had an amazing few nights. The room was incredibly spacious and even being a street view, the noise was minimal. Will definitely be back, highly recommend!

review.title: Very convenient hotel!
review.reviewText: The hotel is very near to fisherman's wharf and there are many eateries nearby. Hollywood cafe is one of the most popular with very long queues during breakfast hours. The hotel is also very near to the hop-on hop-off bus tour stops.
review.locationRemarks: hop on, hop off bus tours

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: This hotel is located at walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Ghirardelli plaza, and many other great tourist attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive parking rate.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of great places to explore at a short distance from this hotel, including Golden Gate bridge, Downtown, Cable cars, Sausalito, etc.

review.title: Did Not Get the Room We Booked and Paid For
review.reviewText:
Booked for one night well in advance through Expedia. There happened to be a convention in town and we believe theses guests must have received preference over our booking. We booked a room with one king-size bed and a courtyard view. At reception they had a problem even finding our booking and we ended up with a room which had two double beds at ground level with the sidewalk right outside our room. The bath surface was totally scuffed up and the room very badly appointed. 

We were told that the going rate for this room was roughly half of what we had paid but they refused to give us any kind of refund (except free parking for the night) saying we would have to take it up with Expedia. We did manage to get a small refund from Expedia but someone has made a lot of money from us. Live and learn!

review.title: Beautiful hotel..close to fishermans wharf
review.reviewText:
This is a great hotel I recommend to anyone..
Very close to fishermans wharf. ..

review.title: Perfect stay in absolute must location
review.reviewText:
booked a king bed room but unfortunately had non available and booked into 2 queen room, but comped our parking for whole stay (50 per day) without batting an eyelid.
Friendly and helpful and location of hotel perfect.
review.locationRemarks: fisherman's wharf - golden gate bridge - san Francisco - enough said.

review.title: Excellent location.
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel to stay. Staff were friendly and always willing to help. Rooms were clean and hotel was well kept up. There was nothing negative to say about our stay. Would stay again without hesitation. Walking to distance to everything you need for your stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Clean & worth the extra money over a 2 or 3 star.
review.reviewText: Paid a bit extra for this hotel, but it was located in a nice section of the city. Peace of mind and security were at hand. Complimentary coffee in the room, to boot!

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText:
WIthin walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go in Fisherman's Wharf.  Short taxi ride to downtown.
Hotel was clean and staff was great.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf has so many things to offer, all within walking distance

review.title: Great hotel in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: Updated, clean and sharp rooms.  If you want to stay in Fisherman's Wharf this is a nice place to stay.  Enjoyable whether you're a family, couple, friends, etc.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Hotel was very close to the wharf, so very easy to catch the ferry to Sausalito, right across the street from the tour buses.
review.negativeRemarks: everything was great
review.locationRemarks: Right across from the tour bus pickup; Hollywood Diner (great for breakfast.

review.title: I do not recommend staying at this Hyatt property
review.reviewText: I will probably not stay at this specific Hyatt property again. The rooms are terrible for projecting sound through walls. Clear conversations are heard through doors and walls. Toilets flushing and showers running are a constant annoyance. Not to mention the power was constantly going out on our floor due to wiring issues in the building. I found on more than one occasion staff membes seemed quite unhappy. The treatment by certain staff was well below the standard of other Hyatt properties I have visited. I noticed a flight attendant who was very unhappy with their service as well. Without going into to much detail, I would suggest finding a different hotel in the area of you plan on staying near fishermans warf.
The hotel was very nice and comfortable. The location was perfect being only a couple of blocks from pier 39 was very convenient.

review.title: Very nice hotel, excellent staff
review.reviewText: Staff outstanding, especially bellhop who had been there 24 years. one thing I found irritating was 2 bottles of water with a note saying refresh and then in tiny tiny letters $5. odd placement of toilet paper?   Refrigerator door open opposite of the cabinet door it was in.

review.title: Good location to visit Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We stayed there three nights. Hotel was only two blocks from the wharf, but far enough away to avoid the noise.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to the wharf and it was upscale. Near tour pick up (Grey Line) across the street.
review.locationRemarks: It's on Fisherman's Wharf, so there is plenty to see and do. There was a nice restaurant open for breakfast right cross the street.

review.title: Good location but terrible experience
review.reviewText: Very poor experience,  reached there around 10 pm and had my reservation through expedia, at the counter the staff was not even ready to entertain us. Rooms were small and did not have many amenities like microwave or iron..it was a complete turn off...i guess it was my first and last booking experience with expedia.

review.title: Easy go to fishman's wharf
review.reviewText: SF is such pretty city ,and nice weather .I will bring my family  visit again because We still have a lot place don't  have time to see.
review.negativeRemarks: Provided free bottle waterbradley

review.title: Comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: We've stayed in this hotel before and have been happy with the rooms and staff. Clean and well maintained. Close to the Wharf and cable cars as well as Ghirardelli Square

review.title: Nice hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: We liked that the room was large and updated to include modern conveniences. The hotel staff were so helpful - giving us great recommendations and helping with any issues. The entire staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome. We loved the location as we were near to Fisherman's Wharf and North Beach. We love to walk so we walked to AT&T Stadium, through China town, and to Union Square from this location. Our only disappointment was the restaurant attached to the hotel. The staff at the restaurant were not friendly and were even cranky. After our first visit to the restaurant, we just went into North Beach for meals and dessert. So many choices and such great food, coffee, and bakeries!

review.title: Conveniently located near the Warf
review.reviewText: Courteous and accommodating valet staff.  Hotel clean. Easy check in and out. Expensive. Noisy air conditioner. Bed somewhat uncomfortable. Pillows great.

review.title: Very nice location, but very dirty hotel
review.reviewText:
The shower curtains are very very dirty üòñ
The first day, they not clean my room. I have to call them twice, and finally they clean it @ 6:00 pm.
Very bad experience!!!
