review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Front desk staffs not friendly, parking fee is extremely expensive $50 per nite . Room is ok and shower is not too clean. The hotel location is great - two blocks from fishermen wharf.

review.title: Hotel that is close to all
review.reviewText: Overal a nice facility.  Only complaint is that the beds were not as comfortable as other facilities that I have stayed in.

review.title: Convenient location to the fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: A recently refurbished hotel so it was clean. Would have been useful if there was more cupboard for storage. It's a minus without a microwave which made life a little harder when children wanted to warm some food etc....The reason we choice this hotel was because it had a pool and a spa. But the pool was freezing cold so we couldn't swim and the spa was very small so we really didn't make use of these facilities. Price wise I would say it's on the expensive side and we really didn't get what we paid for compared to some other hotels.

review.title: Close to tourist attractions
review.reviewText: Experience was ok but the room was very dusty...  Everywhere you look there was alot of dust as if the room was not cleaned for weeks...

review.title: Not what we expected
review.reviewText: This was not the Hyatt experience I expected. I stayed at the Hyatt in San Diego earlier the same week and it was fantastic. This Hyatt was not as well manicured and the staff was not friendly nor attentive. We will not stay here again.

review.title: Well situated close to the Wharf
review.reviewText:
The staff were very welcoming from the start - after a long flight from London you need it. No hanging around either. 
Great room with most of the mod cons ( no kettle or tea just a coffee maker )
Staff all were pleasant and seemed happy enough which is all you can ask
review.positiveRemarks: Nice hotel. Decent facilities. Water is a bit expensive
review.negativeRemarks: Not overcharge for water - $5 per bottle in room
review.locationRemarks: Close - but not too close - to the Wharf. Close to piers and boat trips. A cable car turntable is round the corner

review.title: The hotel is in the heart of Fisherman's Warf.
review.reviewText: The entire family was very happy with the hotel. It was clean, nicely renovated, and every staff member was very friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: The location puts you in the heart of Fisherman's Warf. The hotel is just two blocks from the water.

review.title: Terrible Experience and Fraud charges.
review.reviewText:
After I came home I found an additional charges on my credit card. I called hotel but Accounting Manager cannot even explain what is it. In additional he was very rude. Check your credit card charged after leave the hotel.
Never back again in this hotel.
Pier 39 have a lot better hotels around.
Nice hotel. Good location. Too expensive! That includes the breakfast in the lobby. Save yourself a little money and head to one of the many Starbucks locations.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel was great, room was nice, and comfortable. Don't waste your time paying to eat at the restaurants in the hotel, venture out in the Wharf for food, better food options and not ridiculously overpriced.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: We stayed for 4 nights with 3 adults and a 15 year old. It was much more expensive than any other trip we've taken but it was great to be so close to Fisherman's Wharf with easy access to cable cars, street cars, and buses. Many sights within walking distance including Pier 39, Coit Tower, Lombard Street, and Pier 33 (where Alcatraz tours leave). The staff was very friendly and helpful. I understand parking can be a problem, $50/night for valet parking, but we took a shuttle from the airport and didn't feel we needed a car.
review.negativeRemarks: Double beds were narrow but comfortable.

review.title: Convenient location.
review.reviewText: Good location. Disappointed that I did notget Hyatt points for this day. Didn't think this was up to the quality of other Hyatts I've stayed at

managementResponses.response:
Good Afternoon,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback from your stay at Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf. I am sorry you felt the rate was too high with no breakfast. I am glad to hear you were able to enjoy the attractions in the area.

Safe Travels!

Anne
Guest Relations Associate

review.title: Very Expensive. No breakfast included.
review.reviewText: Very expensive stay for no breakfast included, not even coffee. There are other hotels very near by for less expensive breakfast included. Pool was cold and closes promptly at 9pm. Fishermans warf was nice however the executive area was nicer hotels still near all attractions .

review.title: Nice hotel but horrible air conditioning units.
review.reviewText: Nice location of hotel. Very friendly staff. Clean rooms but horrible air conditioning units. They are individual units in the room located next to the bed. You can hear the compressor and fan going on all night.

review.title: Great location; easy access to everywhere
review.reviewText: Polite and courteous staff, quick check in and check out. Very clean and very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

review.reviewText: Nice location. Very pricey with no complimentary coffee or breakfast, but I guess that's what you get in California on Fishermans Warf.

managementResponses.response:
Hello!

Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback! We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed the cleanliness of the property and the spacious accommodations. We look forward to welcoming you back again soon!

Safe Travels,

Sarah
Guest Relations Associate

review.title: I will always come back!
review.reviewText: Can't say enough about this hotel. Clean, conveniently located, clean, well appointed, clean, spacious. Oh, and did I mention how clean it was?

managementResponses.response:
Hello!

I appreciate the time you have taken to share your feedback! I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed the hotel's location and the helpful service from the hotel staff. I hope we can welcome you back again soon!

Safe travels,

Sarah D.
Guest Relations Associate

review.title: Wife's first trip to San Fran
review.reviewText: Close to Wharf, a car rental, a coffee shop and a Safeway for convenience. We walked just about every where except the boat to Sausalito (a couple blocks away excursion) and the trolleys.  Staff were helpful and always nice.
review.locationRemarks: See experience above.

review.reviewText: I had called prior to our visit to ask for a room with 2 double beds instead of a king bed. They told me there were no rooms available to make the change. A little while later, I was standing at the desk and heard/watched a couple of people come in and check in...without a reservation and request a room with double beds for the same amount of time I was staying and they got it. Poor at best!

review.title: close to tourist hot spots
review.reviewText: Conveniently located in Fisherman's Wharf, walking distance to all major SF attractions.  Hyatt staff were phenomenal!!  Extremely helpful in advice on navigating the city, attractions.  Disappointed room was so-so.  Bed was uncomfortable.  Asked upon booking reservation about getting a fold-out bed.  Was told no reservations could be takend but shouldn't be a problem when checking in.  Well, we couldn't get a fold-out bed and were told they were all pre-booked, so sleeping was "tight."  Room cleanliness not as great as one would expect when paying so much $$ a night.  Most everything in San Francisco is expensive, so hotel food no different.  Had breakfast buffet one day- definitely not worth $23.50 a plate.  Had a small refrigerator but couldn't get a microwave.  Again, staff were excellent- so friendly and helpful.  Overall accommodations were mediocre.
review.negativeRemarks: Additional beds- more than king beds available for family reservations.

managementResponses.response:
Hello!

Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback! We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed the service from hotel staff and the hotel's location. We look forward to welcoming you back again soon!

Safe Travels,

Sarah
Guest Relations Associate

review.title: Excellent location!
review.reviewText:
We stayed for 2 nights and had an exceptional visit.  We did have a mishap where the valet hung one of our bags awkwardly off the luggage cart and broke the handle.  We contacted the manager when we realized it was broken and he bent over backwards to make it right.  He had their seamstress re-attach the handle/strap and gave us a complimentary breakfast for both mornings for all four of us.  The staff handled the situation very professionally and the seamstress re-attached the strap to the point where you couldn't tell it had been broken.  We were told the pool was heated, but it was not.  They do have a hot tub by the pool, the kids loved it!
The location was so close to everything that we left the car parked and walked to Pier 39 and other areas of interest on that side of town.  Lot's of options for going out to eat in the area within walking distance.

review.title: Very convenient.
review.reviewText: Rooms clean. Bed not comfortable. Concierge Matt didn't book my shuttle to airport correctly. But, close to everything.  If you're going to spend most of your time out of the room this place will do.
Great location.  Very comfortable rooms, friendly staff.  Pool and hot tub were great.

review.title: Close to some attractions.
review.reviewText: Everything was generally ok. The only negative was the bed. Very uncomfortable. Could not sleep through the night from the terrible back ache.
review.negativeRemarks: Finish your construction!!!
review.locationRemarks: Close to the piers, public transportation.

review.reviewText: The rooms were not clean and when I paid for late check out I had to ask them twice to come and change the towels and clean the bathroom!

Windows transfer sound from the steet. The small things at the hotel are missing; towel bars, toilet paper holder away from toilet, no glass in bathroom, can not turn the water in the shower without getting wet, STC value of the windows and corridor make the room noisy.

review.title: Parking is a problem
review.reviewText: I don't believe you should tell a handicap person to walk a block and a half and have to carry their luggage because the lot is full.  It took me calling the hotel, and getting a different doorman to take my car for me, so I could check in.  The first man didn't even offer to hold the luggage so that it wouldn't have to be carried.  The hotel staff was very helpful and polite.
review.negativeRemarks: Teach courtesy to parking people and improve on your valet service.  At $50/night it should be good.
review.locationRemarks: Not near anything I planned on doing.

review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed in this hotel while visiting San Francisco and it was well-appointed, clean, modern and very near all the action at Fisherman's Wharf. The staff were pretty friendly and the valet attendees were very polite. The Brick and Beam restaurant next door was lovely to relax in and sip a nice glass of wine or grab a bite to eat.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were very clean and spacious and had modern d√©cor. The hotel was in a very central location.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of shops and restaurants nearby, the hotel is located a few streets from the waterfront, on a quieter street which is nice.

review.title: Great location to fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: Outstanding staff and and we'll above average for dining with a good sports bar!
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to fisherman's wharf and transit.

review.title: Close to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText:
We moved to the Hyatt after checking out of another hotel that was not satisfactory.  The Hyatt is only 2 blocks from the Wharf and we had an excellent stay.  The staff was helpful and courteous, with one going out of her way to help us print boarding passes.  They have a large pull-in (which is great around the Wharf as it's challenging to find parking) and the lobby area is huge with seating and a fireplace.

Great fitness room with cooled towels.  The rooms were nicely appointed and quiet - we never heard anyone outside the room or other doors closing.

Great hotel - would definitely stay again.

review.title: Not a Hyatt
review.reviewText: We had dirty plates from someone's room service sit outside our room for 3 days!!

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for expressing your positive feedback regarding your stay at the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf, CA. We are grateful to hear that you enjoyed your stay due to the fact that the rooms were clean and comfortable and to the excellent service provided by our friendly staff . Your kind comments were forwarded to the Executive management at the hotel. Hope to welcoming you again in the near future.

Johny E.-A Guest Relations Associate

review.reviewText: Very friendly staff! The rooms are very modern and clean! I definitely enjoyed my stay here!

review.title: Nice Hotel, No parking!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with Hyatt quality. Room is clean and comfortable. But the Memorial weekend stay without Valet Parking at hotel really make me not happy. I have to park away from hotel in a parking garage. Even it is only a 5 to 10 minutes walk, but you have to drive to the garage on Saturday afternoon with unfamiliar streets, just not a good experience. Plus, I am willing to pay the $50 Valet. I do not know if other hotel has better parking plan, I was not impressed when Hyatt told me that "We have only 80 spaces and 300 rooms. That is really not my problem. Any way, I will try other hotel next time on my annual trip to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice and comfortable room, excellent location.
review.negativeRemarks: Figure out hoe to have all guest Valet Parking!!!
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fish man's Wharf, A lot of restaurants and shopping.

review.title: Great location, comfortable rooms, ltd amenities
review.reviewText: While they advertised onsite parking, it was incredibly limited and we were directed to a parking lot a couple of blocks away. They also didn't share that they were under construction... which really only impacted the front desk / lobby area so you had to carry your luggage up and down stairs since that was the only way to enter the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location. And the rooms were comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking and construction
review.locationRemarks: Lots of options to choose from

review.title: Maid service was horrible. Overpriced.
review.reviewText: Dirty towels refolded and put back. Did not leave requests made for extra coffee or towels. Uncomfortable beds. Shower was dirty. Maids did very little, just pulled covers up from what I could tell. Told us $50 parking. We were able to park on street for free at night. Meters are from 9am to 7pm. Don't fall for the $50.

review.title: $50 parking
review.reviewText: this wasn't New York, settle down. Stafff was cordial, restaurant was in the same building and the service was excellent

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for being our recent return guest at Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf. We greatly appreciate your recommendation of our hotel. Glad to know you find our staff friendly and professional, too.

We look forward to your next stay so you can see our exciting new updates firsthand.

Safe travels,

Julie B--Hyatt Guest Relations

review.title: Hotel was under a remodel, otherwise 5 Stars
review.reviewText: We have stayed here in the past, and will stay here again. The location is perfect for access to the Fisherman's Wharf area. The hotel itself was undergoing a remodel during our stay. This was a surprise to us, but did not really impact our stay. The staff are exceptionally friendly and professional. They cater to your every need. The rooms are very comfortable, and if I could figure out how to sneak the mattress home I would. If you are planning a trip to San Francisco, and plan to stay in the Fisherman's Wharf area, I would highly recommend the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: Alerting customers to the construction going on at the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Central to activities at Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This was our first trip to San Francisco and the hotel came recommended by a friend.  It is in a great location, just a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf.  The problem was that it was being renovated during our stay so there were painters and construction crew everywhere.  There was no guest parking for your car so you have to use the Concierge Service for $50.00/day.  The restaurant was only accessible from the outside and around the other side of the hotel and it wasn't that good.  Our air conditioner didn't work either so we had to have the window open and listen to the outside noise all night.  We tried to move to a different room but they were sold out.  The hotel staff were very friendly.  They did try to do the best they could with the conditions of the renovations.

should have been told when we booked that renovation works were in progress ,even when we arrived no one said that we would be woken in the morning by workmen drilling into the walls in adjoing rooms , very poor management their.also cleaners didn't dust anything in our room very lazy

review.title: NOISE
review.reviewText: Windows did not insulate any noise from outside.  Sounded like cars going through the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Better sound proof windows

review.title: Hotel is under renovation and not very welcoming.
review.reviewText: The hotel is strangely placed in the city.  It is hard to find the entrance, but once you do, it is a very disappointing.  The lobby is almost non-existent.  I would not stay here again.  It was over priced and so-so.
review.negativeRemarks: It needs to be better marked for easier access.  I understand that they are renovating to make it better, but it needs a bar and restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: IT was very convenient to the Wharf and restaurants.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText:
The hotel is under construction and there was no advisory at the reservation site. I have a sick son, so walking to the room, to the lobby, to the restaurant was very hard because it had detours all
over the hotel due to construction. I would like to request a compensation for the stay, it is not fair, not being advised that it is under construction when you reserve it. You should have advised us, it has been under construction for a year, they told me. it is not fair all they made us walk.

review.title: Under remodelation really noise l couldn't sleep
review.reviewText: Under remodelation dusty and noise. They performe day and night the construction and do not allow guest sleep. Was a nightmare

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,

I sincerely appreciate that you have taken the time to provide feedback regarding your recent stay. I am so sorry to hear that you were not advised of the level of construction going on in the hotel. I am also sorry to hear that the housekeeping staff serviced your guestroom too early. Please know that I will be in contact with the hotel's executive management team to further address your concerns and to ensure that future guests do not share the same experience.

I would certainly like to welcome you back in the near future so that you may experience the completed renovations and the service that is indicative of Hyatt.

SIncerely,
Emma S.
Guest Relations Associate

review.reviewText: The hotel totally undersold how much construction was going on. That being the case, the price point was ridiculous. Also, the cleaning service came way too early every day.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,

I appreciate that you have taken the time to provide feedback regarding your recent stay at the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf. I am pleased to hear that you enjoyed your newly renovated room, but I am sorry to hear about the air conditioner that did not work. I certainly understand any frustration you had regarding the ongoing construction.

Please know that I will be in contact with the hotel's executive management team to further address your concerns. We certainly look forward to welcoming you back in the future.

Sincerely,
Emma S.
Guest Relations Associate

review.reviewText: Excellent location and staff.  Room was newly renovated but renovations were on-going in other rooms and throughout the hotel. Front entrance of hotel was closed so we had to enter and leave from the the side entrance.  There were a set of stairs at the entrance that we had to carry the stroller up and down.  The staff was very willing to help when they were available.  A/C in room did not work very well but the windows opened to allow for cool air to come in so it wasn't a big deal.  Rooms were clean.  We would stay here again.  Overall it was a great vacation!

review.title: AWFUL - Hotel is under construction.  DO NOT STAY
review.reviewText: This is likely a fine hotel...WHEN IT IS NOT UNDER CONSTRUCTION!  Can't park your car, check in is in a meeting room, the noise from the construction is all day long, we had to wait 1/2 hour to get our car when we left, no place to buy anything to eat or drink, no lobby, no entrance, no self parking.  Right now it is a NIGHTMARE.  Shame on Expedia for representing this location as a 4 star experience.
Everyone was helpful and great. The parking is way too expensive but there's no other option so that the guest has no choice but to pay the $50/night.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,

Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback regarding your recent stay at the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf. I am sorry to hear that you found the hotel pricey and the communication lacking in regards to the parking. I also understand you frustration regarding the construction. Please know that I will be in contact with the hotel's executive management team in an effort to address your concerns and to ensure that future guests do not share the same experience.

Sincerely,
Emma S.
Guest Relations Associate

review.title: Too expensive for what you get
review.reviewText: Way too pricey for a hotel under construction   Poor communication about parking. Hard to access

review.title: Great accommodations
review.reviewText: Staff had excellent customer service! Very friendly and accommodating! The only downside was construction during our stay but I know it will be beautiful once complete!

review.title: Good location but construction made it hard
review.reviewText: The construction made it very difficult to check in.  There was only one valet parking worker, and with very little to non existent parking in front of the temporary entrance made it very stressful.

review.title: Construction
review.reviewText: Wish it was advised that the hotel was under construction. Workers were working during business hours, 8-6pm so there was constant noise going on

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The hotel was under renovation. Signs were not clearly visible. Getting to room was not very convenient to reach.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: A great location and close to everything... Cable cars, wharf, & Ghiradelli Square! They are in the middle of renovations and check in is in a conference room and we had to park 2 blocks away because valet was full... A bummer!

review.title: SPRING BREAK VOCATION
review.reviewText: IT WAS MY GRANDDAUGHTER SPRING BREAK AND WE WENT IN SAN FRANCISO IN HAYTT FISHERMANS' WHARF. THIS IS THE FIRST TIME WE'VE STAYED IN THIS HOTEL, BUT IT IS OUR 6TH VISIT IN SF. THE HOTEL DID NOT MEET MY EXPECTATION FOR A 4 STAR, THERE WAS A CONSTRUCTION GOING ON IN THE HOTEL AND IT WAS NOISY, PLUS WE HAD TO WALK LONG HALLS WITH A LUGGAGE UNTIL WE CAME TO THE ELEVATOR AND THE ELEVATORS WERE SHAKY EVERY TIME. OTHERWISE THE ROOM WAS CLEAN, THE HOUSKEEPING STAFF IS VERY PLEASANT, THE FRONT DESK CLERKS WERE POLITE BUT WHEN YOU CALL ON THE PHONE AND REQUEST CERTAIN SERVICE THEY FORGET ABOUT THAT, DO NOT PROBABLY RIGHT DOWN THE ROOM NO. OR SO, WHICH IS NOT SUPPOSED TO BE LIKE THAT FOR A  4 STAR HOTEL. THE LOCATION IS GREAT, CLOSE TO EVERYTHING. IN ANY EVENT WE HAD GREAT TIME, THE WEATHER WAS VERY NICE AND PLEASANT.
review.positiveRemarks: MOSTLY THE LOCATION AND CLEN ROOMS.
review.negativeRemarks: FRONT DESK STAFF SERVICE TO BE IMPROVED.
review.locationRemarks: LOCATION IS THE BEST IN FISHERMANS' WHARF.

review.title: Hotel is under renovation now. Awkward entrance.
review.reviewText: Room was ok but bad valet experience. Close to everything but wouldn't have stayed there had I know renovations were underway.

review.title: Location was great.
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel was fabulous. Great proximity to everything on and around the wharf & piers. The major renovation it was undergoing was not great. I wasn't aware of the renovation when I booked, so it was a major inconvenience. I had to drive around the block 2 times just to figure out where the valet was when I arrived. The staff was very nice & comp'd my parking for the 3 days I stayed. That was a plus. The rooms were typical, very starkly decorated. I just wasn't comfortable, so for the cost it wasn't worth it. There were so many other hotels right around it, so I wish I had stayed elsewhere.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very convenient for walking to all of the shops, resturants and the piers.
They are currently renovating, so the entrance was blocked and there was no direct inside access to getting to the hotel dining. Noise was a factor with the construction starting at 8am. The staff were very prompt at  trying to address the concerns regarding the construction this played a major part in our decision to remain instead of finding another hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Things will be fine once construction is complete
review.locationRemarks: Dining, easy access to cable car, tour bus or just walking the area.

review.reviewText: Very comfortable room and close to the wharf.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for leaving your feedback. We hope to welcome you back to the hotel soon!

Regards,
Kaycee D.
A Guest Relations Associate

review.reviewText: All is fine but now is in construction. We have a few inconveniented for the repairs.

review.title: I think it will be better after renovations
review.reviewText: Hotel was OK. The ongoing renovations made the layout of the hotel a maze - getting to the room was too complicated. Had to carry luggage up and down stairs getting in and out of the hotel - no one offered assistance, even though there was always hotel staff at/around the door. Our recently renovated room was appropriate for the rate which we paid, but not impressive. Bed was comfortable. The best feature of the hotel is its location - 5 minute walk to Pier 39, 10 minute walk to Ghirardelli square, 20 minute walk to Chinatown. I would probably stay at the hotel again, but only after renovations are finished.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff awareness and courtesy

review.title: Close to all sights, but under construction!
review.reviewText: Would have been nice to know that the Hotel was under construction before I booked. Was difficult to navigate and there was not enough valet and staff to help carry bags up and down stairs.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Liked this hotel but it's under construction. The location is the best

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to provide feedback regarding your stay! I am glad you enjoyed our location and appreciate your thoughts on the room as well as breakfast and parking charges. I will be sure to share them with my team.

Warm Regards,

Belinda M - Guest Relations

review.title: Good location, overpriced, mediocre bed, $$$
review.reviewText: Way too dusty due to the construction. Breakfast cost 25/person, parking 57/night. The bed was hard and rigid. Room was small. Staff were ok in lobby/aka meeting room. Valet men were extremely nice and helpful. Great location, not going to return.

managementResponses.response:
Dear World Traveler,

Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback. I am truly sorry to hear about your experience at our hotel. I know the renovations have been impacting our guests more then we had hoped. I am pleased to learn the staff did everything they could to make your stay as enjoyable as possible, but understand they could only benefit your stay so much. I hope you could see through the construction and realize that once done, the hotel will be impeccable.

Regards,
Kaycee D.
A Guest Relations Associate

review.title: It's a DUMP!!!
review.reviewText:
Call before you book to determine if the "renovation" is over. 
We were greeted at the "temporary entrance" by a dozen protestors screaming angrily at us as we tried to pass. The staff was kind and let us escape this by being escorted through the employee entrance. 
The "front desk" is located on a windowless closet. The path to the elevators was dangerous and uneven underfoot; a jackhammer was only stopped when I started to roll my video camera; the guy was right next to me with goggles and ear protection. I had none... Napping in the room (its well located to the action at Fisherman's Wharf so taking a break should have been easy) should have been a option, but hammering, drilling etc. made that impossible. To get to brakfast in the morning you had to exit the hotel and enter around the block. On the last day we encountered a guy in the elevator whose car had been damaged when one of the valet parkers ran into construction equipment in the garage. If there is hell on Earth, this place was it.
As an aside, the staff was working dilligently to make sure the guests were OK; they were great, but there is a limit as to what they can do. This hotel should not accept guests until it can assure their safety (and sanity).

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your visit to the city! I am glad to learn you enjoyed your stay and I am sorry to hear you were aware of the renovations. I do hope you get to stay with us again.

Warm Regards,

Belinda M - Guest Relations

review.title: Renovation was a surprise!
review.reviewText:
You know when you get a deal that is too good to be true....the price we paid for the Hyatt Fisherman's Warf in San Francisco was exactly that.
Great location.  Staff was very good, but it would have been helpful to know the hotel was under renovation.  I believe it should be Expedia policy to indicate when a property is under renovation.  For the price I probably would have booked the Hyatt in any case, but I would have felt better treated by Expedia.

So this really isn't a review of the hotel.  It is a comment about Expedia.
review.negativeRemarks: Include renovation information in the Expedia "offer".

review.title: Great Value for the Price
review.reviewText: The hotel is within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf in a good area.  It was undergoing renovations while we stayed there, so it's hard to say how nice it really is. The staff was very friendly and the room was spacious and clean. Would definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is great - close to Fisherman's Wharf, but far enough away not to have to deal with the crowds and noise.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, close to shopping and we found a great diner - Darren's, which is very close to the hotel.

review.title: Good location, poor service
review.reviewText: We stayed for 3 nights when hotel was booked, there was no mention that hotel was undergoing major renovations on expedia or on the Hyatt's website. The Maine entrance was closed had to use side entrance which had no ramp and not accessible. Staff was friendly but service was poor. The first room was very dark and dirty, we did change rooms and the second room was better ( it was one of their renovated rooms) but only partially( old bathtub and vanities etc..). There was construction noise during the day and it was very expensive for the state the hotel was in. Not at all consistent with the Hyatt name. We were very disappointed and angry that we had paid premium rate for inferior service. The only plus was the location. Be very aware that for the next 3 months or until renovations are done, this hotel is not worth the price they are asking for.

review.title: Under Construction
review.reviewText:
The whole stay experience was okay. It is under construction for  4 months, and I believe they had just started last February, anways, I booked this hotel not knowing that they are under renovation, I was sold by the pictures shown here on expedia, and thinking that it is HYATT, everything would be perfect. Lo and Behold, we got there and their lobby was placed inside of a meeting/conference room. The parking is by Taylor St, not on North Point, there's this huuuge space that's covered inside the hotel, that takes you to a detour going to the elevators. We got to the room and it was nice, They had probably fixed the 5th floor first, because it wasnt as dirty like the 3rd floor. The next day, after a long walk around the city, we decided to come back to the hotel to take a shower and rest, surprisingly enough, the bathroom had NO ELECTRICITY!! tried to call the front desk, the phone was NOT WORKING!!! I had to walk by the elevator to let them know what happened. 

It was far from the experience that I had pictured staying at a HYATT hotel. The only positive that came out of this was the LOCATION. Its a  walking distance to the wharf, pier 39, and a lot of restaurants. I would still recommend this hotel for the location, because all of my issues are caused by the renovations. I would suggest, however, booking after all the renovations is over.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to share your positive comments regarding our friendly staff and their excellent service offered during your stay at the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf. Despite the room renovation, it is always a pleasure to hear that you had a great stay and enjoyed all that SF had to offer. Your appreciation was forwarded to the Executive management at the hotel. Hope to welcoming you in the near future.

Johny E.-A Guest Relations Associate

review.title: Terrific location, close to everything,
review.reviewText: Aside from the renovation of rooms during our visit, it was a wonderful place to stay and enjoy all that SF has to offer!

review.title: Nice hotel near the wharf.
review.reviewText: It would be nice to know if construction is going on at the hotel!

review.title: Terrible experience!
review.reviewText: Workers on strike woke us up every morning and the hotel is under renovations that they failed to mention when we booked our room so construction and workers LOUD! House keeping did not clean our room , we had to call for clean towels!!

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: Being an Expedia VIP Gold Card member I expected a better room. You had to pay for internet service  parking was two blocks away. The room was not very clean. However the valet was wonderful as well as the bartenders and wait staff. The concierge could have been more helpful
review.positiveRemarks: The valet gentleman the restaurant the wait staff and the bar tenders
review.negativeRemarks: Knowledge from concierge about different restaurants and helping with a cab
review.locationRemarks: Great location the warf  the cable car Alcatraz

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The construction was very annoying especially since it woke us up early on vacation but the location of the hotel was amazing.
review.negativeRemarks: the construction going on right next to us woke us up early every day :(

review.title: This is not a 4 star hotel, more like 2.5 stars.
review.reviewText: The lobby area is renovated, but our room is very dated and depressing. There is no sound proofing and we could hear people walking in the hallway. The bathroom has been remodeled in a strange way. The shower head does not provide enough water so that I could not wash my hair. The water only trickled down because of the design. There is no towel bar to hang the towels either.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback regarding your stay. i am glad you found your room to be comfortable. You will be glad to learn that WiFi will now be complimentary so no more extra charges for that. I do hope you get to stay with us again.

Warm Regards,

Belinda M - Guest Relations

review.title: Good choice and less noisy
review.reviewText:
I had a quiet night but early trucks working in the morning with the backguards alarm. 
probably that is just on the side my room was. 
I did not find where to connect my phone near my bed. 
very big room very comfortable 
NO INTERNET IN THE ROOM without paying extra.
review.negativeRemarks: FREE INTERNET
review.locationRemarks: I was on business

review.title: Hotel convenient, parking not and too expensive
review.reviewText:
Arrived to a mildew ceiling rm 314, had to complain at front desk, fixed ceiling only, grout in shower and bathroom dirty, mildew along glass shower wall at bottom, stained at bottom.  Had to place glasses at garbage can to get clean ones, had to ask for more coffee/tea.  There was a Potatoe chip in front of the lounge chair all week, a water cap under the desk all week, 1 1/2 row of dust around all baseboards and thick dust in corner near right side of bed, no luggage racks, dust mound at foot of bed where it was dented.  We felt that we were on holiday and weren't going to spend the week requesting cleaning, so we just put up with it.  Our other room 313, had similar issues but less mold.
The only thing we could rely on was that the heat was always turned down
review.positiveRemarks: A few of the staff were friendly, most ignored us, including in the restaurant
review.negativeRemarks: Clean, clean, clean.....realize that those staying for a week deserve as much if not more that nightly guests.
review.locationRemarks: We were busy and enjoyed everyday away from the hotel.  Location was fine, we choose it.

review.title: Good location, but not much else.
review.reviewText:
Great proximity to too many things to mention. The Concierge service was woeful -- My 16 year old with a phone and google could do the same or better -- and he did!

The location is fantastic with so many things to see and do within walking distance: Fishermans Warf, Ghiradelli Square, Cable Car stop on adjacent corner.

However, we really appreciated having a car to easily get to other neaby fun things to do like Baker Beach, Golden Gate Park and the "top" and "other side" of the Marin Headlands -- which I would list as must see places in San Francisco that some might miss. The car also made it easy to get to Muir Woods which was awesome!

Other memorable moments: brunch in Sausalito at The Trident which has good hippie vibe from its past connection to Kingston Trio ownership. The crab cake eggs Benidict was really good. And the views of Angel Island, Alcatraz and back across to SF are world class. We will really miss the food options available in SF. We went to "Tin Vietnamise Cuisine" on a recommendation as to where the locals go and it was very good and less expensive and I think we were only tourist in the place which was nice.  Also went to the more "Touristy" and expensive option of "The Slanted Door" -- it was more expensive but food was fantastic to look at and eat! All of the food was top notch, but the round Gau Choy Gow are worth mentioning as they were so unique ;-) The peppermint cotton candy dessert was a surprising treat and most awesome photo op for the kids!
review.negativeRemarks: More professional Concierge service. This hotel makes you pay extra for WIFI and coffee in the lobby. Homeless sleep on the sidewalk next to hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Location is the best thing going for this hotel... Easy walk to Fishermans Warf, Ghiradelli Square. Cable Car stop on adjacent corner.

review.title: a place to lay your head.
review.reviewText: If you're looking for full amenities. This will not do. If you're looking for a place to lay your head at night and nothing more, it's the place for you. i have to say that the staff is excellent,very friendly and accommodating. It's close to many things in the area, walking everywhere! One bonus, the restaurant Knuckles next door was fabulous. It's very small but if you can get a seat, they're great!
review.negativeRemarks: More family friendly amenities. More personal amenities such as lotions, robes, etc,.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for staying with us during your visit to San Francisco! I am so glad to learn you enjoyed your comfy room and our great service! I do hope you get to stay with us again soon.

Warm Regards,

Belinda M - Guest Relations

review.reviewText:
Overall a lovely experience. 

Great for a quick get away with your sweetheart:)

The room was comfy and cozy.Nice&clean. 
Only thing, and im not positive who's fault this was.. is I requested a mini fridge in room in the "requests" section upon booking thru Expedia* and my request wasnt granted. I had to ask the Bell Hop for one, which wasn't a real huge problem. All in all i had a wonderful stay.

review.reviewText: This was the second visit to this hotel and it is still under renovation. It was very loud in the morning making it difficult to sleep. Otherwise, the hotel was nice and comfortable. Hopefuly the next time we stay at the hotel the renovations will be completed.
Great hotel located in a popular location. Staff was nice and friendly. Will stay again

I could hear every sound from the next room, even drawers closing and opening.
Also, the channels on our tv would stop working, at random times

review.reviewText:

To top it off, I have NEVER stayed at s hotel where you have to ealk a maze to get to your room! One elevator and it was a longgg walk with suitcases ... I am totally setious!  It was horrible!
Front desk was ok but for the most part, no one went out of their wdy to be friendly!
And one more thing, the big bottles of water sitting out in the room , don't even drink them...unless you want to pay the $5 per bottle they have written in small print.
Overall, I was not happy!

review.title: Very Disappointing
review.reviewText: We found Hyatt Fishermans Wharf to be very tired, looked like minimal maintenance had been done for quite some time.  There was no refrigerator in the room which was otherwise appointed rather basically and was very poor value for money.  We contacted Expedia who were very helpful and we were able to leave after one night and get a refund for the remainder of our booking.  I have held off posting this review until the refund was credited to my account.  Probably the worst of it was that the staff, or at least the ones we spoke to, didn't seem to care.  They said "this is a family hotel".  Fine but the pricing was 5 star and the facilities 2 to 3 star.  Never again!!
review.negativeRemarks: A new Manager needs to be appointed as maintenance and staff attitudes have to change and this won't happen without competent leadership.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf and San Francisco generally is a great place to visit.  We love it but we'll always avoid this hotel.

review.title: No Romance Without the Finance
review.reviewText:
Upon arrival we were informed that they only had rooms with two double beds available. Despite the fact we reserved and paid for a King size bed it wouldn't be available for several days. They offered to add us to a transfer list for later in the week but we declined. 
The front desk stated that reservations booked through third party vendors, like Expedia, don't truly know a hotels room availability so it's a crap shoot. Good to know. 
After my husband and I settled into our individual beds we noticed all surface areas were covered in dust. I love dusting on vacation so why not get out a towel and give the place a once over. (insert sarcasm) 
Unfortunately I left my bathroom grouting kit at home so there was nothing I could do for the rust stained grout that surrounded the shower tiles. Nor could I repair the chipping paint from the tub. 
At $350 a night my expectations for this supposed 4 star hotel were not meet. Lesson learned if I ever return to San Francisco I will be prepared to pay Four Season/Fairmont prices and book months in  advance.

review.title: Excellent Fisherman's Wharf Location
review.reviewText: Two blocks up from the water in Fisherman's Wharf, between the touristy part and residential area. Walking distance to cable cars which lead to Union Square, Nob Hill, BART, etc., so you can get just about anywhere from here. Enjoyed renting bicycles a block away and doing the 10 mile ride to and over the Golden Gate Bridge, down to Saucelito where we took the ferry back, an experience not to be missed. Facility is more than adequate, staff efficient, room comfortable. Hallways are dark and dingy, which seems to be a standard Hyatt design element these days that I wish would change. Lobby area is compact, nice fitness room, a choice of way too expensive on-site parking (valet) and a bit less but still expensive structure parking a couple of blocks away (always be looking over your shoulder on the walk to the hotel). Good rates for what you get, relative to other high-priced SF lodging.

review.title: San Francisco Holiday
review.reviewText:
The Hyatt is situated in an area where most of the main hotels are located, it is minutes walk from Fisherman's Wharf and whilst transport links to San Francisco centre (F line tram) were great the immediate vicinity is in my view was very similar to Blackpool for those in the UK who know it, lots of cheap shops selling souvenirs, there were also and a number of homeless people which was very sad but at no time did I feel intimidated, in fact for someone who isn't a fan of City life I have to say I felt very safe in San Francisco.

The Hotel itself was very nice, the room has all the basic stuff although for the price I paid I expected the room to be cleaner, if you looked closely the edge of the carpets and anything not in immediate sight was very dusty, in particular at the back shelf where the TV was also situated, I can't believe it was ever cleaned, we did raise this and some of the concerns were addressed. Staff were always friendly and polite and they did give us complementary basic internet access, this is normally extra in the room.

The sports bar was a great place to eat although not cheap.

Not sure if I'd stay there again as now I know that there are cheaper hotels on the same block I'd probably try one of them as you aren't in the room all that long.
review.positiveRemarks: Good transport links to all over San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness of the rooms, main area was clean but looking closer it was very dusty, behind curtains, edge of beds, internet access to be free in rooms
review.locationRemarks: Close to Pier 39, Alcatraz and the cable cars to get around the city.

review.reviewText: Great location, within two minutes walk of the main Fisherman's Wharf area, but no so close it's constantly busy and noisy. review.title: Nice Hotel but Horrible Overnight Parking $$
review.reviewText:
Hyatt hotel so of course it was for the majority a comfortable stay. Great thing about the Hyatt is Fisherman's Wharf is that it is conveniently within just a couple miles of everything you wish to do.

BUT

- Parking was 30% the cost of my room over night
- Even if you leave and come back you are charged per hour for your car to sit there during the day

A valet attendant was nice enough to inform me of parking 2 blocks away for more than half the reduced price. I was driving my 7 series BMW, no way I parking it in a random parking lot.

For what I spent in parking I could have got a room for another night. I know how SF is but I have heard stories about hotels which do not over charge for such things.

review.title: When Average is Disappointing
review.reviewText:
I booked this hotel knowing it was a Hyatt and expecting great things out of the hotel. I also booked it for it's location. This did not disappoint. We went not wanting to mess with a car, and this location helped with this. We walked to everywhere in the warf, and some outside. We used the "Hop On/Hop Off" bus to get us everywhere else. This part was good.

The hotel itself was actually dirty. I had to tell the front desk to clean the lobby bathrooms because it was so filthy. Our room did not have a comfortable sitting area, and just was not comfortable as we are used to for a hotel of this price point. Other than bar soap, we had to call for other hygiene items that are typically provided in the room.

There was only one ice machine per level, which seemed to be insufficient with the amount of rooms per level. The pool and hot tub were nice. The biggest frustration was the elevators. The one that took you to the front counter level was always slow and packed. We would have preferred to just take stairs, but there were none around. The elevator was our only choice.

It was ok, but I felt like I was at a budget hotel rather than the Hyatt. I would recommend this hotel only for the location.

Tip: Did not eat breakfast there, but the Hollywood Cafe across the street was the best breakfast I think I ever had at a reasonable price!
review.positiveRemarks: The location was perfect! Lots, including the Pier 39, within reasonable walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't know if it can be improved without construction, but the elevators and stair access was poor. Overall cleanliness as well.
review.locationRemarks: Great eating places, gift stores, and easy to get to the piers from here.

review.title: Good hotel Good location
review.reviewText: Staff was helpful and very good location. The rooms are nice but ours had a dirty/stained couch. Otherwise we had a good stay.

review.title: poor service, expensive parking
review.reviewText:
Parking added about 50% to the nightly cost of the room and the only option was valet parking. That means a wait while you drop it off and a wait while you pick it up, and you can't leave anything in there you don't trust the valets with. The Concierge was not at the desk even though I waited for 10 minutes. The TV is set up to look like there are free movies and pay movies (what else would "premium" vs. regular mean?) but after you spend time looking for a regular movie want to see and select it, then they tell you there is a charge --which is more than you paid to see the movie in a theater when it was new.

The shower head was in the ceiling instead of coming out of the wall. You know, one of those really stylish showers designed to make it hard to get the soap out of your pits and groin because anything unusual is stylish, no matter how uselsss. And this shower had an extra bonus. Someone cleverly built the stall so that you have to stand under the shower head to turn the water on. It is impossible to turn it on without getting splashed by cold water even if you are tall enough to reach the shower head and redirect the spray. My roomy is petite and she had to get the full spray of cold water in order to turn it on, because she couldn't reach the head to move it to the side.
review.negativeRemarks: let people park their own car install plumbing designed for functionality rather than stylishness

review.title: The Best in Town
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf in February, 2014. The room was spotless, the amenities the best and the staff was wonderful. As our departing flight was a red eye, they were very accommodating allowing us to set in their very comfortable bar while waiting on our flight. They also arranged our shuttle to the airport. Their heated pool and hot tub were awesome. Water, a newspaper and breakfast buffet was included. The food was wonderful! I definitely recommend this hotel. We stayed at Radisson the first two days of our trip and will never stay there again. The had no hot tub, no information regarding things to do in the area in our room and charged for everything! Not even water was complimentary. Hyatt is the way to go!

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience regarding your recent stay at the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco. Also, we are grateful to hear that you enjoyed the place and call it home for its great location, its excellent service as well as the comfy bed and the amazing tub for relaxing after a long busy day. Your kind comments were forwarded to the Executive management team at the hotel. Hope to welcoming you again in the near future.

Johny E.-A Guest Relations Associate

review.title: A comfy,welcoming place to relax after a busy day!
review.reviewText: Having a cable car stop 2 blocks one way and the Wharf 2 blocks the other was perfect! The bed was so comfortable. The staff was very helpful. The hot tub was our salvation after all the walking. Very enjoyable place to call home for our 1 week stay.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to piers and much more
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and the staff excellent. Food at the restaurant was very good, but very expensive. $62.00 for breakfast of pancakes and French toast was ridiculous. Luckily there is a very nice cafe across the street that both excellent food ( breakfast and lunch), and much better prices.

review.title: Cheap design, not functional!
review.reviewText:
Overall, with the price what we paid, we were happy to be so close to the Fishermans‚Äô Wharf and the hotel staff were friendly. However, hotel only offers valet parking which is much higher than other hotels in the same area. We ended up using the public parking around the corner.

Anyway, we were really disappointed to know the room was not functional. It was really nice and clean but no bath tub, only the rain shower without shower head and hose, no towel hanger, bathroom tissue holder placed so low, no recycle bin...etc. We travel a lot around the world, and we know the standard of the hotel rooms. And these little things really bother us because it‚Äôs almost like our second home. It was really disappointing...we wanted to know who designed this room, it is not just cheap but also non-functional!!! The thing we appreciated was that there was bigger fridge.

We do not recommend this hotel for those who are particular about little things in your room. Otherwise, it is in a great location.

review.title: Great location near the Wharf
review.reviewText: Stayed for business. The commute to boat show at AT&T park was only about 15 minutes and
review.positiveRemarks: Knuckles restaurant and bar and the Bartender Clayton were a hit. The personnel in the Hotel were all very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Room cleanliness at check in was lacking
review.locationRemarks: Only a couple of blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and Buena Vista. Walking distance to many popular spots.

review.title: good location, but hotel needs a face-lift
review.reviewText: hotel is outdated....very small lobby, furnishings showing wear

review.title: Nice hotel; even better location
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean, comfortable beds and friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The art work
review.locationRemarks: It is perfectly located close to all main attractions: Alcatraz, the Pier, Golden Gate Bridge, Lombard Street and a short Trolley ride to Union Square

review.title: Great hotel close to the action of SF
review.reviewText: My daughter and I went to San Francisco for a holiday get-away - the hotel was close to public transportation, tour centers, and wharf activities. It has the perfect location. The staff was helpful and room was restful and clean. There isn't much they could do for improvement. Very friendly.

review.title: very modern and clean hotel
review.reviewText:
this was our second stay at this property and we were just as satisfied as the first. the hotel is clean and modern with all the right touches amenity wise.
be sure to note that this hotel is 2 short blocks away from the world famous fishermens warf, where the massive sign bearing a dungenous crab inside a ships wheel has been standing for decades.
review.negativeRemarks: I would mention parking but its SF were talking about.
review.locationRemarks: fishermens warf shopping sightseeing

review.title: Hyatt Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Everything was ok, except we would not want stay on the Main Street side (front hotel) due to excessive traffic noise all night.

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Wharf and other attractions
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, rooms seemed a little small, but staff was very good and rooms were clean. However, parking at hotel is very expensive. Then again it's all about location. I would stay here again.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf is conveniently located, it's a short stroll to the wharf where the restaurants are and also to Pier 39. Staff are nice and very helpful. Room is clean and comfortable. Room includes complimentary coffee facility. The hotel offers other complimentary items such as razors, robes, slippers etc which are available upon request. The only downside is that the Internet is not included in the room rate. You have to pay for $10 minimum good for 24hrs use.

review.title: Convenient, but nothing special
review.reviewText: Just there over New Years 2013-14. Close to Fisherman's Wharf. Small lobby, limited elevators, adequate rooms, pleasing staff, nothing special. If it wasn't geographically desireable not sure I'd spend any time there...but it did the trick.

review.title: Great hotel close to most tourist attractions
review.reviewText: My family and I had a great trip to San Francisco. The hotel was great and convenient being right in fisherman's wharf area.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

review.title: Location...location...location
review.reviewText: The Hyatt is in the perfect location-not directly on Wharf but close enough! Most hotel staff were awesome and helpful with directions. Bed and breakfast was well worth it. Not comfortable with sliding non-locking bathroom door and rain shower head is not what we expected. Pool cold for heated pool and hot tub closed exactly at 9 which didn't give people enough time to walk the wharf in evening and get back to enjoy at night. Overall, we were pleased with our stay.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the bay
review.reviewText: Everything was ok, but I regret there is no complementary wi-fi in the room, even in the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Wi-fi
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, sightseeing bus, cable car, Lombard street.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the bay
review.reviewText: Everything was ok, but I regret there is no complementary wi-fi in the room, even in the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Wi-fi
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, sightseeing bus, cable car, Lombard street.
Located at the heart of Fisherman's Wharf (just three blocks away). Great place to stay. Pretty close to many places nearby.

review.title: Pleasant hotel
review.reviewText: Convenient location. Comfortable room

review.title: Perfect for quick and comfortable stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience to local attractions and well situated for meetings I had in the area.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of eating attractions at Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Wharf and Cable Car Access
review.reviewText: Have stayed here ten or more times and for the first time the woodwork is showing signs of neglect. Not what I expect in a Hyatt.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to cable car and trolley and Wharf.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText:
The location was good, hotel clean and easy to stay in. Bit of a "rabbit warren" from lift to room but good directions helped.
Bit disappointed the hotel couldn't. Give me the extra night at a good price or if not at. Least offer me a light breakfast of internet connection for a day free.
Most hotels I have stayed at like to impress so they get return business. I travel to USA every year so I would have been a regular now I'll look around
review.negativeRemarks: In room dining menu
review.locationRemarks: Fishermen Wharf, pretty water side walk, good selection of stores and a few good restaurants. Lunch places on wharf particularly. Good .

review.title: Nice Hotel. Middle of Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: The bed was very uncomfortable. The hotel charges for WIFI and bottled water. The TV is difficult to navigate. The exercise room is nice. The elevators are very slow.

review.title: OK hotel
review.reviewText: If you are looking for an inexpensive hotel to rest at the end of a busy day of sightseeing then this is the right place for you. The facilities are outdated, hallways and rooms are dark and dreary. It definitely could use an uplift. Personnel was very friendly and always willing to help.

review.title: $57 per night to Park
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel is in a great location. Very well maintained.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is outrageous. $57 per night.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for providing feedback regarding your stay. I am so sorry that you did not get any assistance with your luggage and will be sure to discuss this with our front office team. I am glad to see that the rest of your stay was enjoyable and I do hope you return to experience a more inviting welcome.

Regards,

Belinda M - Guest Relations Associate

review.title: Good enough
review.reviewText: The main issue for me here was lack of staff. We arrived post 11 hour flight. Checked in. Tired and with a lot of luggage and there was no bell man. No help at all. Which wouldn't have mattered so much if the room hadn't been a very long walk away. I arrived with a walking stick. So. It was obvious that I needed help. This set the stay off on a bad note. That being said. The room was good. Bed comfortable. TV good. The Internet is $9.99 a day. The restaurant here is ok too. So ok in summary

managementResponses.response:

I know that sometimes they do get busy but they should still be able to provide service to our guests in a timely manner. I will be sure to discuss this with our concierge team. I am glad to see that you did enjoy the hotel itself and its proximity to attractions. I hope we can welcome you back in the near future.

Regards,

Belinda M - Guest Relations Associate

review.title: City Hotel within walking distance from lots of ac
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay, relaxing place
review.positiveRemarks: Nice hotel, close to key areas of city
review.negativeRemarks: Concierge - (seems it was a temp/replacement person) Was always on phone, had to wait 10-15 minutes to get service.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, waterfront

managementResponses.response:

Regards,

Belinda M - Guest Relations Associate

review.title: Good hotel in good location
review.reviewText: Good hotel, with comfortable rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Stop the fifty dollar a night car park rip off
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman s wharf

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Stayed here recently for a 3 night stay. Great location, within easy walking distance to many sites & access/ease to transportation options makes it ideal for tourists. Overall the hotel is ok.

Thin walls, can hear the conversations of the adjoining room.

Concierge is well, awful. Has absolutely no knowledge of local sites or information. Couldn't answer any of the questions I asked, & offered no help as well. Overheard another conversation he had with another guest which confirmed to me that he was totally useless. 'I heard Sausalito is a nice seaside town'....REALLY??!! Either educate yourself on the LOCAL area, or replace him with someone who is willing to provide more effort. The man working at Walgreen's ticket counter provided me better knowledge, more personable & friendlier as well.....

The housekeeping staff were probably the best service feature of the hotel. Very friendly, did a consistent job everyday & were the only people who made the effort to greet guests through the property.

Overall should this hotel really shouldn't be considered a true Hyatt property. More on the level of a better Motel.
review.negativeRemarks: Better concierge services. The property is dated & high volume traffic/turnover, so service drives the experience, good or bad.
review.locationRemarks: It's close to the Wharf - so many things to do/see within easy walking distance or short taxi ride & the cable car turnaround is behind the hotel.

review.title: A 3 star hotel that is close to it all.
review.reviewText:
I picked the Hyatt because it was known for its high class, business type of feel to the hotels throughout the country. I have stayed at Hyatt's before and never have been disappointed like I was with the one in San Francisco. First, the lobby needed some updating. Most of the furniture is worn and dirty. They have a concierge and a welcome desk with a few chairs. The staff was very friendly and advised there were no rooms available at 12pm (early anyway). Came back a short time later and was given a 5th floor room with a view of the pool.

The room (just like the lobby) needs updating. The furniture was old and showed signs of wear and tear. The bathroom had a cracked sink along with a few cracked tiles. The bed was horribly uncomfortable. For a "four star" hotel they need more comfortable beds then an old spring-style bed. The couch and desk in the room had stains and dust present as well. The window held out no noise and could hear every word said from the pool area to the 5th floor.

Parking is expensive! The attached restaurant is so-so and no amenities outside of the lobby unlike the fire pits and other outdoor seating seen at other "2 and 3 star" hotels. The only benefit is being 2-3 blocks away from Fisherman's Wharf and a taxi ride away from anything else you want to see. If I come back to SF, it will not be at the Hyatt.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel and concierge staff were friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds, cleanliness and overall modernization of the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, MANY restaurants!

review.title: Hotel Convenient to Everything. No need for car.
review.reviewText: Had two days in San Francisco and chose to stay close to Wharf. The Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf was the perfect location and convenient to everything.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location! And great customer service.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking at $50 a day was too high. We did not need our car so it was parked the entire time.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, Ghirardelli Square, cable cars, bike rentals.

review.title: Nice Hotel, close to everything
review.negativeRemarks: Parking

review.title: Nice Hotel close to the Wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel is located one block from Fisherman's Wharf, a great location. There is a great bfast spot across the street. They have Starbuck's coffee promptly ever day in the lobby. The room was clean and modern with a great TV. Didn't use the internet experience, but it's available. Too busy site seeing!
review.positiveRemarks: Coffee everyday early, cleaning staff, service
review.negativeRemarks: I wish every hotel would give free coffee and free internet.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Good location but poor service
review.reviewText: We were very disappointed with the maid service. Our room did not get cleaned until 7:00PM each day. The room was not clean or made up when we returned from the day in the city. Each night when she came to clean at 7:00pm, we had to keep telling the housekeeper to return after we had gone to dinner. Often, she would call to see if she could come clean. When reported this to the manager at check out, he replied that this was against policy (eg. all rooms cleaned by 4pm), but did not seemed concerned or offer any adjustment. My feeling is that this was poor management and the practice still continues.
review.negativeRemarks: housekeeping
review.locationRemarks: wharf area

review.title: Not a 4-star hotel, at all.
review.reviewText:
Maybe a 2-star hotel. I was struck by the lack of cleanliness in the so-called lobby. The chairs, tables and sign-in desk show extreme wear, and need to be wiped down. We're not talking about a dusting cloth, but a scrubbing. The elevator is the same--in need of a good cleaning. This isn't a matter of the day just being active, but you can see layers of grime in the corners of the elevators that clearly were not taken care of for a long time. The hallways are not much better. The walls show many scrapes and blunt hits from what I hope are the luggage carts, but it's apparent that these have been there for a very long time and the walls need to be treated/repaired. The hallways are too dark, making you wonder what the lack of light is hiding.
The concierge is no help if you want to choose a restaurant or go to see something other than the wharf. Then again, he was unaware of details of a festival happening on the wharf and it was the 3rd weekend in a row that they had been going on.
Be prepared to be surrounded by homeless when you exit the hotel. If you have children and are not accustomed to seeing this it can be a shock.
Stay somewhere else that is truly a 4-star hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Better information for what to do for guests. Cleaning the hotel top-to-bottom would be a help.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the wharf; easy access to double-decker bus and bay tours. Good walk through the Italian and Chinatown sections.

review.title: Expected better
review.reviewText: For a Hyatt, I expected better than just ok. The location was excellent; that was the best aspect of the experience. Staff was mixed; the valet was good, the others just nothing special. Why I will probably not return to Hyatt: First, the $10 additional charge for wireless - it isn't much, considering I paid nearly $60 to park overnight, but it annoyed me because no other hotel I've stayed at charges for wireless, and their room rates are pretty high - why nickle and dime over something so basic as wireless access? . Another issue I had was the outdoor hot tub and pool. I was looking forward to the hot tub after a long walk from dinner on a Saturday night. I put on my suit and went to the 4th floor area and entered the hot tub, but I was told to leave after only a few minutes. Why? Because the pool and hot tub are closed at 9. It was about 9:15. It is poor service to advertise amenities and have them so restricted - 9:00 on a Saturday in San Francisco? That is ridiculous, especially as I was being very quiet, just sitting there enjoying the warmth. And, they should have had a sign up or locked the door at closing time instead of letting me get barely wet before kicking me out.
review.locationRemarks: It is a few blocks to Fisherman's wharf, walking distance (a good walk, about 8-10 blocks) to North Beach area. Safe neighborhood.

review.title: Good location, poor management
review.reviewText:
Food and beverage manager excellent, but room service dishes left for 3 days in corridor, dirty linen put on bed, reception staff unfriendly and unhelpful especially after disasters such as chap sent to fix faulty basin plug made it WORSE and had to be sent again.
However location is great, serviced by trolley and cable car and close to Fisherman's Wharf and ferry terminals.
Pity that receptionists don't realise how vital they are to a business's image
review.negativeRemarks: Management, management, management
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf, Ferry terminal at Pier 1 has a great farmers market, good transport to Union Square, shopping uptown and Civic Square

review.title: Great hotel. We've stayed here before & LOVE it!
review.reviewText: We visit S.F. often and stay at the Hyatt. It's a great location near Fisherman's Wharf and a short walk to Union Square.

review.title: Nice facilities closed the Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed every moment. Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and restaurants and many other activities in the beautiful city of San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Closed by everything. Cleanliness. Friendly personnel.
review.negativeRemarks: Improve the set up in the bedroom, such as a place to put luggage, seating place, towels rack in the bathroom, bigger closet.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location, closed to Fisherman's Wharf, nice restaurants and various activities to do in San Farncisco.

review.title: Tourist hotel in tourist heaven - extremely $
review.reviewText: I checked in on a Sat at 2:54PM. I reserved a King bed but was told by the staff with an attitude that if I wanted a King, I would have to wait 30 to 45 minutes. I informed her that check in was at 3PM. She basically told me too bad and that I would have to wait if I wanted a King. I had to get to a wedding by 4PM so I had no choice but to take the room. I paid a very large amount of money for this room for one night inclusive of all fees and this is how my stay began. The room itself was fine. Clean and spacious, especially for SF. Hallways were a bit run down and elevators were super slow. Tacky "I left my heart in SF" music was playing throughout the halls. I am from the Bay Area so this was lost on me but I'm sure some people are enchanted by this. Checkout was similarly frustrating. The desk lady refused to sell me stamps because she couldn't find the key and wanted to give me change in all $5s because she didn't want to count out a new banded stack of ones. (Which were in plain view when she was aggressively pushing the $5s on me. The hotel worked and everything and its in the best of locations if you want Fisherman's Wharf but it was rundown for the price and the staff really didn't care at all about you. It felt like they think of you as an annoyance rather than the reason they are employed.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel staff demeanor, modernize hallways and clean public areas of the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: There is a large red bridge that people really like. Look at it.

review.title: Good location Walking distance to a lot of thin.
review.reviewText: Great visit to San fransico Hotel staff was very helpful. Rented a car and drove down to Carmel on pacific coast hwy.

review.title: Great location... but no free wifi
review.reviewText:
I was surprised at the cost of hotels in the San Fran area, not just in the Fisherman's Wharf area. In the end I chose the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf for over $350 CAD a night. I was disappointed upon arrival to receive only two double beds when I purposely booked a king bed room. Also very disappointed that, for $350 a night the only wifi provided for free was in the lobby.

All in all a good hotel and close to all the tourist attractions we desired but not perfect by any stretch.
review.negativeRemarks: free wifi in rooms, faster elevators
review.locationRemarks: close to the wharf, bike rentals and shops and restaurants

review.title: Hotel close to the marina and acitivities
review.reviewText: Great location, good amenities with pool, spa, gym, laundry.
review.negativeRemarks: air conditioning too loud. update on paintwork.
review.locationRemarks: perfect location for site seeing, go carting, bicycling, running, bus tours, eateries.

review.title: Good hotel, close to San Francisco center
review.reviewText: Good hotel, clean, nice rooms, friendly staff. The hotel i located near to fisherman's warf and one block away from the famous cable cars. Golden Gate bridge is about a 20 minute bike ride. SF center is 30 min walk or 10 min cable car/bus.

review.title: Clean hotel, friendly staff, close to the pier!
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Staff were very friendly. Hotel was always clean. Room was clean. Only thing I wish was different was free wifi in the rooms. You had to go down to the lobby to get free wifi. If you wanted wifi in your room you had to pay approximately $10 a day. The only other problem we had was we were traveling with another couple and I called about a week in advance and requested connecting rooms. They told me it was already put in the system that we had connecting rooms. When we arrived, they had no note that we requested connecting rooms and could not get that for us. The best they could do was to put us on the same floor. Short walk to the pier and most of the local attractions or teansportation to get to further attractions. Overall, very happy with the hotel. Would stay there again.

review.title: Perfect for our needs
review.reviewText: We really just wanted a nice, clean bed near Fisherman's Wharf, but ponied up a little more for a nicer place. It was pretty perfect for us. Nice bathroom, good-sized room, king bed, good AC, and very clean. Staff was very friendly as well. Above all, you can't beat that location. About two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf.
review.positiveRemarks: Most of all, the location. Next in line was cleanliness.
review.negativeRemarks: Would have liked a refrigerator.
review.locationRemarks: Stated above.

review.title: Good location for the Wharf and attractions.
review.reviewText: We used the valet for the car and they we're prompt and courteous. Wi if had good reception. Staff was helpful and offered recommendations.
review.positiveRemarks: The amenities were good. room was clean and modern.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: I loved how close it was to the cable car stop and within walking distance to north beach restaurants.

review.title: Splendid location in Fishermans Wharf.
review.reviewText:
Easy reach of Pier 39, the historical ships, and the ferry for Alcatraz, cable cars and trams.
Rooms are very comfortable but could do with a bit more storage space if you are staying more than a couple of days.
review.negativeRemarks: More storage room needed for stays over 2 days.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal location in Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: Perfect location for the Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel was great and the breakfast was even better. Nice clean room and comfy.

review.title: Great Location.
review.reviewText: My only complaint is paying $42 to park. Ridiculous!

review.title: A little too modern in the Room
review.reviewText: Very nice and clean hotel, walking distance from Fishermans wharf and the trolley station. The receptionist was not very friendly and helpful but the valet guy was super nice and more helpful than the front desk. The room was a bit too modern for my taste because the shades are those see thru type and unfortunately we were on the same level as the swimming pool and had to see the swimmers all day and it made our rest uncomfortable thinking perhaps they could see us sleep. We even work up early cause of the light and to avoid people seeing us.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for the bay access.

review.title: Good location for Pier 39, F tram and cable car
review.reviewText: Good quality hotel, nice rooms but a little "end of season" in the public areas.
review.negativeRemarks: Public areas and the bar could do with a bit of sprucing-up.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for Pier 39 and Alcatraz. Close to F tram and Cable car termini so easy access to downtown.
