review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: First impression, room looks nice, but after second look...very poor design. No place to put clothes, no place to hang towels. No privacy as room was directly overlooking pool.
review.negativeRemarks: Design needs to take guest into consideration & not just "look good." Need drawers, towel racks, ect.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, walking distance to Wharf

review.title: Nice hotel close to the wharf
review.reviewText: Well situated, within easy walking distance to attractions, restaurants, and shopping.

review.title: Nothing extraordinary.
review.reviewText: Took my family to SF for Labor Day. Hotel was clean, but I was put off by no "free" wi-fi unless in the lobby (even motels offer complimentary wi-fi) and the desire to charge $5 per bottle for in-room bottled water. To me, that's an affront; it's water, for crying out loud, and does nothing to improve goodwill. The valets were very nice, however, for what that's worth.
review.negativeRemarks: Offer free in-room wi-fi and a couple of bottles of water.
review.locationRemarks: Great part of town - a hub to te rest of the city.

review.title: Location, Location, Location!
review.reviewText: Check in was a breeze and staff was attentive. From driving in to checking in all the steps took no more than 15 minutes.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness was great, no complaints about linens and facility was tidy and neat.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel house keeping was very early to room in the a.m. when check out was at 12:30; no need to be to early when on a break form work.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf was within seconds and entertainment. couldn't have asked for anything more.

review.title: I give them a 2 only because of the location.
review.reviewText:
I was extremely disappointed with this hotel. Somebody needs to reduce their star rating. Lets start with the cigarette buds in the lobby floor! Really? I was so digusted. Then as you walk to the elevators, they have this old nasty rug that smells like an old attic. Very bad first impression for guests.
The rooms were no better. The carpet was so nasty and dirty, never expected this from a 4 star hotel. Then the comforter was wrapped in two sheets because apparently the hotel can't afford duvet covers. This was disgusting as the sheets were not even wrapped to cover the nasty comforter. If you have any class, I would suggest you pay a little more and stay at a 5 star. This hotel was definitely a disappointment.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything. From the smelly rug near the elevator to the clean up of cigarette buds in the lobby to the lack of duvet covers to the dirty old carpets.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great. Very centralized.

review.title: Hotel near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Great location for easy walking to all Wharf attractions. Hotel room was very quiet and comfortable. The only down side is that on site parking is $50 per day.

review.title: Great location but beds are bad
review.reviewText: Walked to everything but had to switch rooms the second night because the mattress was very uncomfortable and couldn't sleep in it for another night. The new rooms bed was better but still not Great! I would probably stay at a different hotel in area as there are all the other major hotels on the same street

review.title: Hyatt at fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: Excellent proximity to fishermans wharf with lovely rooms. Staff all very helpful and friendly and overall facilities good with hot tub, swimming pool and a restaurant with an interesting menu.
review.positiveRemarks: Room excellent and overall standard high
review.negativeRemarks: Surprised no mini bar in room
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to Embarcadero with aquarium, markets and exploratorium. Cable car and buses nearby so access to downtown and chinatown

review.title: Nice, ok, but lacking for a Hyatt
review.reviewText:
No Bar fridge in a Hotel of any kind is average, especially disappointing for a Hyatt, also no WiFi access in room, available but must be paid for. Location good, Bar/Restaurant also disappointing.
Won't stay there again, wouldn't recommend.
review.negativeRemarks: As Above
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Great Location!!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf. The room was quite modern and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was great for going down to the Wharf and even walking to Lombard Street. The staff made suggestions for sightseeing that were very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: More package options include airport transportation packages
review.locationRemarks: Great location-- the best part I think!!

review.title: Hotel close to the Wharf
review.reviewText: When we arrived we were warmly greeted by the valet outside, when we arrived at the front desk the two ladies were in the middle of a great chat and only stopped when we were in front of them instead of greeting us as we entered. Check-in was smooth, the room was ok. Clean, smelled nice, bed was good. The only thing about the room was the roll down blinds were stuck and hard to close/open. Check-out, was smooth. We didn't need anything but it seemed that the front desk people were always chatting with each other and not really paying attention to anyone else. I accidentally left my charger in the room and noticed it after we landed in LA. I called the front desk & operator several times and they just forwarded me to the (associate) director of housekeeping. He was not available so I left a message. I call again a few hours later and encountered the same thing. I call again the next day, and the next. Certainly it was my fault for forgetting the charger, but after 3 days with no reply and no contact I figured I'd try a bit earlier. I called again and I reached one of the housekeepers. She said she checked the computer and there was nothing left in the room, I asked her to please check the room she agreed and would call me back after she checked. Still no reply the following day... I returned back to NY and then called to speak to a manager right off the bat and within 2 minutes he was able to find my charger. I understand people are busy, but don't leave me hanging for day.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, room was decently comfortable. Valet guys in the front were very friendly. The manager who finally located my charger over the phone.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service? Front desk? (Could use some lessons from the valet guys. Or just switch them.. heh) Add some smiles.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf. (Where many tours depart) The cable car is nearby, so is Lombard street. Annnd that's about it..

review.title: Not a happy camper
review.reviewText:
Our room was located sort of in a breezeway where we heard all the traffic noise and the wind blowing. Needless to say we didn't get a good nights sleep.
One of the beds was lumpy, very uncomfortable and made a lot of noise when getting in and out of bed and when turning over.
We only encountered hotel staff when checking in and out. She was friendly but didn't inquire about our stay upon checkout.
I thought that was unusual because most places will want to know if you had a good visit. I thought it might be because they didn't appreciate the fact that the room was less expensive.
Sorry I can't be more positive. At least I know where not to stay on my next visit to San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds that are comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance to Pier 39 and lots of shops and eating places.

review.title: Great location. Large, clean, comfortable room
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a great location. Large, clean room. Did not provide free wireless Internet which was disappointing. Good variety of TV stations and flat screen TV. Some rooms had a fridge but ours did not even though we booked two rooms at the same time and our friends room did have Fridge
review.negativeRemarks: Provide free wireless. Most hotels do!
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Just a few blocks to Fisherman's wharf and cable cars

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: This hotel is very convenient for tourists. It is attractive and clean, although the decor in the room was of "Trading Spacings" quality - it looked sort of cheap and temporary. There was a giant surge protector dangling just below the desk/entertainment center that was visible from the bed and, although it didn't bother me, it illustrates the lack of focus on style. The staff is very nice, no complaints there. Parking is valet only and quite expensive, and the valet forgot to give us back our car key which is probably going to become more common with keyless ignition, so we had to make a special trip back to the hotel to get it before our flight home. All that aside, I would definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the location, the cleanliness.
review.negativeRemarks: The decor seemed a little cheap. There is not much storage for clothing, just a few drawers in the closet. The bathroom did not have an exhaust fan.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to lots of wonderful restaurants. Try Fior d'Italia, great food and ambience.

review.title: Great staff
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 4 days, staff was great and friendly. Beds were comfortable although the room was smaller than we expected. There were also a lot of complimentary items included in our stay, all we had to do was ask.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was friendly and accommodating, beds were comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: Grouts in restroom was not clean enough, counters were also dusty

review.title: Noisy Location
review.reviewText:
Centrally located to the Fisherman's Wharf within walking distance. Totally shocked at the mandatory $46.00 parking fee. Hotel as okay. Nothing really special about it to make a statement or get you to return. Our room was situated across the street from a cafe which was extremely noisy first thing in the morning. Heavily traveled street with constant noise all night. Windows were not adequate to keep the sound down.

Lots of left over hair in the bathtub which was another bummer about the hotel. Sort of expected more from a Hyatt hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping could make sure room was clean before moving on to other rooms and the parking fee could be lowered.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf.... Don't forget your jackets. It was freezing when we visited and had to buy one from a local shop.

review.title: aan te bevelen
review.reviewText:
Erg goed hotel, parkeren wel wat duur en ook het ontbijt maar beiden werden door de receptioniste included geregeld.
ligging uitstekend, loopafstand 2 min. van Fishwermans warf, 5 min. van de Golden Gate met de auto.
Kortom aan te bevelen.
Ook zeer goede service van alle personeel
review.locationRemarks: fishermans warf, eten en drinken,

review.title: Marginal at best...
review.reviewText: I was expecting more. We stayed at 2.5 star hotels far better than this 4star. No wifi or you had to sign up to T-Mobile to get it! Really, in these days you shouldn't have to search around for something that simple, all the 2 star and above give free wifi.
review.negativeRemarks: no wifi, had to drive 2 blocks to park my own vehicle (valet was full)
review.locationRemarks: near fishermans wharf, kind of lame

review.title: Very good location
review.reviewText: The hotel is very close to Fisherman's Wharf and there are many restaurants and souvenir shops around the hotel. The room was clean and hotel staff was very welcoming and nice.

review.title: Located at Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Good hotel located a block from Fishermans Wharf, yet very quiet. Clean rooms, yet slooooooow elevators. Discounted rates are located very far from the elevator bank. On the down side the valet parking is expensive ($48) but standard for the city. The pool is kind of freezing and a bit small. There is no minibar or refrigerator in the room. On site restauration is pretty good and affordable.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Located a few walks from Fisherman¬¥s Wharf and Guiraldelli Square. Pricey, as everything in San Francisco, but worth it.

review.title: Hyatt fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: Close to Fisherman's Wharf. Nicely appointed rooms and hotel. Even though it's cool in SF we made good use of the pool. Too bad its a shallow one.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was very convenient. Helpful staff

review.title: Perfect spot is Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel in Fisherman's Wharf. Super location, convenient to everything. Staff was very accomodating and treated us to some extras when they learned we were there for our 20th anniversary. Pool and jacuzzi was a nice perk in a quiet courtyard away from traffic. Knuckles restaurant was delicious with an A+ breakfast buffet. Rooms were large and spotless, great bedding and towels.

review.title: Staff needs to be more friendly
review.reviewText: Not real happy with the place. 12:30 at night the fire alarm goes off for an hour straight and they had no idea how to deactivate it. All they said was "We apologize for the inconvenience". They should have at least provided free breakfast or somthing to the guests. They didn't even come on the PA system and announce that it was a false alarm until I called the front desk to ask if we need to evacuate. They also screwed up our reservation. We were supposed to have two beds in our room and all they had was a king and then moved us LATE the next day.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel was clean and nicely appointed. Good location.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff needs to be friendlier. Front Desk were not especially nice at all.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is real close and all the touristy things for a first time visit to SF.

review.title: Location of the hotel: I think it is the best.
review.reviewText: It was very nice experience!! The city is beautiful, easy to go around, quite expensive
review.positiveRemarks: The location is the best. Close to the main attractions, public transportation, tour offices and departures for them, food at the restaurant very good
review.negativeRemarks: The cleaniness of the bathroom. Some black spots at the corners and a yellowish color on the walls. Refrigerator is provided only by request.

review.title: Located at the Wharf, close to dining,shopping,etc
review.reviewText: Fisherman's Wharf is located across the street so name is accurate. Hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Provided a refrigerator on request and a replacement when the first was not working. Hotel was quiet at all times. Concierge provided great tips on local attractions.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet, perfect location, helpful staff, Knuckles Restuarant and Bar, Hollywood Cafe across the street.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms could be painted, parking could be cheaper for guests, $46.00/plus tax a night seems excessive if staying but it's CA so it could be worse
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, Ghiradelli Square, Alcatraz Landing, cable car station nearby for trips to Chinatown, Hyde St. Pier. etc.

review.title: A reasonably priced hotel in the center of San Fra
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a very convenient place for a business person who might want to bring the family into the city for a weekend of sightseeing . The family is right in the heart of all of the tourist attractions and is a five minute cab ride to the financial district. Clean & comfortable, friendly staff, and reasonably priced.
review.negativeRemarks: Refrigerator in the room would be nice
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf, Lombard street, Alcatraz, and the Golden Gate Bridge within walking distance. Short cab ride to financial district.

review.title: Weekend stay at the Wharf with a knife and glass.
review.reviewText: I always stay at Union Square when I'm visiting San Francisco. This time I decided to try the wharf and it was nice. It's more quiet, no clanging or ringing of the trolley bells, and more of a mature family oriented crowd at the area. I would have given the Room Cleanliness an "excellent" rating, but when I checked in the room, there was an empty glass and a use butter knife outside our door. I could have picked it up and taken care of it, but I don't where those things have been. I checked in on Friday night, checked out Sunday noon and they were still there. I'm sure the staff saw it as I ordered some stuff from the front desk to be brought to my room, and I know they do daily cleaning, but the knife and glass stayed there.
review.positiveRemarks: Great staff, esp Luz. Attentive, accomodating, professional and passionate. Luz was the best, most helpful registrar I've ever encountered anywhere.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking. Too expensive, and maybe too small? Also, the filipina lady/ hostess which greeted us for breakfast on a Sunday was too controlling.
review.locationRemarks: Trolley station is just a few blocks away, less than a 5 min. walk, and right beside that is Ghirardelli square. Free chocolate samples!

review.title: Overall Good, but ......
review.reviewText: We paid a premium to stay in a the Hyatt in the center of Fisherman's Wharf. The location is great and the staff met our expectations. Our experience in the bathroom was not pleasant. Please tell the accountant in charge of micro-managing the budget that when a guest pays a premium for a hotel they expect toilet paper and towels to meet the premium price point expectations. I know you saved a penny a day buying the lowest quality toilet paper on the market and another nickel on the worst towels you could find, but I would re-think this if I were you. The towels smelled like they were dried over a fire and they were as rough as sandpaper. The toilet paper was practically unusable and we had to go down to the local drug store to buy our own.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is fantastic. The gym is the best hotel gym I have seen.
review.negativeRemarks: Improve the toilet paper and the towels. They are practically unusable. Please don't tell me that they were selected to be environmentally friendly.

review.title: Too Much Money for Too Little
review.reviewText: For the amount of money per night I paid, I was disappointed that we had to pay extra for Wi-Fi internet access in our room and I was disappointed that there was no continental breakfast in the price. For 4 nights and paying just under $900, I was not impressed. After a long day of touring the city, it would have been nice to sit in the hot tub but the pool and spa area closed at 9:00pm so we couldn't do that either. That staff were really nice but overall, I won't be staying there again.
review.positiveRemarks: It was a five minute walk to the Fisherman's Wharf
review.negativeRemarks: Had to pay extra for internet, no continental breakfast, and pool area closing at 9:00pm.

review.title: would stay again
review.reviewText: Great location for young family as hotel is a close walking distance to many tourist attractions, would have liked a fridge in the room but you can request at additional charge. Staff very helpful and friendly. We had a lovely quiet room. Would definately stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, close to lots of tourist attractions and transport
review.negativeRemarks: No fridge
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for families, close to many things but quiet location set back a few blocks from cable cars and shore

review.title: San Fran holiday
review.reviewText: It was a great location and accessible to so many must see activities.

review.title: much older and more dated than we expected
review.reviewText: Our overall experience was OK, but our initial impression when we arrived at the hotel was that it was very dated and worn. Location is good for Fisherman's Wharf, but there are many hotels in the immediate area that we had searched online that were comparable price-wise. We went with Hyatt due to reputation, but the other hotels looked a lot nicer once we saw them. Also, our room was RIGHT by the pool, so that there were people lounging about 2 feet outside our window....it was unsettling. We called to ask for a different room, but were told they were booked and could not move until the next day. We opted to stay so we would not have to unpack twice since we were only there 3 nights. The staff was accommodating, but that room would better serve as a changing room for the pool or something.

review.title: Excellent stay
review.reviewText:
Clean room and common areas.
Pool area excellent, someone seen cleaning throughout the day.
Staff friendly and helpful,
Held our luggage for our last day so we could finish our trip.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness of room. Quiet room that had a window that opened onto a courtyard!

review.title: San Francisco vacation.
review.reviewText: A great 4 day San Francisco vacation. Weather was excellent, take warm clothing to the baseball game! The hotel is in a great location. Staff was courteous and polite and always helpful. The Hollywood Cafe across the street has a great breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was right across the street from the pick up point for our tours. Within walking distance of everything near the pier.
review.negativeRemarks: Include free WIFI with the room.
review.locationRemarks: Golden Gate Bridge, Muir Woods and Napa Valley.

review.title: Much overpriced - not worth more than 2 stars
review.reviewText:
We booked this hotel since it was where we were about to stay the last three days of our trip and wanted something fancy when in San Francisco. We thought a 4-star establishment would be great.
If the location is perfect, very close to the ocean, very close to the cable car, the hotel is at the low end of what a 2-star hotel should be.
Our room was small, the furniture was old and damaged.
Food at the restaurant is very ordinary. Do not have your breakfast at the hotel, there is a very nice breakfast restaurant just in front where you will get great food for much cheaper.
So, it all depends how much you pay for the room. More than 150 / 200 USD per night would be strongly exaggerated.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, close to the ocean, Fisherman's wharf, cable cars etc.
review.negativeRemarks: All should be refurbished. Not worth more than 150 USD per night.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal for walking to the ocean, to fisherman's wharf. The cable car is 1 minute away. A lot of nice restaurants within walking distance.

review.title: Great hotel if holidaying in San Fransisco
review.reviewText: Excellent 5 star hotel in good location for holiday makers. The staff were professional and friendly, room was clean and well appointed. There was a reasonable walk to the hotel's lift but nothing too dramatic.
review.negativeRemarks: slight walk to room
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to Fisherman's wharf, good public transport to downtown.

review.title: West Coast Vacation
review.reviewText: We had booked our hotel online through Expedia at least 3 weeks before arrival. We had requested a room with a King or Queen Bed. We arrived the night of our stay around 10:30 p.m. to check in. I was told that there was only 1 room available and it had 2 beds and was asked if that would be okay for the night. I told her that I had asked for 1 bed and she stated that was all she had and if willing the next night they would move us into a King room and upgrade us to free breakfast the next morning and free Wi-Fi. I agreed. When we went to our room there was a placard that said "Conference Suite" on the room. When we got in there was a twin bed and a loveseat folded out to a bed. Those were the "two beds". Not sure how our original room wasn't available but this was wierd. The loveseat bed was not very comfortable. Once we moved the room was fine.
review.negativeRemarks: Location, location, location. Close to public transportation, close to the Piers and many of the tourist attractions were within walking distance.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf Pier 39 was close, Aquarium, Sea Lion rescue, Lombard Street, Trolley, Maritime Museum, Ghiradelli Square.

review.title: Really great hotel just a block from the Wharf.
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel, very clean, would be nice if they had breakfast included, and the parking is outrageous. $46.00 a night for valet plus the tax - and it is your only option for parking - they really have you over a barrel.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, very clean, great staff.
review.negativeRemarks: parking is really expensive, and it would be nice for the rates charged if breakfast was included
review.locationRemarks: It is literally half a block from the Wharf, lots of restaurant choices, lots of neat little shops, plus the view, boat rides, lots to do.

review.title: Hyatt Fisherman's Comfort
review.reviewText: Staff very helpful, prompt and efficient. The hotel lobby is small. Excellent ice-water provided. The limousine recommended by the hotel was excellent. The receptions are is also very small. The room is comfortable, a little old. The bedroom slippers were not so good. We liked the coffee making machine in the room.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfort that is just right. Good, efficient service and information.
review.negativeRemarks: Small lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Great, right at Fisherman's Wharf precinct.

review.title: Great Hotel!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel was very nice. Very comfortable beds! Very clean and well kept hotel. Walking distance to so much San Francisco fun! Parking is $46.00 a day for guests, I used taxis and public transit as opposed to car rental.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable beds. Cleanliness. Heated pool. Location.
review.negativeRemarks: More dining options. Free wifi would be nice. Cheaper parking fees.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans wharf. Pier 39. Aquarium at the Bay. Cable car rides.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Stayed a couple of nights to visit San Francisco. The locatiom was very close tomthe bay, restaurants ans other ammenities. It is a big hotel, the room was spacious and comfortable, the staff super nice and friendly, they went the extra mile to help when needed. The bed and pillows were very comfy.

review.title: Great hotel! Great location!
review.reviewText: Overall I was very satisfied with my stay. I've stayed twice so far, and I would stay again on my next visit to SF.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was friendly and helpful. The decor is very nice and modern. The beds are extremely comfortable--I slept well.
review.negativeRemarks: I wasn't happy about paying for Internet access.
review.locationRemarks: It's only two blocks away from Fisherman's Wharf. It's also close to Ghiradelli Square. There's also a Safeway about a block away.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The staff was pleasant, but never noticed anything above and beyond. Maintenance could be improved: a broken lamp and radio along with a flooding shower. Everything was very clean, though, and the location was fantastic.
review.negativeRemarks: Maintenance
review.locationRemarks: Blocks from everything in the Wharf

review.title: Nice hotel , close to most attractions in Sfo
review.reviewText: The staff wasn't helpful . If you take a car prepare to pay50 usd per stay overnight . The rooms charge 10 usd for the basic Internet access most of the Hilton's and Marriott's have Internet access these one you have to pay. Also there is no minibar . But to have a nice sleep it's ok
review.negativeRemarks: Internet and staff friendliness
review.locationRemarks: It is perfect no complains

review.title: My review
review.reviewText: I stayed in motels that had more luxury than this so called Hayatt!!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Over great experience..! Great location. Close to all tourist areas..

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was great. Reason for 4 stars, was that a male employee in the lobby told me that the limousine service back to the airport was the same as the cab fare. No. It was $15 more. Too bad he could not just tell the truth. Best thing about this hotel is the Hollywood caf√© across the street. Unbelievable breakfast in both quantity and quality!! Knuckles in the hotel not so good. Food good, but service terrible.
review.locationRemarks: great. close to Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: GREAT FOR FISHERMANS WHARF
review.reviewText:
Our hotel stay was excellent, we had no problems what so ever and all the employees were very pleasant.

The location for Fishermans Wharf was ideal and the Tram Line was just round the corner.

We would stay again at this hotel if we ever made it back to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: COMY ROOM WITH WALK IN SHOWER
review.negativeRemarks: NOTHING
review.locationRemarks: CLOSE TO EVERYTHING AT FINSHERMANS WHARF

review.title: Hotel itself is great, booking services poor
review.reviewText: The only reason why I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5, is that I specifically requested a king bed. Even called twice to make sure. By the time I checked in, my record was "lost". I can understand if a king is not available, but I don't like wasting my time calling and paying the rate that they charge and being ignored.

review.title: Great weekend hotel
review.reviewText: I feel comfortable here. The drawback is that they don't have free wifi. It is small and upscale and the staff are very personable. I am always there for weekend conferences. Don't know about Monday thru Friday.
review.negativeRemarks: They charge for wifi

review.title: okay Hotel, very good and covenient location
review.reviewText: The elevators a bit slow n the overall hotel okay nothing special about it...the price is the only thing upscale. Ive stayed at other Hyatts n this was the worse..check in sucks n too time consuming

review.title: Not staying here again
review.reviewText: Front office staff were not friendly Hotel room had dirt on the vents. Valet parking attendents were nice and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk staff
review.locationRemarks: Convienent to alot of sights and restaurants

review.title: Lackluster stay somewhere else
review.reviewText: Found this hotel very disappointing for the location and particularly the price. Front desk staff was maddening as to lack of customer service. Basic amenities like a room fridge, room service not available. Pool and spa close too early to be enjoyed. Elevators are very slow, and the floor plan of elevators to rooms is very odd- long trips around every time to do anything. Needs work. Rooms are okay. Wouldn't stay again. More of a mid-range motel for luxury hotel price. Felt as though since they're in Fisherman's Wharf they feel they don't have to try.
review.negativeRemarks: Guest service- felt very unwelcome
review.locationRemarks: Good location- close to many things

review.title: for the price...not so good
review.reviewText: We are not wealthy people and am excited when we can plan a get-away. For the price and supposedly a 4 star hotel, we were quite disappointed. Hotel is in need of a makeover. Our room was not too clean. Hair and dust in folds of shower curtain. My sheets had some kind of blood stain (gross). It was about 9 p.m. when I saw the dirty sheets and called to have sheets changed. They came quickly and was apologetic.
review.negativeRemarks: Worn down, not too clean
review.locationRemarks: Near Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel as a place to rest your head only. Good location and the staff were pleasant. The breakfast was very ordinary.
review.negativeRemarks: Mattress on both beds were old, not comfortable.

review.title: Great hotel and great location!
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location. We were able to walk to many of the tourist attractions. The hotel staff was wonderful. If we needed anything, they were able to provide it instantly. I was able to get a room for a second night even though the hotel showed as being sold out online. One thing to point out is if you're staying here, there's no need to pay for a rental car. The daily parking fee at the hotel is high, so if you're able to go without a rental car, I would advise to do so. There are many other ways to get where you need to go in the city and traffic can be pretty bad.
review.positiveRemarks: My favorite thing about the hotel was their level of service.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel restaurant was expensive.

review.title: Great accomodations
review.reviewText: Great location with an extremely pleasant staff and fresh clean accomodations. We were very pleased with our overall experience while staying here.

review.title: Location!!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel had a a great location and everybody was very helpful except for housekeeping. The room was never dusted and the staff kept forgetting to clean parts of the room and replace somethings
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping

review.title: Perfect for sightseeing
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay. It was a base for us in a good location. The retreat of the outdoor jacuzzi and pool were perfect after a long day biking the Golden Gate Bridge! The staff were polite and helpful. The only annoyance we had was that one day when we returned to our room at about 4 pm to relax our room had still not been cleaned. They came upstairs immediately to correct this.

review.title: Wonderful stay
review.reviewText: We booked two rooms, three nights for a girls reunion. The location was perfect for walking. We ate breakfast in the restaurant and had wonderful service and food. Loved the salt water taffy kept at the front desk and ate far too many of them. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Better not to have a car, the parking is expensive. The only thing I would change is to not have an extra charge for in-room WiFi. More and more I am looking for places to stay that include amenities with the pricing and skip the add-ons.

review.title: I felt pampered!
review.reviewText:
The staff were the most accommodating that I've ever experienced. They anticipated my needs, even thinking of things before I did! My departure date could have been very stressful for me, but was made painless, thanks to the wonderful people at the Hyatt.
I will definitely be returning to and recommending this hotel in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: The concierge services and room amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: I chose not to pay for their available internet packages, and would have liked all options to have been available with the room.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf was a dream, and the hotel was so easy to get back to from wherever I chose to explore.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the piers
review.reviewText:
We LOVED the location of the hotel- it was walking distance to the piers, restaurants, Lombard street, Ghiradelli Square, car/bike rental places, and more. It was also just a short cab ride to Union Street. We wanted to check out the hotel pool, but we had so much fun exploring San Fran that we ran out of time!

Our room was clean and in good condition. My husband and I requested a king size bed, but were given two small beds (not queen- the ones smaller than that), which meant we had to sleep separately as my husband is 6'5" and needs some space. That was annoying. The front desk said every other room was full, but since the hotel was never very busy, that seemed a little hard to believe. Parking our rental car overnight was expensive, although that might be the case everywhere- not sure. All in all, we were happy with our experience at the Hyatt.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, cleanliness, friendly staff, modern feel
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators are painfully slow... lots of waiting.
review.locationRemarks: Cross the street to eat at Hollywood Cafe! Delicious breakfast, huge portions, and great prices. We ended up eating there EVERY morning!

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: We love this hotel. I am very picky and I can't come up with one complaint. This is a place we will come back to stay anytime we are in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The helpful staff, the beautiful rooms, and the great beds!
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive valet service
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks from the Wharf, less than ten minutes to Chinatown and North Beach.

review.title: A good choice for a first visit to San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Pricey, but very well located, near the water. Room was ready before official check-in time, which is always great. Nice room and comfortable bed, but the walls seemed thin (we could hear someone snoring in the next room).
The hotel restaurant is convenient, has healthy options and reasonable prices.
Helpful concierge, but you should skip the wine tour he suggests (it was disappointing: we saw one small organic winery, but then the other two were very commercial, with wines you can buy in stores).
The font desk attendant paid almost no attention to us at check out time, which makes you feel like once they have your money, they don't care anymore.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and comfortable room, restaurant in the building,
review.negativeRemarks: Reception desk staff upon departure, disappointing wine tour
review.locationRemarks: Great location, you can walk to the water in less than 5 minutes

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Great location. As like all the hotels in San Fran the cost of parking is high.
The only other thing is no wifi in the rooms unless you pay.
Overall a nice hotel with a great place for breakfast just across the street ' Hollywood cafe'
review.negativeRemarks: Parking charge and wifi

review.title: San Francisco - Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
Overall, great location to Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf and to the cable cars and transit.
The only item I might suggest is that the vending machines not only carry soda pop, but also bottled water. This would save on having to trek on over to the local Walgreens to wait in some very long lines to purchase bottled water.

review.title: Great value!!
review.reviewText:
This is a great property! I've always liked Hyatt hotels. Great location with access to everything. For the money I don't think you can beat it. The beds are amazing. I did not use many of the amenities so I can't rate concierge, restaurant,or pool/fitness center.

My only gripe would be parking...$53 a day! But I guess every where in SF is expensive. Oh well.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, comfortable beds, central location, great value.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee shop, hallways, parking fees.
review.locationRemarks: Gary Danko!!! Fishermans wharf, gherideli square, Chinatown.

review.title: Best location
review.reviewText: Hotel was so nice. Everyone was friendly n helpful. This is a great location to see the city, so close to all attractions. Would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Wouldn't change a thing
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman' wharf Great food Alcatrez ferry Bridge

review.title: Good stay
review.reviewText: Hotel is back from the street, so quieter than some neighboring hotels. Valet parking for $46 (unlimited in and out) or offsite self park at $32 when Hyatt validates the parking ticket. Very comfortable. Bathroom lights could be brighter.

review.title: Ok but overpriced for what you got..
review.reviewText:
No wifi in room. Charged an arm and a leg to have wifi on separate devices (charged per device). Had to travel to lobby to get wifi.

Good location.

Pretty expensive considering the experience/what you got.
review.negativeRemarks: No wifi.
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: My wife and I had no issues with the hotel and it was a very comfortable stay.The staff were extremelly professional, well groomed and were very attentive. I would definitely recommend the Hyatt to my friends in the travel industry and can't wait to stay here again the next time we visit San Francisco..
review.locationRemarks: Great location across from Fisherman's wharf

review.title: Nice hotel in tourist friendly area
review.reviewText:
This Hyatt is a nice but reasonably priced option in a major tourist area. The staff was very friendly and helpful - going above and beyond several times with recommendations and suggestions. The room was nice - clean and comfortable. Being very picky, there was minor water damage to the ceiling in the shower area (but nothing I would complain about! just a function of it being a shower area).

We had drinks and snacks in the attached restaurant (Knuckles) a couple of times - drinks, food, and staff were all wonderful.

There was a function one night we were there and the noise carried a bit into our room. I was tired enough to barely notice it but it did disturb my husband a little.

My two biggest complaints: booking through Expedia did not guarantee a king size bed and we ended up in a room with two full size beds (not quite big enough to sleep together comfortably) and the hot tub is shallow - only 2.5 feet deep. And those are really picky complaints - I would absolutely consider staying here again!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was warm, friendly, and helpful!
review.negativeRemarks: The hot tub was only 2.5 feet deep!
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is a busy touristy area of San Francisco. Many attractions are easy to walk to or have inexpensive public transportation options.

review.title: VISITORS
review.reviewText:
I live in SF and had a couple of friends visiting me so I put them in this hotel. its ashort walk to puplic transport MUNI .

They loved it

review.title: Perfect Location!
review.reviewText: Walking distance to wharf, restaurants, cable cars, ghiradelle square. The onsite sports bar, Knuckes was very good. We will defintely stay here again.

review.title: Disappointing hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed at Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf for 4 days and must say that for the money paid I was personally very disappointed with the hotel. I had specifically asked for a top floor room with a view of San Francisco and when arriving looked out of the window to see a side street. I also felt that the room itself was very disappointing, our bedside lamp didn't work and on moving the side table found a dirty fork behind it. The room was also quite dated and the pictures on the website are not a true representation. Not good value for money. The one good thing about the hotel was the friendleness and helpfulness of the hotel staff. I loved San Francisco and have wanted to visit for such a long time, but feel very disappointed at the hotel chosen.
review.negativeRemarks: Dated room and not very good view.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal location on the doorstep to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Great all around hotel
review.reviewText: Staff, from reception to house keeping, were always friendly, attentive and curteous. Nice clean hotel. Quiet but close to all activities in Fisherman Warf. Definitely recommend and return.

review.title: Great for Families!
review.reviewText: The hotel location was very convenient to all that SanFransisco has to offer. The pool was terrific for my son after a full day of sight-seeing and before dinner. The pool and pool area were super clean with plenty of towels. The front desk also gave the kids water toys for the pool. Really, the hotel was all you would expect from a Hyatt. What blew me away, was we checked out and a few hours later realized my son's special teddy bear was missing. The staff let us back in the room but it had already been cleaned. Housekeeping had already sent our linens out to the cleaning service. To make a long story short, the staff contacted the cleaning service and the bear was shipped back to us in NY. This just shows how helpful the staff is and how willing they are to help out the guests!

review.title: Excellent Hotel for Location
review.reviewText: Nice Modern Hotel with good Clean Bright Rooms - Room Size excellent with lovely large walk in shower - Executive Room
review.locationRemarks: Excellent - Close to all amenities, easy walking distance to Pier 39 and whole of Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Nice Hotel Management
review.reviewText: Professional Staff and nice management to handle the claim professionally

review.title: Go with Warf
review.reviewText: Nice hotel only complaint is there over night parking fee's .
review.negativeRemarks: Rate's for parking
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Hyatt adds to San Fran enjoyment!
review.reviewText: Staff very friendly and helpful. Comfortable, attractive decor. Excellent location. Internet a pain - paying $9.95 for 24 hour service. Definitely recommend overall.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff so friendly and ready to be of service.
review.negativeRemarks: Paying for the internet in 24 hour allotments was expensive and a pain.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for walking and catching transportation.

review.title: Happy Vacationer
review.reviewText: Great location. Steps from Fisherman's Wharf and the trolly cars.

review.title: great hotel for fisherman's warf area.
review.reviewText: I would have rated this hotel as a 5 if there would have been a fridge in the room, offered free wifi, and if the restaurant's breakfast buffet was reasonably priced. The breakfast buffet is around $20 per person, but the offerings and quality is not great. There are restaurants very close you can walk to for a much better breakfast. I don't understand why they charge for wifi. Even the cheapest, budget hotels offer free wifi these days.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was clean, bed was comfortable, hotel very convenient to Fishermen's Warf.
review.negativeRemarks: Over-priced breakfast, charge for Wifi.

review.title: Is not value for money
review.reviewText: The only good thing about this hotel was the location, but even still I would have preferred staying in union square. The hotel did not offer free wifi in the rooms which is disappointing for a hotel of this scale. The rooms were nothing special, no mini bar again surprising for a Hyatt hotel. We had to walk a maze before we even got to our room. The staff were ordinary, did not greet us we entered the hotel. I did not find this hotel value for money.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything but the bed

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This is my go to hotel when I'm traveling for business and pleasure in San Fran. Its great for family stays as well as small meetings and small conferences. My only complaint is the shower is a European style that only has a half glass wall. It really needs a door to keep the heat in the shower.

review.title: Very clean, modern comfortable
review.reviewText:
The staff was very kind and helpful at the front desk. I noticed that whenever we passed anyone in the halls, like the maids cleaning the rooms, they would always acknowledge us with a friendly hello.

We only stayed overnight, so I can't comment on housekeeping the second day, but the room was very clean and pleasing upon arrival. We had a view that overlooked the swimming area/inner courtyard, which was no big deal since we had such a short stay, but it may have been nice to have an outside room. The front desk checked us in without delay even though we arrived at 9 am.

If the stay had any downside, I didn't love the bathroom doors that slid shut and apparently didn't lock that I could see. It was actually hard to close it all the way, without there being a little crack down the middle. I was only with my husband, so it wasn't an issue, but if I shared a room with kids it may have been an issue. Maybe all doors aren't like that... We had only a king bed. The shower, while clean and beautiful, was too open and drafty feeling, and the shower head was installed in the ceiling and I at 5'6" could barely reach it to angle it a little so it wasn't just pouring straight down.

I didn't get to try the pool or spa, but it looked clean and nice. The location was convenient also.

Overall, it was very clean and beautiful and comfortable and we would stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: shower drafty
review.locationRemarks: Great for Wharf, trolley accesibility.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The only negative thing was our room was above the valet parking. Whenever the phone rang or they were hanging out talking it sounded like they were in our room. Otherwise a nice hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The restaraunt. The staff there was great!

review.title: Great location and nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Nice staff and great location. Would stay here again.

review.title: Great hotel for family
review.reviewText: The room is very confortable and Stuffs are friendly.

review.title: Great hotel for family
review.reviewText: Great hotel with comfortable beds. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Great location with many restaurants very close by.
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Chinese New Year
review.reviewText: The only thing I didn't like was that I had to pay to park. The valets for parking were very friendly and fast when you wanted your car though.

review.title: Less than perfect staff
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is excellent. Most of places where we wanted to go were in walking distance. Hotel was clean. Unfortunately the hotel staff were less than perfect. They did not notify the package that is delivered to the hotel. It took a long time to get the package from the front desk. They kept asking if the name on the package is correct or not without checking the backroom. Finally someone decided to check the backroom and it was there. I asked a newspaper to be delivered to my room but it did not come. Concierge did not give the coupons for the hope on hope off bus. I knew he had them.

review.title: Great Location Poor value
review.reviewText: Parking in an outrageous price $52 per day. Charging $5 for bottled water place in your room. Card beside bottles has very fine print stating the $5 charge. Few bathroom amenities provide. Parts of the hotel look worn. Charging $10 for WIFI in your room. Choice of TV channels limited.
review.negativeRemarks: All the additional charges
review.locationRemarks: Good

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: I had much higher expectation of a Hyatt property. Any Best Western would be of similar quality and service.

review.title: Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf A Little Disappointing
review.reviewText: The Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf is located within walking distance of many attractions. My biggest disappointment was the comfort of the bed AND both my wife and I found ourselves sneezing and sniffiling all week long. On the last day I popped open the access plate to the HVAC system and found a filter that looked like it had not been replaced or cleaned in years! The staff at the Knuckles Sports Bar on the main level was great and fun. Also disappointing was that there was no free coffee service other than the poor excuse for coffee in the rooms. I'm sure this was available across the street at the Holiday Inn Express where we will stay the next time.
review.negativeRemarks: Maintenance of HVAC System & No Coffee Service
review.locationRemarks: Excellent Location

review.title: Great hotel for Fisherman's Wharf walking
review.reviewText: Perfect location for our three block walk to our favorite restaurant. As we own an all-electric car, we loved loved the fact that the parking garage had a charger for our car and that the garage is on site and not blocks away. The noon check-out time is more than generous too. Staff was very friendly and accommodating.

review.title: SF getaway
review.reviewText: Internet access within the rooms would be helpful as well as additional seating besides te bed and desk chair. There was a chaise but had no interest in sitting on that as one could only imagine what 'activities' may have occurred on that and just how germ infested it may have been. Plus we did not get hand lotion or even a newspaper.
review.positiveRemarks: Location to wharf (but there are several other hotels on the same block
review.negativeRemarks: No Internet and the exceptionally long walk from the elevator to our room.

review.title: Great Hotel, Excellent location in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: It was an excellent stay in the heart of the Fishermans Wharf in San Francisco. The staff was excellent and were very helpfull when needed, they were always happy to help. This hotel is close to everything and is in a good location, close to all the touristy things. Alot of excellent restaurants to choose from. Cable cars located around the corner. If you like seafood, come to San Francisco. GO 49ers GO!

review.title: great staff
review.reviewText: great super helpful staff, good locationd for toursts, but the hotel badly needs an upgrade. It is definitely not up to Hyatt standards,

review.title: one stop shop
review.reviewText: clean, stylish rooms, comfy, nice tv, great bar/restaurant, great room service..the staff - excellent! very friendly, willing to help, superb service! also has pool and gym - they've got it all...and right near the wharf which is the best of San Fran
review.positiveRemarks: clean, stylish rooms, comfy, nice tv, great bar/restaurant, great room service..the staff - excellent! very friendly, willing to help, superb service!

review.title: Good Alternative for that Area
review.reviewText:
Overall good place to stay in the Fisherman's Warf area, staff very friendly and professional. However the rooms are what you would expect to find in a good road side travel motel, and not in a four star city hotel. More so, from what you would expect from the Hyatt chain. Rooms where modestly decorated and somewhat weathered.
In all fairness the price was a good deal for San Fransisco.

review.title: Great hotel for family
review.reviewText: No surprises, no extra charges, the reviews of the hotel were true!
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Spectacular

review.title: New Years week
review.reviewText: Great location, walking distance from many San Francisco attractions and restaurants.

review.title: It was enjoyable overall.
review.reviewText: We were able to check-in much earlyer than usual due to our early arrival at SFC airport. Your staff were so kind in allowing us to go rest in our own room. We thought this was a special courtesy extended to us by your staff. Thank you.
review.negativeRemarks:
At check-in pillows had some dust pieces and tables/wooden surfaces were not dusted, Perhaps the room
was not used for some time.
review.locationRemarks: Walking around the hotel was fun. It was easy to access restaurants and shopping areas.

review.title: Great Spot, nice rooms, Amazing Staff
review.reviewText:
Great location and very adequate acomodations. The hotel wad in a great spot amd is therefore a little pricier than it should be. Great bed, and very unique shower set up, loved it.

Just want to say a special thanks to the front desk staff, especially Maria (i think that was her name, I appologize buts its been awhile) who was most accomidating, friendly, and really helped my wife and I with the tricky parking situation. Many thanks again for a lovely stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Slightly drab interior colors
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf at the Finest

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Not the most luxurious hotel I stayed in, but it is ideally located and the staff was extremely friendly. The rooms are sober and clean. Great choice for breakfast, I dinned there as well and it was not bad at all.

review.title: Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The staff and their service are super nice!! However, there is no bathtub in our room :( I am also disappointed their breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: There is no bathtub :(
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Good location. That's about it.
review.reviewText: I thought this would be more of an upscale hotel. Often the employees were understaffed, no one new how to use their new television/computer system, the "coffee house" was really just someone in a room that ran over to the restaurant for coffee. There is no "yoga away" program even though it's on the website and was advertised in the room. There was nothing luxurious about the guest room, and the entire first day I had to deal with one issue after another. They tried to make it up with a free breakfast and internet but frankly the best time we had was whenever we were not in the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: My favorite thing about this hotel was the location.
review.negativeRemarks: My least favorite thing about this hotel was everything else. It was not the same hotel that was advertised on line. It was very disappointing.

review.title: It was a nice experience in general.
review.reviewText: The decor seemed to relate to business travelers. It was nice, but a little too "cold" and not relaxing. With only one exception, the staff was very friendly and helpful. Three staff members went out of their way to be extra helpful. The decor related to business travelers, but the location was great for sight seeing.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive parking, decor.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fisherman's Wharf, and not that far from several other attractions and the cable car.

review.title: one of the leader in this bussiness
review.reviewText: I recommend this hotel to anyone who want to come to San Francisco USA.

review.title: Great Experience - Except for the Dirty Pillows
review.reviewText:
The staff were very helpful and accommodating - which I never expected based on other reviews here. There are staff on all fronts - front desk, parking, concierge, and bell - and that was around 11 PM already.

There are some things I need to mention:

1. The room size is ok, but the arrangement of the furnitures made it quite tight to walk around - specially between the table and the bed.

2. The shower has only half a door (glass), so you need to shower carefully otherwise water splashes outside to the toilet.

3. The extra pillows were not replaced - they are dirty - you can see the dirt lining on it.

4. Parking is expensive - but same with other hotels in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: The Pillows!
review.locationRemarks: Great location - near everything!

review.title: disappointing
review.reviewText:
In my opinion, the room was pretty dirty and certainly not typical for a Hyatt. I kept my shoes on and rewashed the hotel glasses. Also, it was a very long walk to the room from the elevators .
We were able to move rooms on the second day and it was slightly cleaner and the proximity to the elevators was more convenient.
The staff, with the exception of two young desk clerks, was generally pleasant and helpful. The concierge and valet were the most professional.
Attention to detail & service was lacking in this hotel. I was looking for a four star experience and I didn't find it there.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking charges

review.title: Might work for sightseeing, not for business
review.reviewText:
While this hotel would be fine for tourists wanting to be at Fisherman's Wharf, it was not a good choice for a business trip. The staff is very friendly and really tries to please but there are so many little things that end up not working.

The room was ok - comfortable bed - but the view is into other wing of rooms. Some of the furniture really needs upkeep - my desk's paint had peeled off a ton - an easy thing to fix but fit with the overall feel of needing a step up in management.

There's room service - but only for breakfast and dinner, no lunch if you're working in your room --- and the wifi situation is dreadful. $9.95 for "standard wifi" that is stunningly slow even for basics like email - if you decide to pay to hefty premium fees charged for their upgraded wifi, the logins don't work.

The inhouse restaurant is ok for breakfast but really limited for lunch and dinner and the food is mediocre (salads in particular just are not good - Cobb salad had barely any of the fixings chicken, egg, bacon etc but cost $14 or so) but there are all the seafood places on the Wharf a short walk away.

There is also no "gift shop" for snacks and they charge $6 for the bottles of Dasani water in your room -- there is a relatively nearby Trader Joe's if you want to get some snacks.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of upkeep, decent wifi and poor quality food
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf & right near cable car

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The front desk staff were amazing and friendly. Breakfast in the hotel has a great variety and the food is good. There is a restaurant across the street but the hotel is better. Slightly more expensive but much better.
review.negativeRemarks: Dishes were left in the hallway for over 20 hours.

review.title: Don't take a car
review.negativeRemarks: parking was outragious, $45 a night plus tax. I know its rediculous everywhere but the hotel guest should get some kind of discount

review.title: wharf hyatt quickie
review.reviewText: The best thing about the hotel has to be its location. Haven't been so SF for the longest time. We lucked out as it is close to pretty much all the things my wife and I were interested in. The fish and chips at Knuckles is even better than the ones I've tried in London. The only issue I had with the hotel has to be the long walk from the elevator to my room and some misleading directions i received from hotel staff. Then again I could have heard wrongly. All in all I would go back.
review.negativeRemarks: 1) Elevators 2) View

review.title: Disappointing at best.
review.reviewText: Not what I would have expected out of a Hyatt. No amenities at all in the room except travel shampoo and conditioner. Beds were not very comfortable. Towels were worn out. No tea/coffee servers or refrigerators in the room. The hair dryer did not work. I could have stayed at the Holiday Inn Express across the street for less money and gotten the same type of room. The only positive about this place is the location...right near Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Great Hotel, closed to everything !!!
review.reviewText: The hotel is at a very good location, the staff was helpfully and the room was clean. I will stay again.

review.title: Excelent choice!!
review.reviewText: Excelent choice, great location and very friendly place and secure.

review.title: Good hotel but..
review.reviewText: All good but..... What's the deal with charging for Internet? Seems like the more expensive the hotel the less likely you are to get free wifi. Take a page from HI Express and other reasonably priced hotels that all offer free wifi.

review.title: Location great for families who want to sightsee
review.reviewText: Location was awesome. Close to everything. I had children and we were able to walk to everything we had wanted to sightsee. The staff was great...the hotel held our bags and called me to let me know when the room was ready as they had let us check in early. On the morning of departure they had arranged for a town car to take us back to the airport (we had to be at the airport by 5 am)
review.negativeRemarks: Had to pay daily for parking ($45)
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: clean rooms
review.reviewText:
My newly wed husband and I were sightly biased because we had just stayed at a hotel in Monterey the night before where the staff was unbelievable. So while the staff here was nice, they paled in comparison to our previous hotel. We unloaded all the luggage from our car after the bellhop almost hit our rental car with the luggage cart. We then paid $50 to park the car for the night. We also brought out luggage to our room, which is no big deal, but at the previous hotel, they insisted on taking it for us out of courtesy.

The hotel is situated within close walking distance of the Pier, which is perfect for dinner. The lobby is beautiful and the rooms are modern and clean, but I would probably look at other hotels before going out of my way to book a room here.

review.title: great deal with unpublished offer
review.reviewText: We had a great time. Great location for Fisherman's Wharf area stay. Great surprise with this Expedia special rate un named hotel booking. Only negative might be the room had two double beds but we didn't larger beds. Valet parking was additional $45.

review.title: The location was convienient and met our needs
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly and the location was great.
review.positiveRemarks: location was excellent to Piers for dining and shopping
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: Wonderful stay.
review.reviewText: Perfect location. Staff was more than helpful. Highly recommend. Thanks Expedia.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is well situated, just a few minutes to cable car or Fishermans wharf. Easy access to golden gate. Plenty of dining option nearby. The bar/restaurant attached to the Hotel is really cool, recommend the pork shoulder.

review.title: You Don't Get Much For Your Money
review.reviewText:
This place was ok, out of all the hotels we stayed at during our trip this was the only one that didn't offer free wifi. We knew that going in but in this day and age free wifi should be standard. It had a laundry room which was handy to clean our clothes. The Fishermans wharf area was nice and we had a easy walk to it from our hotel. Not the biggest rooms but they were ok. There is a bar/restaraunt attached to the hotel, this was good to watch sport or grab a bite to eat. You are also very close to the starting point of the hop on hop off buses.
Overall maybe we expected something a bit better from the Hyatt and for the money that we paid.
Also there are no fridges in the room but we saw one being delivered to someones room. So you can ask for a fridge but we only found out by accident.

There are many homeless people here but they are harmless.
review.positiveRemarks: Having a laundry and bar/restaraunt onsite.
review.negativeRemarks: No free wifi and small rooms.
review.locationRemarks: The location in very good, easy to get to Fishermans Wharf and the main tourist sections in the area.

review.title: Needs some guidance ...
review.reviewText: Our room was never completely cleaned ... Drinking glasses were never changed ... Beds were never completely made, the decorative blankets and pillows were thrown on the back of the sitting chair even when we place them back on the bed or asked to have them put on beds... Yet the bellmen, hostess & servers in the restaurant & the gentlemen at the valet parking couldn't be nicer or more helpful ... Front desk personal listened and did nothing ... Not one of the best hotels we've stayed at, and will never stay here again ...
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk including manager & housekeeper ...
review.locationRemarks: Great location near everything

review.title: Choose this hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, Room has everything you could think of and the beds are very comfortable.

review.title: Hotel Experience
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, hotel looked exactly like it did in the online pictures, good buffet breakfast, great location.

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: really enjoyed our stay.Great location for accessibility to tours etc. Especially if you want to beat the lines for the cable car.

review.title: Our recent holiday
review.reviewText: A very good location for all activities in SF. Rooms without comfortable storage and hanging space for clothing. Coffee provided in rooms awful, no fridges.Sorry, not 4* hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: No fridge

review.title: Excellent choice for sightseeing
review.reviewText: Very lovely room. We actually were upgraded to a deluxe room upon arrival (nice surprise!) Convenient to everything. Would highly recommend the Hyatt as a fabulous retreat in San Francisco.

review.title: Great Time
review.reviewText: The location for attractions and ease for connections was great. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful for any and all requests. Only regret is the pool closes at 9 pm but I understand with liabilities in todays environment. Overall great experience.

review.title: recommended
review.reviewText: Would recommend this hotel for first timers in San Fran. Walk, ride, drive.

review.title: Good safe location
review.reviewText: Expensive for what it was but it is situated in the main tourist area of San Fransisco and that is what you pay for.
review.locationRemarks: Safe, with lots of options for eating out.

review.title: Close by hotel
review.reviewText:
Overall was ok, eveything was close by.
Car parking charge was high, no free nternet in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet parking staff were not helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: asome
review.reviewText: great service love it!!!was very clean really frienly best place to stay
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: san fran
review.reviewText: nice hotel close to the wharf! overall a very pleasing stay
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: Nice refuge
review.reviewText: Did not like billing. We had to sign off on charges such as a free breakfast and the discount was made later. I understand signing is a commitment to pay so this was very strange. And our bill at the end of our stay needed adjusting(but they did do it). A bit too much street noise for 4 star. Also not enough towels for 4 people. Also something was not completed after every servicing such as no coffee replaced. Nevertheless good value for our Expedia rate and a comfortable refuge from the city with nice amenities like the pool and gym and a delicious breakfast to suit lots.

review.title: Not normal hyatt quality
review.reviewText: Staff friendly and helpful.. For the price of the room, the furniture was beaten up and beds were not of high standards in comfort. The $45 charge for overnight parking was extreme. Most costly hotel of the week of our vacation and the least comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: At least it a had a pool.
review.negativeRemarks: Furniture ie: desk, chairs...looks like a hundred kids left their wet swimsuits on them.

review.title: Very nice hotel for families
review.reviewText: Our family of five including two teens and a 20 year old stayed in adjoining rooms, one king and one with 2 doubles, for three weekend nights. The hotel is in a great location in that it's close but not too close to Fisherman's Wharf and has easy access to sight seeing buses, Powell/Hyde cable car turnaround, bay criuses, biking over golden gate bridge to sausalito, the alcatraz ferry and transportation to the rest of the city. The hotel and restaurant staff were very friendly and helpful. The conceirge was friendly and provided some great restaurant recommendations - one seafood at the wharf and one in chinatown. I thought the hotel was reasonably priced for comparable hotels. We had their breakfast buffet at Knuckles, the hotel restaurant on two mornings. The food was very good with many choices and was also reasonably priced at $20pp compared to the other comparable hotels we stayed which had a high of $32pp. We saw many other families with all aged children staying at the hotel. Only negative comments were the hallway and room carpeting could use some updating and the green paint in the hallway made it them seem a little dark. The lobby and other common areas of the hotel were very nice. Walked out to see the pool but did not have time to use it - people at pool areas seemed to enjoy it. As other reviews have noted, remember that parking rates at this and any hotel in the area are high, this one was $45 per night.
review.positiveRemarks: location for tourist attractions and convenience of a nice restaurant with a breakfast buffet
review.negativeRemarks: only comment was room and hall carpeting could us updating but it always seemed clean - not really a signficant issue
review.locationRemarks: great location for access to all tourist attractions in the area and access to the rest of the city via cable car, cab or tour bus.

review.title: Very convenient, very friendly, very good hotel
review.reviewText:
Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf
The Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf is very convenient to local waterfront attractions, public transportation (bus, streetcar, trolley) and a variety of very good restaurants. The hotel/service staff were very friendly and very accomodating, as good as anywhere I have ever stayed during my travels. The room itself lacks a bit of ambiance. Would describe as very common business travel room accomodations. Colors and furniture are business focused, not resort style accomodations. That being said room was clean, quiet and beds were very comfortable. The area is very safe for walking anytime of the day so that met all our families needs. We had breakfast every morning in the hotel restaurant (offers large buffet) and the food was good. Don't know I would have paid full price for the buffet but booked hotel deal through Expedia that included breakfast for just a little more, a great deal. I would definately stay there again. We have stayed at the Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf and this is much better. The 4.5 stars review is spot on.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel staff very accomodating, very friendly and genuinely seemed to have good time serving customers
review.negativeRemarks: Room lacked a bit of ambiance, traditional business hotel room
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf, public transporation and some very good restaurants.

review.title: Better Places to Stay in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
The location of the hotel was perfect...close to everything in Fisherman's Wharf. That is about the only positive comment I can make about the hotel. Overall, the hotel was dirty and worn. Stained carpet and upholstery in our room and in common areas. The furniture had scratches, dents and was in need of refinishing.

Although the hotel staff was friendly, the service was dreadful. Every request would require at least three calls and very long waits...for simple things, like more towels at the pool. We stayed there five nights and had to request more "in-room" coffee to be brought to our room each day. The housekeeping staff would not replenish it.

In summary, the hotel was not typical of the Hyatt properties we've stayed in over the years. However, our family made the best of it and enjoyed our visit to San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel needs a good cleaning!

review.title: Great location to see the sights along the Wharf
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, friendly and accommodating staff. Walking distance to the Fisherman's Wharf area, cable car, city and tour bus stops nearby, grocery and great sightseeing just a couple blocks away.
review.positiveRemarks: Great access to everything we wanted to see and do along the Wharf. Comfy bed and modern design. The hotel soaps smell great.
review.negativeRemarks: Pricey overnight parking. Shower floor needed a scrub.
review.locationRemarks: 2 blocks from shore. Walkable to Ghirardelli Square one way and Pier 39 fireworks show the other. Trader Joe's/Safeway one block up. Good location.

review.title: Comfortable, Good Location
review.reviewText:
This is a good hotel in a good location. Comfortable, quiet rooms with good temperature control.

But they do charge extra for almost every little thing. It is not really a luxury hotel or an economy hotel.

The pool and Jacuzzi are very nice. But the hours make no sense. It opens at 7AM but closes way too early at 9PM. Clearly if they open at 7AM they are not concerned about disturbing the neighbors. 8AM-10PM or even 9AM-11PM would make more sense.

The layout is a bit odd. It is not a tall building. But they offer no stairs! (The stairway doors are all locked!) You are forced to take an elevator even to go up one floor! And the elevator stops one level below the lobby, so you have to climb stairs to get out of the elevator anyway!

I would stay here again. But I think the managers could make it even better if they made those easy changes. And if they would not be so stingy with basic services! At least offer free wi-fi!
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet, comfortable room. Good temperature control. Comfortable beds. Nice pool and Jacuzzi. Great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Pool and Jacuzzi closed way too early in the evening. No stairs! Charges for basic services like Wi-Fi.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal location for Fisherman's Wharf. Close to F and 30 transit lines. Not too far to walk to Chinatown and North Beach.

review.title: Fine hotel, mind the valet parking cost.
review.reviewText:
As you would expect with a Hyatt hotel, we had a pleasant stay. We got the room on a super saver deal. The room was on the smaller side but still room enough to move around the two queen beds. The staff were friendly, the location was great for tourists as things are easy to walk to, however Fisherman's Wharf on a weekend is not somewhere you'd stay if you didn't have to. So. Many. Tourists.
The hotel walls are a little thin, but this wasn't a huge issue. My biggest complaint about the hotel is the cost of valet. Over $50 per night inc tax!!! It's outrageous! Two nights valeting at this hotel cost me more that the rest of the valeting in the two week trip put together! There are no alternatives either so you're stuck with it. I will acknowledge that the other hotels have similar valet costs.
Otherwise, the hotel was fine. We didn't eat here as there are plenty of options close by.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet parking costs are HUGE.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient walking distance to touristy San Francisco.

review.title: Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco
review.reviewText: A very good hotel which is only a short walk from Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf. Staff were helpful when we arrived and allowed us to park our hire car temporarily outside the main entrance while we dropped our luggage off so to avoid getting a ticket. Our room was clean and comfortable and the hotel gym was also very good.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, quality of the room and the gym
review.locationRemarks: Just a short walk from Fisherman's Wharf and Little Italy

review.title: good fisherman's wharf location
review.reviewText:
The check in staff and the concierge both seemed lack lustre and uninterested and appeared to "rather be somewhere else". Particularly the concierges on at the time had less information on where to go in San Francisco for a drink with a good view than my husband had researched. On one morning, upon passing the concierge desk, he was slumped in his chair, yawning.

The location of the hotel is very good, though no view whatsoever as it is only 4 storeys high.

Bar and breakfast is expensive considering what is offered.
review.positiveRemarks: close to trolley car starting point
review.negativeRemarks: disinterested staff

review.title: Great stay!

review.title: Experience
