review.title: Great location-staff but beware wifi nickleanddime
review.reviewText:
staff great friendly- concierge was fantastic -a young man
1 issue their fees for wi fi access and internet are ridiculous and almost a deal breaker- $15 for 20 minutes in the business center is insane (just to print out boarding passes) and 12 bucks a day in your room is also a rip off. This is an expensive hotel in a touristy part of town so I expect to pay some premiums but we stayed in a Clarion in San Jose after SF with free wi fi as most hotels now give- just because I can pay it doesn't mean I should or want to.

the only other nick was the shower was a little lacking
review.negativeRemarks: wi fi-nickel and dime charges

review.title: Bad mattress and shower
review.reviewText:
We had a room with a king size bed. The mattress was evidently well used as it had two distinct "depressions". There was no bathtub, only a shower with a shower head that came out of the ceiling making it difficult for me to shower without getting water in my ruptured eardrum.

The staff was very courtious and attentive.

We use a white washcloth and alcohol to quickly wipe down all hotel rooms and found this one to be about average in cleanliness with others. It was no cleaner then rooms for which we paid much less.

We have stayed in much nicer hotels for less money elsewhere, but this may be the standard for this part of the country.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower and worn mattress

Breakfast buffet was nice.

review.title: Good clean hotel in Fisherman's Wharf

This hotel is a good choice if you want to stay in the Touristy area and the staff are very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Spring break with 2 teenagers, had a great time!
review.reviewText: Everything was great. The restaurant Knuckles was overpriced, service was fair to poor however we only ate there 2 times: evening arrived due to rain and morning leaving which also was raining. I would not recommend eating at the hotel but the hotel was very clean, easy location to many attractions.
review.positiveRemarks: water in lobby but wish they had it available all day and evening.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant
review.locationRemarks: Good location to everything, just short walk to wharf, 2 cable car locations.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: The furniture in our room was all marked up and scratched and very tired looking, needs complete replacement. The shower was sooo weak that we needed to cup our hands for water and bath that way, ridiculous!!!!! Also, they are trying for contemporary design so shower only had ONE half enclosed in glass the other half completely open with the design, they assumed water never splashes out BUT IT does. Use your towels to clean the floor from shower splash. All in all, a pain and discomfort for that money. Also, very dark hotel, halls and room.
review.negativeRemarks: shower pressure and darkness, not enough light any where except for front lobby
review.locationRemarks: ok

review.title: Maybe 3 stars
review.reviewText: The first suprise was the 45 dollar parking. The bed was pretty hard and the pillows felt like rocks. The room was fairly nice and clean except for a spider under the pillow. This seemed more like a 3 star experience than a 4 star one.

review.title: Dreadful furniture and bath but staff is friendly
review.reviewText:
The walls in the hallway on our floor were scratched up and dingy. In our room, the furniture looked extremely cheap and it was terribly scratched. It wasn't at all what I would expect from a Hyatt Hotel. I had always stayed in Hilton hotels and thought this one would be comparable. Well, it didn't come close.
The bathroom door wasn't even a real door. It was two sliding doors and you could see daylight around it. No privacy. My husband would leave to use the lobby restroom. The shower had marble on the floor, big safety issue there, and the shower head was mounted to the ceiling of the shower so it poured down on your head. It was almost impossible to rinse my hair without feeling like I was drowning. Since there was no curtain or door on the shower, you had to reach around a glass partition to turn on the water and there was no way to not get wet doing that. Also, there was no hook or knobs or anything to hang clothes or a towel on in the bathroom. You couldn't hang up your towel to dry so it could be re-used.

The whole place needs an over-haul. Period. The only redeeming quality was the staff. They were incredibly friendly and went out of their way to make our stay worry-free. The concierge was friendly and knowledgeable. The restaurant had decent food. Oh, one other nasty surprise...no coffee maker in the room! I switched from a boutique hotel to this one so I would have coffee in the morning!! I'm giving it a 2 because of the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom, beat-up, cheap furniture
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location couple of blocks from Pier 39, Walgreens, restaurants, shopping, transportation. Everything is within walking distance.

review.title: Wonderful stay!
review.reviewText: Super friendly staff in a fabulous location to shops, the wharf and restaurants! Very clean and well kept. Would stay there again with out a doubt.

review.title: Beds rock, in a good way

The room lacked in cleanliness. Cobwebs visible, you could tell where the cleaning staff started and stopped. Great location... Just need to work on the room cleaning.

The bed was very clean and very comfortable

review.title: No in room coffee pot!!

review.title: Great stay.

My only complaint was that you could hear people talking and laughing while going down the hallway at 3 a.m. - the door was not very soundproof. But all in all, we liked the hotel very much.

review.title: Excellent price, service and location!
review.reviewText: Excellent price, service and location! Will certainly come back... Travelled with a large family including one baby and children... three rooms and all pleased. However the restaurant may do some improvements in food quality...

review.positiveRemarks: quiet room, arrangement of room, location

review.title: Usually you ask for wake-up calls.
review.reviewText:
Parking: $45 per day plus tax. Ridiculous. Slow valet.

First day: Woken up by intercom blaring about fire drill. Then fire drill for 20 minutes. No more sleep or consideration.

Second day: Housekeeper decided to bang on the door until someone answered and ask when we were checking out. Another annoying wake up call.

The room: The bathroom looks as if it's ready to fall down. Steam stains are gross. Our room was on the 2nd floor and we could hear every car driving by and people can look right into the room unless the curtains are all drawn, thus depriving me of natural light.

Restaurant: Choose a theme or bring in a chain restaurant.

Star Rating: I don't know how hotels earn star ratings, but I would suggest a rescore. I stayed at a Best Western the next night and I felt it was much better.
review.locationRemarks: The location may be the only redeeming quality of this hotel. But there are lots of three star hotels on the same street. Go go Holiday Inn Express!

review.title: Exceptional service
review.reviewText: The staff were incredibly pleasant and helpful, from the bellman to the front desk, the consierge, dining room staff, and Housekeeping. It's a few short blocks' walk to the Wharf. Excellent breakfast buffet.We will definitely stay here again!

review.title: Fisherman's Warf Hyatt
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location and everyone was very nice and accomodating. Room was nice, no complaints. The hallways were a little drab with the dark green colors and carpet. For a Hyatt, I would expect it would have been a little more upscale. I dont think I would stay there again, although for the area, it was definintely one of the better-looking. I think I would stay downtown to get a higher-end experience.
review.negativeRemarks: I didnt really like the set up. Other Hyatts I have stayed at have been much nicer.

review.title: Try the Hyatt
review.reviewText: The food was delicious, room service was great and efficient. Laundry room was good to use but, ventilation was bad. All staff was very hospitable and helpfull. The concierge was very knowledgable and informative with happenings around the Wharf.
review.positiveRemarks: Room service, Food, location to the Wharf
review.negativeRemarks: No Pool (Out of Service)
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location, didn't have to walk far to get to the Wharf and Cable car was right around the corner.

review.title: Altogether, a good stay
review.reviewText: Our family stayed for only 3 days/3 nights & just want to explore the city on foot, cable car so Hyatt's location is very convenient. Near Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf, Cable car roundabout (behind the hotel). We also atched the NutCracker ballet & my husband forgot to bring a formal belt so it was good to know ROSS store is just behind Hyatt :-) Good breakfast buffet came with our room (cooked to order omelettes) & Knuckles hostess Elizabeth (Filipina) is very friendly, same with our server Wilfredo (Latino from Honduras) who loved meeting people, making them comfortable, very professional. Minor things we didn't like...WiFi is not free :-( but that's all.
review.negativeRemarks: Wi-Fi is not free

very clean and comfort hotel.

review.title: Great great experience!!
review.reviewText: First time in SF and this hotel couldn't be better! Location is just amazing!! Walking distance from major attractions: cable car stop, fishermans wharf and all the piers as well as the ghiardelli plaza,Starbucks and even Walgreens. Pretty hotel, clean and yummy breakfast too! I would totally stay here again, super friendly staff that even let me borrow a microwave to sterilize my baby's bottles. Super experience!
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, has everything: shopping, eating and entertainment.

review.title: SF in three days!!!
review.reviewText: Staff was very nice....

review.title: Great location, walking distance from the locations that we book all our tours
review.reviewText: Great

review.title: "Good but not Great"
review.reviewText: The hotel is well located in/to Fisherman's Wharf and a close walk to North Beach, China Town, etc. I found the service good at the lower end (bell boys, vallet, servers, etc., but the check in service was stiff and unfriendly. On the last day I stopped to ask a question to a person at the front desk but was quickly blown off to another person who was on the phone. Perhaps it was an omen of things to come as the same night a party in the next room began around 11 pm and was still going on when I checked out around 4:30 am. Repeated calls did raise security but after two warning it was apparent these partyer's were in the for the long haul. Otherwise the experience was a good one with even a small yet clear view of the water....
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is a bit touristy but has most everything worth seeing within walking or public transportation distance. After 1-3 days one can rent a car and see the outlying parts of the city and county or head for the wine country or Muir Woods, etc. This is my 10th or 11th tiem to San Francisco and I never get tired of it. It is interesting to note that walking on the street I heard many languages other than Englsih and not limited to Chinese and Italian.

review.title: Great location, walking distance to lots of fun.
review.reviewText: Good rate, clean hotel, great location for seeing the entire city.
review.locationRemarks: Chintown, Market Street, Alamo Square, Fisherman's Wharf, Marina Green.

review.title: Deb n Mike loved the Hyatt
review.reviewText: Our location was perfect for visiting the wharf, catching the bus to the 49ers game and restaurants. The beds and pillows were awesome!!!! wanted to take them home. Hotel staff were pleasant and responsive....thanks for the oppty to stay there.

review.title: Conveniently located
review.reviewText: Exceeded expectations
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, shopping. Fisherman's Wharf, ability to walk eveywhere

review.title: Great Price, Great Hotel
review.reviewText: I was impressed with the professionalism of the staff. They obviously are guest oriented ..... very friendly. They were ready to help in any way they can. The front desk, bell desk, valet, maintenance, and restaurant staff were exceptional. I felt pampered. Room was very clean. I would definitely recommended this Hotel to visitors to SF.
review.locationRemarks: I highly recommended seeing Beach Blanket Babylon in North Beach. It is a hilarious and uplifting show. It is not far from the Hotel. North Beach has some wonderful restaurants and beautiful churches. Enjoyed lunch at Alioto's on Fisherman's Wharf close by the Hotel. For foodies, Gary Danko is a restaurant which is a must, also not far from the Hotel. Make reservations far in advance or ask to be on a wait list. At the Wharf, don't miss the delicious crab, shrimp, clam chowder, and sour dough bread. Boudin's (bakery, restaurant, and shop) is a fun experience. So many more places. SF is a unique and wonderful city!

review.title: We want to go back.
review.reviewText:
We had a great stay at the Hyatt at Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf.

The employees at Registration were all extremely friendly and helpful as well as the Valets.

I was not impressed with the Concierge. When I approached her desk she was working on the computer and she did not acknowledge me. Once she did acknowledge me she did not have the information I was looking for (in regards to Chinatown).

The only complaint about the condition of the hotel was that the hallways needed to be vacuumed. But our room looked great.

This was a great location for us. It was just a short walk to the Wharf and a little further to Pier 39.

We would not hesitate to stay here again.

review.title: Sweet
review.reviewText: Nice

review.title: Mili
review.reviewText: Location nice...service good...next to all touring services...

review.title: Really enjoyable stay
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hyatt for one week in October 2011. The room was really clean and comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful. There was an offer on the buffet breakfast which was excellent value. We had an inward facing room that was really quiet, Fishermans Wharf was a great base for getting about especially as the cable cars are close by,

review.title: Perfect location!
review.reviewText: It's a brand new renovated hotel in a contemporary style within the perfect location!

review.title: Great base to explore San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The Hyatt delivers all you would expect from a large hotel chain, rooms were modern and clean and the service was efficient and friendly. The hotel is in an ideal location to explore San Francisco with many attractions within walking distance and good access to transport links to travel further afield.

Top 3 holiday highlights:
1. Angel Island is a great day out with stunning views and plenty of picnic spots and photo opportunities. Perfect if the sun is shining
2. Farmers Market days at the ferry building - beautiful produce and a real buzz about the place
3. 49ers game. Tickets organized through the hotel concierge. Cheap and easy to get to on the local bus service. Great atmosphere and a lot of fun
review.locationRemarks: Sausalito - nice boat ride across the bay and a great mix of shops, restaurants and bars

review.title: Not look like a Hyatt hotel at all..!!!
review.reviewText: Very expensive for the kind of hotel it is. Others hotels in the area look better from the outside than this one. Lobby not nice at all. Front desk very small, there is just two written desks and no more. People there not help full at all. Concierge never available in four times we look for him. Just from the moment we entered, we were very disappointment. Room size was ok, and also bathroom but furniture is not good or nice. First day no one glass in the room. Second day no one towel in the room (I called front desk asking for it and they did not help me, I had to look for the cleaning lady and she was rude). Third day keys did work out and a friend who tried to call me could not communicate even though he had our room number. Area is not good, I rather Union Square. Many restaurants around are small, bad, and very expensive. It is possible to find better restaurants down town and not that expensive, and with good service! Everything closes early at night, Pier 39 around 9pm is desolated. San Francisco is a great city to now, many places to visit and great views, but look for an other area and other hotel if you you want to be at 100% satisfy.
review.locationRemarks: I recommend Union Square because shopping is good there. There are many good restaurants and prices are good related with quality. Sausalito is great to walk. We drove to Carmel and the place is fantastic, high level..! great golf courses, great shopping, great houses. Excellent place to visit.

review.title: Over Rated
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 3 nights whilst in San Francisco and location yes was pretty good to Fishermans Wharf and there was a great little resturant accross the road, but the hotel was just to big getting in and out of room to front etc. Had to pay for TV, no free Wi Fi and expensive for parking.

review.title: Good Location, Clean Rooms
review.reviewText: This Hyatt's staff were wecloming and attentive. Rooms were clean and updated baths very nice. The towels were very low grade for a Hyatt. Location good, no view but fine.

review.title: Loved Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText:
Hotel was great. Excellent location, would much prefer to stay at Fishermans wharf as opposed to Union Square having kids much better location.
Staff were very friendly & helpful.

review.title: Not as nice as expected, but ok
review.reviewText: The hotel was a little older and not as close to the water as I expected. The staff was very helpful and friendly, but the facilities were not as high rate as I had expected.

review.title: A hotel that relies on its name and doesn't try very hard
review.reviewText:
It's a Hyatt. For me a little up itself, it thinks it's great so doesn't seem to try very hard.
Not the cheapest hotel but charges for internet access in the lobby, not sure why.
Good location though, although we would have to demolish a building to get the sea view we were told we had!

review.title: good value
review.reviewText: You can't beat the location. Right in the Wharf area, clean, and very comfortable.

review.title: Great central location for Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
We stayed here for 3 nights before picking a car up and moving on.
We used the pool and hot tub several times. The outside pool was heated to a comfortable temperature. We used the hotel sports bar/restaurant which was pretty good and reasonable - around 15$ for a main. My student kids loved it.
Fisherman's wharf is only 5 minutes away and sites such as Lombard St and Telegraph hill are easily walkable for fit people.
We liked the hotel - recommended

review.title: Great location but some improvement needed
review.reviewText: The checkin process went smoothly. with friendly, efficient staff. However the lift system in this hotel is odd. In order to access the main bank of lifts you need to go down two flights of stairs which proves difficult when dragging luggage behind you. There is only one small lift accessible from the registration lobby. It operates on the same calling system as the main bank of lifts and it's impossible to call this lift independly. Subsequently it never shows up when required. Room itself was fine but lacking in information that is vital to travellers. No rates or details for the use of the in-house phone system, no information about internet rates or business centre access. no information on the location or even presence of a guest laundry etc. The furniture was looking a little bashed about and there were no luggage racks availble to place luggae on ( a problem we found in most US and Canadian hotels). Minor details but they show an overall lack of attention to detail. No minibar or refrigeration available. A coffee maker was available but only one paper cup for two occupants and this was never replenished in the whole week we were there. No refrigeration means no milk for tea or coffee and no method of boiling water for tea other than using the coffee maker which taints the tea water. Similar issues with the steam iron - nothing to use to fill it with water. Overall the location is great and handy to everything San Francisco has to offer.

review.title: We enjoyed the Hyatt because of its great location.
review.reviewText: Good hotel in a great location! My only comment is that the bed could have been more comfortable.

review.title: Good Value, Good Location
review.reviewText: Good location and decent hotel, although I had to wait a day to get the room I originally booked. Remote didn't work, the bath could have been cleaner, but it was adequate for three days on business.

review.title: Would go back any day of the week!
review.reviewText: Considering that this hotel is a fantastic hotel- I would prefer to see and pay a more reasonabl valet parking cost.

review.title: Good Pool, Great location
review.reviewText: Good hotel, really convenient location, but buy your breakfast over the road at the Hollywood Cafe - better and cheaper!

review.title: Great Time
review.reviewText: Loved the location of this hotel. Close to everything we wanted to see and do. Customer Service was great with friendly staff always there to help when needed. Nicely decorated rooms. The beds were so comfortable. We ate quite a few times at the restaurant in the hotel. the food and service was very good. Overall experience was great.

review.title: Lovely hotel in good location for main San Francisco tourist sites
review.reviewText:
This was a very comfortable hotel in a location very convenient for Alcatraz, old fashioned street cars and Fisherman's Wharf.

Staff at the check in desk were very efficient and helpful. We asked for a quiet room and they made sure that was the case. Porters and doors staff were also very friendly and couldn't do enough to help.

There is a great independent diner - Hollywood Cafe - across the road which did a lovely breakfast, good value, excellent service. They also do lunches there.

Fisherman's Wharf itself is very commercial and not our favourite place but would still choose the Hyatt because it was such a pleasant stay and well located for other attractions.

We also did the Hop on/off guided tour bus which was worthwhile and the first stop is very convenient to the Hyatt.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location and the team at the hotel was great

review.title: loved san fran
review.reviewText: we stayed at the hyatt for 3 nights for our first time in san francisco. The hotel was perfect and in a good location. we loved san francisco and would stay again. the only negative was no complimentary wifi in the room or hotel.

review.title: Just perfect
review.reviewText: In 1 word I describe this hotel, "perfect"

review.title: At great place to stay
review.reviewText: Hotel is great but you pay for everything, no extras, no little perks to make the expense worth it. If you are passing through pick up a new rent car when you are ready to leave. Valet is crazy expensive and there is no need to drive in SF.

review.title: would return!!
review.reviewText:
very convenientlylocated for many attractions i.e. the wharf, trolleys, alcatraz
Nice restaurant/bar part of the hotel.......good for a meal or a pre-dinner drink before a night out........very friendly and helpful servers/bartenders who can give you suggestions about places to go in town

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Modern style hotel, nice, clean and close to wharf. Nice staff, too.

review.title: Cozy comfort
review.reviewText: The hotel and room were fabulous overall. Central to all the action on Fisherman's Wharf, within walking distance of the Ferry Building, and steps away from the Cable Car stop, it's a great place to stay. Despite being in the middle of a busy district, our room was quiet and peaceful. Amenities on site were great, the workout centre was well equipped and clean, and the pool was nice too. The only challenge was the space was a bit tight for 3 travellers. However, having stayed at other hotels near Fisherman's Wharf, I think this is going to happen anywhere. Although the beds were only double, they were really comfortable. Flat screen televisions and a clean, quiet room made our space a restful retreat from all the tourist action.

review.title: Hyatt at Fishermans Wharf Review
review.reviewText: I enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt but we were not told that you have to pay for parking which is 45,00 per day plus a parking tax. I believe this is something that should of been disclosed up front. Other than that the hotel is very nice and clean and it's close to all the attractions.

review.title: Close to all the ACTION !!!
review.reviewText: Nice well maintained hotel that is walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 and Ghiradelli Square. Restaurants are pricey, but Hollywood Cafe across the street is great for Breakfast and lunch...large portions and great breakfast options....Great shopping @ Pier 39 and found a new store that sells only bamboo products very cool and environmentally conscious just opened last week...kids had a blast @ the Mirror maze.

review.title: too many fees $$$
review.reviewText: great location but too many extra fees. $5 for the water bottles in room. $50 for internet access and $45/nt for parking. Ridic.

review.title: Right in the Heart of the Action
review.reviewText:
This was a beautiful, modern hotel, close to all the attractions, yet very quiet in the room. Very clean and well maintained. I was very glad to have chosen to stay here. Loved having computer access in the lobby to check in for our flight and print our boarding passes. All staff was very friendly and helpful.

The cable car turn around was right outside, Fisherman's Wharf just 2 short blocks away, food available everywhere you looked. The Hollywood Cafe across the street had a wonderful breakfast menu, The fresh fruit was to die for. Loved the Boudin Bakery. People were literally fighting to get in there.

Did NOT like that our courtyard room looked out on a ROOFor that it faced other rooms where other people could look in your windows if you opened the shades. Also hated that the room we were given was so far from the elevator. Didn't want to walk half a mile to my room after a long day of walking. Have to say I wondered if they gave us a less desirable room because we booked through Expedia.

review.title: Perfect location and would stay again
review.reviewText: Myself and my husband stayed at the Hyatt for 3 nights , our room was very clean and comfortable , bed was extremely comfortable. Staff were very polite and friendly , not just on check in but every time we came and went from the hotel. Our room was cleaned every day of our stay , towels and linens are only changed daily if you ask for them to be (I did not as did not see the point). There is a bar/restaurant attached to the hotel where you can get breakfast but we chose not to , instead we walked across the street to the "Hollywood Cafe" and had breakfast , the menu had the usual pancakes , omelette , bagels etc and very reasonably priced. We were less than a 5 minute walk from pier 39 , we also had a bus stop on the street which we rode to take a look around Pacific heights , we even walked to Lombard and the "crookedest street" from the hotel which took around 15 minutes. A lot of reviews I read on this hotel before booking mentioned street noise , we had a room that overlooked the street and the cafe across the street and I have to say that street noise did not keep me awake , from around 6/6.30am the traffic becomes more frequent but not so much that you can hear nothing else , and if you are staying in any Wharf location hotel you are going to have the same issue. Overall I would say that this is a great location and a great city to visit , even with young kids. On this occasion we were without our young kids as this was an anniversary break for us.

review.title: Yuji
review.reviewText: Hard to find the entrance. No bathtub.

review.title: Exceeded Expectations
review.reviewText: Hotel was Fantastic. Staff were always smiling and ready to help. Couldn't ask for a better location.

review.title: Good Location, Nice Room
review.reviewText: Very good location within walking distance of most sights. Room was nice and service was pretty good. Only complaint was the shower which had no door, sprayed at an akward angle, and had very little hot water.

review.title: loved it
review.reviewText:
would go back in a heart beat
clean, spacious
the bathroom was huge
with the coffee maker in the room and frige
it made it very comfortable

review.title: Rough start, but overall a great visit.
review.reviewText: Our visit started out a little rough. We arrived late on a busy weekend, and the room I requested was not available. However, after the first night, the management moved us to superior room, and then everyone went out of their way to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. This hotel is in a great location for enjoying everything SanFrancisco has to offer. I hope to stay here again soon.

review.title: Great trip! Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful. Very clean in lobby, rooms, and public areas. Heated pool and hot tub were a great place to relax at the end of the day. Only complaint is information from hotel staff about restaurants was incorrect. One restaurant was described as family-oriented, but was more fine dining, another was recommended for "American" cuisine, but was all seafood. Just minor disappointments. We had an 8-yr-old with us and it was great for kids too. Lots to do within walking distance or public transportation. Felt safe and secure in the area, even at night.

review.title: A basic hotel room
review.reviewText:
This hotel is a safe bet if all you need is a clean bed and bathroom. Even though its billed as a luxery hotel, its pretty much the same as a Holiday Inn Express, except that HI Express is a lot cheaper.

The Hyatt location is great -- close to Fisherman's Wharf. We stayed there because it has a pool. Several downsides: $18 for breakfast! We walked across the street to the Hollywood cafe for a fraction of the price and better food and service. $50/day for parking. $10/day for internet.

review.title: Location is main attraction.
review.reviewText: Undoubtedly, location is THE reason to stay at this hotel. The positives, besides great location for a family with children, is are a very good consigne who gave us great information (use the weekday consigne...NOT the weekend warriors who know much less) and a friendly staff who attend to your needs. The negatives, FOR THIS PRICE, are the small room, tiny bathtub, NO view of ANYTHING but other sides of building, no refrig., and you pay FOR EVERYTHING...and I mean EVERYTHING extra...including internet service. Only one restuarant which I would not recommend, no store, and no indoor pool. Also, we asked for a poolside room which we did not receive. However, you can literally walk to everything you need (breakfast restuarants, Drug store, all muni transportation means, wharf, stores, etc). Strongly recommend you buy a muni pass for 3, 5, or 7 days as you can ride ALL transportation except double-decker buses and BART. Great plaace for fish and dinner is Alioto's on the Wharf and cable cars located right behind hotel. Muirs Woods and Alcatraz are good tours. Television stations are terrible, so I would bring a portable DVD player and tapes unless you want to spend 15. for a movie. Otherwise, great, safe location..... but you will pay for it.

review.title: Great room for the price
review.reviewText: We were impressed with the quality of the room for the price we paid.

review.title: "Can't wait to go back",
review.reviewText: It was great to stay in nice service and clean hotel with kids.

review.title: San Francisco here I come!
review.reviewText: This hotel is top notch. from the room, to the front desk, and the staff. The one complaint is the Sunday brunch. We chose not to purchase the vbuffet, and we ordered off of the menu. Our order was lost, the staff was so busy helping folks that were "self service" our coffee cups went dry repeatedly.

review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText:
Nice, clean hotel, in a good location for Fisherman's Wharf. Whilst the room (and the double beds!) weren't as large as I had experienced on my American trip, it was acceptable.

Only negatives worth commenting on was the in room coffee machine and supplies was poor and after every other hotel providing free WiFi it was annoying (and expensive) to have to pay for WiFi at the Hyatt. Also, despite requesting a 'room with a view' we ebded up with an inside room which had a view of a roof

review.title: Excellent Hotel. but expensive parking
review.reviewText: Great hotel, fantatic location just a shame about parking costs over $100 for two nights

review.title: Just what we were expecting.
review.reviewText: Thyis hotel met our needs and was centrally located to our destinations.

review.title: Good but a few issues
review.reviewText:
The cleanliness, service, and location of this hotel are great. The hotel is within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf and there are many restaurants at different price levels in the immdiate area. It's also wIthin waking distance of the ferry landing for the Alcatraz tour.

The price we got for the room was good but there are some gotchas. First, if you're driving the parking at the hotel was very expensive at about a third of our room rate per night. There were public lots within a block and a half but even they were pretty expnsive. I understand parking in SF is expensive but if you're already a hotel guest I don't see why you should pay so much to use a lot that is owned and operated by the hotel itself.

The room was nice. We chose an oversized room and we were glad because with me, my wife, and our 2 kids we could use the extra space. A regular room would have been cramped. However, the beds were way to soft for my taste and for my wife as well. I had a sore neck when I woke up in the mornings. The beds weren't old but just very soft which I know some people like but was horrible for me.

Finally, the restaurant in the hotel, Knuckles, had good food for breakfast but is on the expensive side. We chose to patronize some of the other local restaurants for some of our breakfasts.

review.title: Fine hotel at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Not luxurious, but a good price for what you get. Simple, clean, great location.

review.title: A great place to stay for a family vacation
review.reviewText:
Spent six days at the hotel during my son's spring break. Definitely convenient for accessing tourist stops along the Wharf and catching cable cars into downtown -- a good place to stay with kids.

The service was very good -- friendly and attentive. Breakfast at Knuckles [in the hotel] a nice way to start the day and good serving staff. The bym is a little light on weights, but plenty of cardio equipment. The pool is also good, but not very deep and older kids won't enjoy.

Overall, we were extremely pleased with the selection. I've stayed at a few places in San Fran and this was fair value for money [we got a great rate by booking early and went in the spring time]. If you get a deal much better to stay here with the kids that further out at some of the chains along the route to the airport.

review.title: Great for the tourist family!
review.reviewText: If you are looking for something convienent to the tour spots and transportation hubs, this is your hotel.

review.title: Fine hotel except for parking!
review.reviewText: This hotel was beautiful when traveling with children. (swimming pool) Just a short friendly walk to the pier 39. However it must be in small print somewhere that the Hyatt charges you $45.00 a night for valet parking. Other than that small surprize every thing was great!

review.title: One of the Best!!
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was very convenient. It was walking distance to the Wharf (two blocks), Pier 39, and also to Cable Car (Powell and Mason). The hotel was very modern, clean, and very comfortable beds. The hot-tub was a bonus too. The staff was very helpful as well. Knuckles breakfast buffet was also yummy! The hotel was also walkable distance to Lombard St (crooked st) and Little Italy (Northbeach). Overall I recommend this hotel if you want to stay in SF. However, to get to Downtown, take the Hyde St and Mason cable car to Union Square, etc.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a great spot to walk to everything !

review.title: hyatt - fisherman's warf
review.reviewText: although on first glance this appears to be a hotel out of the way for business traveler, it was actually the perfect place to stay for business downtown. the price was great. the staff attentive. the complimentary car service made the hotel convenient each morning to my office on market. plus it rained -- the car service was even more of a bonus. joe, the drive, is now a trusted friend. i will go back.

review.title: Great stay at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
We had a great stay at this hotel. The location really is as good as advertised, two short blocks from peer 43. Some good restaurants are located in walking distance.
We got a great deal for a 3 night stay with complimentary valet parking at the hotel (rate in San Francisco) and breakfast. I don't know what the usual price is there, but we were very happy with the deal we got. As this is an upscale hotel, their full price would probably be higher, making this deal less attractive. Look for the promotional offers.

review.title: Great hotel and location , I would stay again
review.reviewText: We were in town for Chinese new years. Great location for getting down town and the wharf. Breakfast was included and parking in our rate. Fantastic breakfast buffet, imported cheeses, fruits, ect.

review.title: Great hotel near fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: The staff wass really nice. Centrally located hotel for all the fun stuff in San Fransisco. No views but we weren't in the hotel much. There is so much to do. We are very picky and live only 70 miles away. We would definitely stay again!

review.title: Would definitly recommend this hotel to others
review.reviewText:
Check in was very fast and freindly. Our bags were taken to our room immediatly. Food at Room service was excellent and was delivered within 30 minutes of order.
Room had no view but this was not important to us as we arrived at 10 pm in the night and only stayed one night.
Breakfast and parking was included in room special and was a great deal for this high end hotel.

review.title: good stay
review.reviewText: My husband and i went to San Francisco to celebrate our 4 year anniversary and thought this hotel would be perfect because of the location. We arrived earlier than the check in time, so they put a rush on our room. They had it ready in about 1 1/2 hours wich was fine because check in wasnt until 3p and it was only 12p when they gave us our room. The room was nice except for the fact that they gave us 2 double beds instead of one king but we didnt mind too much and just let that go. We had an oversized room that had a couch and flat screen tv. The tv wasnt the biggest and they didnt have MTV! but it's ok we lived lol. Also not to be to explicit, but the bed was very, very, loud that night. We've stayed at alot of hotels and usually the beds are very quiet so that was a very bad surprise. Over all though, the hotel was very nice and clean and the restaurant was very nice and convient with good food. The location of the hotel is excellent, we walked to the Wharf and Ghirardelli's Square in no time. Overall we liked this hotel alot and would recommend it to anyone.

review.title: Awesome time on the Wharf!
review.reviewText: Have stayed at the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf before, and this time did not disappoint. Got a great deal on Expedia that included parking and b-fast buffet, which made are stay that much more enjoyable. This is my preferred location when visiting the Fisherman's Wharf area.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: My friend and I stayed for a long weekend here and found it to be the perfect hotel. The location is fantastic with everything within walking distance, including trolleys and metro line. The rooms were very nice, yet not super fancy. The beds were comfortable and the hotel staff was very accomodating. I would definitely stay here again. Be mindful that the coffee pot is hidden in a drawer under the closet.

review.title: Great place..
review.reviewText: The hotel is in great location and wonderful service...

review.title: Quick Trip to SFO
review.reviewText: In town for a 1-day business trip. Reasonably priced (for SFO) and very close to Wharf and all it's restaurants and shops. Sports bar/restaurant attached to the hotel was great; nice to just walk from the lobby to the bar. Would have been nice to have a couple more days, but overall Hyatt staff made this a trip with no issues whatsoever.

review.title: All good - but beware of the bathtub issue!
review.reviewText:
We booked an oversize kind bedded room at this hotel for our recent stay, not realising that "marble bath" means marble bathroom! It simply never occured to me that the bathroom in such a hotel as this wouldn't have a bath in it!

At the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf, it seems the king bedded rooms have a walk-in glass shower, andthe double rooms have baths (which the Americans refer to as "tubs".

I wouldn't care, but for my wife not being able to bathe is a disaster, so we downgraded to a standard double room and there were no oversize doubles available and hotel compensated us by paying for breakfast every day (useful, at $18 each!).

Otherwise, it was all fine. The standard room was a good size (bathroom was big) and the inside facing room we had was extremely quiet.

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText: WE were not familiar with San Fransisco when we booked this Hotel. It is located Close to Fisherman's Wharf but we actually had to walk past other hotels to arrive at the actual Wharf Area. We were traveling with another couple and therefore "Meeting" in the lobby before heading out. There really is not much of a lobby area. The breakfast buffet was excellent and the Hotel staff was very attentive. Our room was comfortable and well appointed.

review.title: Hyatt was awsome! Told you I would never stay at the Argonaut Hotel again.
review.reviewText:
The hotel was awsome, very quiet rooms, so convieniant to everything, and the customer service was great ! Very clean and friendly.
I stayed at the Argonaut Hotel last time,and had problems 5 days in a row, and the front desk basically said too bad so sad, you booked through expedia,there is nothing we can do. They didn't care,now the ecomomy is poor,wonder how much they would have liked my five night stay this time. I completely recommend the Hyatt hotel on Fishermans Warf, and will gladly stay there again. I told the front desk at the Argonaut Hotel I would never stay there again, and I didn't.
Stay at the Hyatt,and recieve the best overall expieriance.

review.title: Location is the best around for everything to see.
review.reviewText:
Ride the cable cars or walk to the warf for a bowel of clam chowder. This is the place to be if you are going to be in tourist mode.
The area is expensive for parking and it is limited. $45 per day at the hotel for valet does not seem that bad compared to everything else.
Not much to do at the hotel, just used as base camp.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: The over-sized room we had was clean, quiet, comfortable and all staff at the hotel were friendly. Valet parking is quite expensive and street parking was not an option. Great location!

review.title: Good value, good location...
review.reviewText: The hotel is very clean, quiet, and the staff was very courteous and helpful. A very good value for the location for visitors to SF on vacation for a couple of days. Rooms are a little small, but the Hyatt is a real hotel, not a Holiday Inn...

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel was average nothing special. Staff was very helpfull. 1 -2 days in that area was more than enough- we stayed 4.

review.title: "Love SF - good location"
review.reviewText: Great spot, not crowded w/ tourists, but everything close by.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Close to everything. Parking is as expected $45.00per day but you can come in and out as much as you like. Clean, great staff, nice rooms, comfortable bed.
My husband and I came up for the weekend but I brought my kids there last Labor Day Weekend. They enjoyed it. They are 19 and 16yr old
Fisherman's Wharf is great for families with kids also. Lots of shopping, restaurants and things to see. Make sure you make your reservations for Alcatraz early. My kids enjoyed it a lot. Reserve before you get there. You may get lucky getting a tour the same day. Pier 39 has lots of things for the kids to look at. Gotta have the mini cinnamon and sugar donuts at the Mrs. Fields store. Bubba Gumps is great too. I recommend the hop on and hop off bus. You can get tickets before hand or hop on the bus and pay for tickets when you get on. Great tour of the city. Also has great high end shopping. Macy's, Tiffany's etc...

review.title: More like a boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, good location, good restaurant, good concierge. Very pleasant.

review.title: I have made a reservation to return to the same hotel in December of 2010.
review.reviewText: The experience was so worth while, I have made reservations through EXPEDIA to return to the SAME hotel this Decemebr.

review.title: Good family friendly hotel
review.reviewText:
Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf has a great location, just a couple of blocks off the main bustle of Jefferson St and the Wharf but convenient for all the main attractions (if you don't mind the climb, Coit Tower and Telegraph Hill are also very walkable from here). All staff cheerful and helpful - recommend the limo ride from the hotel back to SF airport.

Catch the Powell-Mason cable car behind the hotel and return from Market Street via F- line historic streetcar. A 3 or 7 day Muni pass is great value, especially if you have two 17 year olds in tow who can't walk more than 100 yards before needing to sit down for a coffee.

review.title: "The MOST PERFECT and ONLY place to stay in San Francisco!"
review.reviewText: At check-in there was not much of a wait...the person checking us in was extremely polite. One of the best features/services about the Hotel was the concierge. My husband and I had a more difficult request with arranging a trip to Napa Valley: a hot air balloon ride followed by wine tasting. The concierge arranged the driver to take us to Napa Valley along with the hot air balloon tour...everything was perfectly timed and we were contacted to agree to and confirm all of the reservations/arrangements...did not feel any stress. The recommendations per the concierge were "spot on"...restaurants/places to visit/etc...Also, the hotel was very clean and the room was a bit more contemporary than what I expected. The hotel truly is the PERFECT location to reside while visiting the Wharf and San Francisco in general...will always return to the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf for future vacations in San Francisco :)

review.title: San Fran good choice
review.reviewText: San Fran about 30 mins from airport which was ok. Hotel ideally placed for Pier 39 etc and having a chlld with us was the best choice for us as we spent much time at the piers and marina. Obviously more restaurant choice in Union sq and China town area but these were reasily accessed from hotel as cable car stops right behind hotel and runs from early until late, do get Muni pass as otherwise can be very expensive) the pass also allows you on the buses as well so great to get around. Hotel restaurant and bar very nice easy going and casual, we only had one meal there and it was lovely although a bit more expensive than outside. Must say cafe over the road from hotel called Hollywood Cafe was fabulous for breakfasts people queued outside every morning the breakfast really set you up for the day so go there. Really loved San Fran and would go again and stay in same hotel.

review.title: Great location, bad bathrooms
review.reviewText: Fantastic location. Great service. King guestrooms not good. All style over substance especially in the bathroom. The "rainshower" means that you have to stand under the water while adjusting the temperature-very unpleasant. It's also very difficult to wash your hair without getting completely out of the way which means shivering in the open doorway (no closing shower door). I won't even mention the bathroom door which provides virtually no privacy and the beautiful but ineffecient sink. Only the double rooms have regular bathrooms. Also no views from any room. Staff were exceptionally nice though.

review.title: Good spot at the Wharf
review.reviewText: Good hotel. Clean, but I wouldn't give it full marks for cleanliness. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Fairly good spot in relation to the Wharf. About a 10 minute walk at most to Pier 39. Tonnes of great restaurants and shops around. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant...seemed a little over priced compared to what you could get in the area. One cable car turnaround is a behind the hotel which is handy. The other is only a 5 minute walk. Hot tub only has room for 6 people and pool is only 3.5 feet deep, but they were both a nice break after all the walking we did. Overall very satisfied and would definitely stay there again.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: The Hyatt is a lovely hotel in a great location .The wharf and cable cars are very near the hotel staff were very nice and welcoming, 'you have to pay for parking but we expected that being where it is located. I would definitely stay there again for location .The only thing against it for me and my young family was that breakfast was very expensive ,so i would recomend you cross the road and go to the cafe.

review.title: Excellent location and Motorcycle Friendly.
review.reviewText: Pulling into this above average hotel on my Harley Davidson,after having been on the road for almost a week, I was concerned. Here I was looking pretty rough around the edges, and the first thing I see is a black limousine dropping off well heeled business guests. My concerns were put to rest when the bellman approached me and and in a friendly manner inquired if I had reservations. When I told him I did, he immediately helped me find a safe place to park my motorcycle and he assisted me in unloading my bags and finding my room. My room was luxurious. It faced the pool and it couldn't have been nicer. I loved the modern decor, and the bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. The "rain shower" was just the thing to wash off the road grit, and I then kicked back, relaxed and watched a first run movie, which was included with my room. Everything was nearby, including a Harley shop, a Starbucks, and the cable car turnaround. The Wharf was only a few blocks away, and you end up right where the crab booths are. I will definately be back to this property except next time, I'm bringing my family. One word. Epic !

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We arrived late and Knuckles was about to close so we grabbed some food which we thought was high but found out later that food in Frisco is high. the room was large modern very clean . We do have one problem it had no table to eat from or do stuff. The location was great . We loved it but would not come back due to expence.

review.title: okay visit with a few problems
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and comfortable. The location was great for visiting Fisherman's Wharf - nice and close. We were not accomodated on wanting our 2 rooms side by side - they were quite far apart but on the same floor. The "courtyard view" was not great but it was the quieter side of the hotel. The attached resturant was convenient and food was good.

review.title: A wecoming safe city , which loves tourists
review.reviewText:
Hyuatt - ideally located, Fisherman's Wharf , cablecar terminal at rear of hotel. thus getting easy access to Union Square centre of shopping area. Quiet. Best public transport - easy access to buses. Staff helpful and will advise on SF travel etc. Food good at the hotel. Waiter service excellent.
Go in Spring or Autumn - less chance of fog. Sept/Oct good weather. Take helicopter trip even though expensive. Superb sights Lots to see and do. .Wonderful city The perfect holiday destination. . Safe

review.title: Great hotel in more intimate setting
review.reviewText: Perfect location for seeing the sights and being able to walk to most of them. Upscale luxury - what you would expect to find at a Hyatt - but wrapped in a small, three story hotel, which made it feel more intimate and casual - which is just what I wanted for a little family vacation. Good bargain rates mid-week but don't know if I'd spend the big bucks for a room on the weekend with many medium priced hotels literally next door. My double-bed room was large but had no view. The outdoor pool is heated but it, too, has no view. The bed was comfortable, the amenities excellent and it was a very pleasant experience with generally good service.

review.title: Great location; good service
review.reviewText: We got a good deal on this hotel for a weekend. We only live across the bay but just wanted to get away from home and stay a night in the city and play tourist. This hotel is very close to the wharf and 1 block away from the cable car. Good service. Can't go wrong with this hotel. Just be aware of the parking fee - but you really can't get away from that if you want to stay in the City.

review.title: "Great Location"
review.reviewText: The Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf is the perfect location! The hotel is just a block away from the pier. The hotel staff was wonderful. Only downfall was the pool. My family and I stayed 5 nights and were only able to swim 1 day due to maintenance work being done on the outside of the hotel (in the pool area). Overall The Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf is a good choice!

review.title: Pretty nice overall
review.reviewText: Good quality room. Nicely staffed. Reasonable price, but the parking fee seemed too pricey ($52 a day). Valet people could be more alert.

review.title: Would love to go back!
review.reviewText: The Hyatt at San Francisco was our hotel of choice for my daughter and two grandchildren for their Spring Bread. And we got a real deal through Expedia!

review.title: Nice hotel, conveniently located
review.reviewText:
This hotel was great. Very clean, staff were friendly enough, nice tvs in the rooms. Optimal location to wharf/tourist activities. Very nice view of the city out our nice big window.

The only minor issue was there was no fan in the bathroom so the mirror fogged up really bad after someone took a shower. But that is really hardly an issue.

review.title: Midlanders
review.reviewText: great location to ride the cable cars. Open top bus is fun but make sure you have a hat or hood for over the bridge. Hyatt beds are really great!!!

review.title: Worth every penny
review.reviewText: I love that the hotel room actually looked exactly like the pictures. The bed was very comfortable! Road noise wasn't even noticeable in our corner room over the courtyard. I liked the easy check in/out computer kiosk that kept me out of the long line at the desk.

review.title: First San Francisco Experience - Would Like To Come Back!!
review.reviewText: From check-in to check-out we were very happy with this hotel. Everyone went out of their way to make our stay most pleasant. The check-in specialist was outstanding - giving us recommendations and ideas. The bell staff was more than AWESOME. David was so kind to all of us, making sure we had directions, coupons, etc. In and out of the hotel we saw smiles, concern, and kindness. We will be back.

review.title: Won't Go Back
review.reviewText: We did a lot of research before choosing this hotel for our stay in the Fisherman's Wharf area, and from reviews on this site, anticipated an upscale hotel with a comfortable, lovely room. We arrived on a Friday evening and were given a room next to the pool/spa area with a large window that was largely obscured by a very large black tarp-covered repair project complete with bright orange traffic cones and ugly pipes. It was a very depressing and unacceptable view. We immediately went back to the front desk and talked with the staff who said they were very sorry, but the hotel was sold out and they would see if they could move us the next day. When we checked with them the next day, they were unable to do that either, so we endured two nights in one of the worst rooms we have ever stayed in. The layout was uncomfortable and the decor very dull, with grays, blacks and browns in varying patterns, not inviting and conveying no sense of warmth. The walk-in shower had a glass door that only covered half the opening, so it was drafty and cold. I called the front desk to see if they at least offered bathrobes upon request and was told that they do not. The other frustration is that the hotel charges $45 per day for parking, whether you use the valet or self-park. That seemed to us to be a ridiculously high amount. We took photos of our view of the construction mess and showed it to the front desk manager, who did agree to waive our parking fee as an apology.

review.title: Friendly, Helpful and Great Location
review.reviewText: The day we arrived at the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf, we had to return our car to the airport. The doorman was extremely helpful and after unloading our bags allowed us to leave the car at the front until we got settled. Usually the parking is quite expensive. Once settled, we took our car to the airport, and again the doorman was very helpful in telling us the best route to take. We also found the conceirge extremely obliging and resourceful when we needed to book some game tickets. The hotel was in a safe area, walking distance to the Pier and also to the trams. There are a lot of homeless people around the Pier area but we didn't find them troublesom. We had an adjoining room with the children and they were your typical hotel style and very clean and made up daily. We used the spa outside and they also had a laundry on the floor which was most handy. Overall a great stay and we loved San Francisco.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: It's a very clean and well organized hotel. I enjoyed my experience!

review.title: Hyatt @ Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This is a very convenient hotel, located near SFO attractions. From there, you can take the famous cable car, or any sightseing tour of this wonderful city. Its price was reasonable and the quality of this hotel is superb!!

review.title: To much mony for nothing
review.reviewText: Small rooms, poor decoration, expensive parking. We were expecting a Hyatt as nice as others we stayed before but it showed to be an average hotel. We can¬¥t say it is a bad hotel but we could get the same in the same region paying much less. We ware two adults and two children (ages 10 and 4) and we almost could¬¥t fit in the room. House kipping need significant improvement as do the hotel restaurant. We recommend you to look something else, especially if you have children. We would ¬¥t return to this hotel and got very disappointed with Hyatt Brand. The location was nice.

review.title: Excellent hotel and good value for money
review.reviewText: Very comfortable hotel with friendly staff and good facilities (pool, gym). We stayed for 3 days and it is in a great location at Fisherman's Wharf only 3 mins from Pier 39 and 10 mins from the Alcatraz Cruise centre. Food is a bit expensive which has allowed several excellent value cafes to spring up literally opposite (particularly for a great breakfast)

review.title: Loved the Hyatt!
review.reviewText: THe hotel was clean, comfortable and the staff was very helpful. The location was fantastic. I would definatly come bak here.

review.title: Average Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: Average Hotel, Great Location. People friendly.

review.title: Can't wait to go Back
review.reviewText: Everyone at The Hyatt at the Fisherman's Wharf was very friendly. We were celebrating our 40th wedding Ann. They helped us find a restrautant to celebrate our 4oth Ann and was very helpful with helping us with some of the attractions. They are very close to everything pier 39 and the cable car line is wright across the street. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone. The Hollwood cafe across the street is a great place for breakfast and is very cheap.

review.title: Great hotel, excellent service & top location. Will come back
review.reviewText:
Our family of 4 spent 2 weeks at this hotel between November - December. It was a great experience from the start. The lady at the reception desk - Annie - let us check in early at around 11AM and gave us good, useful information on restaurants, attractions around the area.

Our room on the 5th floor was very quiet and supplied with a small fridge & microwave oven (on request) which was great.

Concierge, front desk and cleaning staff members were friendly, helpful and efficient. The hotel is within walking distance to many attractions and restaurants. Public transport and car rentals are just around the corner.

We travel a lot but have mainly stayed at the Starwood hotels or Hilton. After this trip, we will definitely put Hyatt on our list. When we visit SF again, the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf will be our hotel of choice

review.title: Friendly Helpful Service
review.reviewText: Hotel was very convenient and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was clean, comfortable and a good size. No real complaints except the dim lighting in the room which we found to be the case in every one of the 11 different hotels we stayed in during our visit to America. Always only occasional lamps which we found annoying. Especially bad for those that suffer from night blindness and can't see well in dimly lit rooms. Also never enough hooks in the bathroom. Very disappointed that there was a charge to use the computer in the business centre. Only the second hotel out of the 11 hotels to charge

review.title: A Nice hotel in a great location
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the Hyatt at Fishermans Wharf in the middle of November.
The concierage was very accomodating and helped us with planning for a number of trips. The hotel staff were very friendly and courteous, and the rooms were clean and comfortable. The hotel location was only a block away from fisherman's wharf, pier 39, the ferry to Alcatraz, and access to the cable cars, which is a bit of a relief considering how noisy it can get there.

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: We LOVED this hotel. It was in the perfect location. It was walking distance from Pier 39, as well as what seemed like hundreds of restaurants and shops. We will definitely be staying here again. The staff was wonderful, and helped us with anything we needed. The hotel restaurant "Knuckles" had great food, and was a fun place to hang out. It was rated the #3 sports bar by City's Best.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location, comfortable room, nice amentities and sports bar. Did I say great location?!

review.title: Excellent Hotel at a great location
review.reviewText: very near to the Fisherman's Wharf... great location.

review.title: Convenient Comfort
review.reviewText: The rooms are spacious with excellent bathrooms, although as there is only 1 lift system we had a long walk from room to lift. The location is 2 blocks from the wharfs and handy for Cable cars and trolleys. We did not eat in the Hotel but the bar /restaurant seemed well used. Most staff were very helpful. Free Wi-Fi in lobby.

review.title: perfect
review.reviewText: Location was superb, breakfasts great.

review.title: excellent
review.reviewText: loved the hotel and its location

review.title: Love, love, love San Fran. Hyatt
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Hyatt Oct 4-8, 2009. Perfect location to both the cable cars and F-Line street cars. Room was excellent!! All staff were so friendly and helpful. You don't have to pack shampoo, toothpaste, lotion, hair dryer, iron, ironing board - -- it's all in the room. Had daily breakfast at the Hollywood cafe just across the street --- good food and prices. I will agree that parking is very expensive. I asked for the $32.00 rate and got it. Expensive, yes, but better than their advertised $45/day rate. Didn't tip the valet parking guys every time they brought out the car. Just gave one tip at the end of the stay. I will definitely stay there the next time I visit San Francisco!!!

review.title: Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Excellent location and the staff members were helpful and very friendly. Our room was excellent and the cleaning staff was efficient and thorough. We would definitely stay at the Hyatt again. The Enterprise place, (to rent a car), nearby was excellent too. It was very accessible and the manager very nice to deal with.

review.title: Great location, Great hotel
review.reviewText: The Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf is a great place for a vacation stay. We were able to walk to many attractions and restaurants. It is probably the quietest hotel I've ever stayed in. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The beds were so comfortable. Perfect place to stay!

review.title: Unhappy
review.reviewText: We were unhappy the moment we pulled up to the hotel. They offer Valet Only parking at $45.00 a day. That wasn't advertised. The room service amenity I requested and paid for PRIOR to our arrival was not available when we checked in, despite being told that it would be waiting for us. I was told that room service wasn't available at that time and that I had to wait. Kind of defeated the purpose. Upon checking in, I was told that I was getting a smoking room with two queen beds. I reserved a non smoking room with one king bed. I had to request that AGAIN. And, one two separate occasions our privacy was violated by the housekeeping crew. They entered our room despite our request for privacy. All that was offered to make up for these mishaps was an "I'm sorry" and we won't charge you for a bottle of water that you utilized in your room. We won't be visiting this hotel again.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and the room was well kept.The staff was allways ready to help and gave you great idea's for your stay.I would recomend the Hyatt to all my friends. Would come back to stay again.

review.title: Expected more for the price we paid
review.reviewText: The foyer was great but the room was pretty average for the price we paid. The room was very dark and small however the location was great. Close to the tram cars and walkind distance to fisherman's wharf

review.title: Great hotel. Great location
review.reviewText: My experience at the Hyatt was nothing short of amazing. The hotel is very centrally located in Fishermans Wharf. It is near anything you need. Public transportation is also with in a block away. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. The customer service was absolutely fantastic. Everyone there was so friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: We had never been to San Francisco before. This hotel is located across the street from one of the tour companies and just a couple of blocks from the shops and restaurants on the wharf. It was clean and comfortable with a great location.

review.title: I Left My Heart ...
review.reviewText: Staying at the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf was just one of the many wonderful memories of my trip to San Francisco! The staff - particularly Marleni, was very helpful any time I had any questions or requests, even for band aids for the blisters on my feet from all the walking! My room(418)was AMAZING! Lots of room, loved the shower, and I have to agree with everyone who has raved about the extremely comfortable beds! WOW! I also used the e-concierge to request a mini-fridge for my room before I even arrived! The location of the hotel was perfect for accessing the cable cars, Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Ghirardelli Square, and the F line trolly to get to anywhere else I needed to go! I know where I'll be staying on my next trip to the City by the Bay!

review.title: Really enjoyed our visit.
review.reviewText: This was a very nice hotel located within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. We were also able to take public transportation to other spots we wanted to visit. Several nice eating places, one right across the street. Concierge was extremely helpful with getting us to where we wanted to go and how to get there.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Centrally located for all the attractions: Pier 39, Wharf. Girardelli square, and only 5-6 blocks from China town and the pier for Alcatraz. No need for a car, either walk or take cable car to all attractions. Hotel Parking is very expensive and so was breakfast prices at "Knuckles Restraunt" associated with the hotel. Excellent breakfast across the street from hotel at "Hollywood Cafe" and at half the price

review.title: Right There
review.reviewText: Hotel is 2 blocks from Powell-Hyde cable car and 1/2 block from Powell-Mason Line. Up hill ride to Union Square. Two blocks from wharf. Knuckles is a sports bar that had all the games on. Guys Dream Would stay there again.

review.title: Perfect place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel's location is within walking distance of just about everything, and it's only 1-2 blocks to catch a cable car or city bus. The staff was extremely helpful and knowledgable. The hotel was clean and quiet, and the beds were SO comfortable! I would most definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a perfect location within walking distance to the wharf, shopping and restaurants - no need to rent a car. Quick access to bus routes too. Staff were great and helpful. Room was nothing special but clean and quiet. Food in hotel lounge was great. Would stay there again.

review.title: Will return
review.reviewText: The hotel was at a great location, the staff were helpful, very nice, answered all our questions. The room was very spacious, clean and neat, cleaned everyday we were there. The only change would be free internet to guests. Plan to return in the future and will very likely stay at the same hotel.

review.title: great atmosphere
review.reviewText: This hotel is in wonderful location close to most tourist atractions Union Square, chinatown, Little italy, and The Bay. But what makes me recommend this hotel is the staff. They were very upbeat and the concierge was extemely helpful in showing me the quickiest and cheapiest ways around town. Overall I think it is a good hotel with a Great staff, and next I am in town I will stay there again.

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: Excellent place to stay with great location. Staff extremely friendly and excellent concierge staff! Good size room with a funky shower- have not seen one like it before.

review.title: 2nd time and just as good
review.reviewText: This was the 2nd time my wife have been to this Hotel and it was just as nice as the first time. Great Location. Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, China Town, Lombard Street and many more popular destinations. Very Classy. Would definitely do it again.

review.title: San Francisco's great hotel
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel for my vacation. I wanted a hotel that is within walking distatnce to all the main attractions. We were able to walk everywhere, all the attractions are so close to this hotel and Fisherman's Wharf is a block away. I would reccomend this hotel.

review.title: Great location, service was extrordinary, you'll love it too!
review.reviewText: 40th Anniversary trip! We stayed at the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf from Sept. 15 through the 23, 2009. The weather is awesome this time of year. There were two possible room types that we could choose from and we were given keys to both to access and decide. There was a larger room with 2 double beds, and a slightly smaller room with a king. We chose the king. Comfy beds! We requested & got a fridge. The pool was heated to 82 degrees. It's 3 to 3 1/2 feet deep. The hot tub was not huge, but cozy. It was a nice place to chat with others also. Other visitors also liked the hotel. Our desk clerks & consierge were helpful with suggestions for some meals. They also helped with which bus connections to use on our adventures. The consierge also helped us navigate with the MUNI transportation system to get to places like Golden Gate Park. (FYI: No bus stops IN the park, but go through the park, get off the bus on Lincoln and walk back into the park.). We visited the Japanese Tea Garden at the park. Lovely!.. and we had TEA!

review.title: Clean, comfortable and GREAT location!
review.reviewText: This hotel was everything we needed for our trip. Front desk service was friendly and helpful. We used the concierge multiple time during our stay and she was always very helpful and even made dinner reservations for us. The location was super. It was close to most public transportation (the cable cars and f-line cars). And we loved staying at the wharf where a lot of the action was along w/ beautiful scenery and close to the water and seals on pier 39. The hotel also had a beautiful bar/restaurant downstairs that we went to several times. Good food and drinks. The only negative I can think of is that there is not a complementary continental breakfast and that you have to pay a fee for wireless internet. However, I still highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel was filled with great amenities along with a terrific location. The staff was friendly and helpful, making our stay fun.

review.title: Great location on the wharf
review.reviewText: Great location 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. Had a great sport bar in the hotel. Directly across the street is the BEST place to eat breakfast and lunch (not open for dinner). Its only has a few tables, so will have to be selective when to eat, but GREAT food. Hotel does not have a gift shop or place to buy beverages, but close enough to other shops thats not a big deal.

review.title: Not worth the money.
review.reviewText: Felt the rooms were too expensive! You need to be in good physical shape since the rooms are very far away from the elevators.

review.title: Nice hotel, Great location!
review.reviewText: This was a beautiful hotel, we just didn't find the staff overly helpful. Quick short answers was all we got from them. The valet staff was great. Never waited long for the car - but do expect to pay the $45+ fees to keep your car in the area.

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: Great hotel - great location - great restaurant/sports bar. Service was impeccable. Only complaint is the per night parking rate. Would stay here again - loved San Francisco!!

review.title: Great concierge
review.reviewText: Very helpful staff including knowledgable concierges.

review.title: Really nice staff
review.reviewText: the staff was really nice and welcoming. Always greeted by the staff with a smile! Really close to the wharf and ghiradelli square, we parked for free and walked everywhere!!

review.title: Hyatt at Fisherman's Warf
review.reviewText: The hotel room was not clean, in fact, there were animal crackers under the couch when we checked in! I have stayed in Hyatts before and enjoyed my stay and this is the reason I selected the Hyatt for my trip to San Francisco. My experience at the Hyatt was not at all typical to the usual visit. I will be back in San Francisco again next year but will have to find somewhere else to stay. Very disappointing!

review.title: great place to sight see
review.reviewText: The Hyatt is in a great location. You are in walking distance to the wharf and several good restaraunts. The sight seeing buses and cable cars are across the street. There are two little breakfast places right next door with excellent food and good prices.

review.title: Had a great time.
review.reviewText: Everything went very well, from check in to check out. The hotel was very clean, including the fit room, pool, and spa. The employees were very courteous and helpful. We enjoyed Knuckles restaurant and found their staff to be most efficient. Future trips to the San Francisco Bay area will also mean future stays at the Hyatt. Thanks to the Hyatt our stay was very enjoyable.

review.title: Unbeatable.
review.reviewText: My wife and I have stayed at the Hyatt at FW on a number of occasions when on vacation in San Francisco and have never been disappointed. The level of staff service is outstanding (particularly from the bar staff who are extremely friendly and always willing to engage with customers). The bar and restaurant can be very lively and noisy at weekends and is probably not the place for a romantic dinner but it has a great atmosphere. The concierge is very knowledgable about local restaurants and has never recommended one we have not been delighted with. The hotel is ideally placed for public transport - a couple of blocks from FW and the ferry to Sausalito, an F line street car stop a short stroll away (takes you along the Embarcadero and onto Market Street with connections to other lines or buses to take you to attractions like Golden Gate Park), the number 30 bus to Union Square (just a block from China Town) goes up Columbus (a couple of minutes away), get the 30 going the other way to the Marina District and the Exploratorium and there is a cable car turnaround just round the block from the hotel on the Powell-Mason line. Overall, it is a great place to stay with some of the friendliest and most helpful staff you will ever find in a hotel. We recognised a lot of the staff from previous visits (they seem to stick with the hotel) and a happy and contented staff wll make for happy and contented guests.

review.title: Average but great location
review.reviewText: Just an 'average' hotel with everything you would expect. I think it was a little overpriced and the photos are not representative of what the hotel actually looks like. Saying this, it is in a great location - well worth staying here just for that bonus. Although there are many other hotels nearby which im sure will offer better value.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Tour bus stopped right outside, 5 min walk to ferry terminal, nice location.

review.title: Great Location/Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was very comfortable and the service friendly and helpful. Great location for getting around town on public transportation.
