The F-Line streetcar is just a block away and gets you to the Ferry Building and anything along Market Street. The cablecars are 1 & 3 blocks away and the No.30 bus takes you to China Town, Cow Hollow and the Marina District.

review.title: everything we could have wanted
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. Good location.Quiet street. the beds were comfee. What else can we say.

review.title: Expensive, but good.
review.reviewText: It was a little expensive, but the room was clean and quiet; I'd stay at the Hyatt again. It's close to everything, including a great Enterprise rental garage, a few steamed crab vendors, and Boudin's.

review.title: Loved It!
review.reviewText: This hotel is really nice! We had a gorgeous room with an oversized King-sized bed. The location was great. It was just a couple blocks from the Wharf, but walkable to North Beach and one of the infamous Cable Car stops. The staff was very pleasant and accomodating. The concierge helped us out with dinner recommendations and reservations.

review.title: Better than some
review.reviewText: The room itself was comfortable enough, but a little tight with a roll away cot in it as well. We felt compelled to stand the cot up each morning to get it somewhat out of the way. Perhaps a futon or small pull out would be better in the room than the lounger chair which was too narrow for our 11 year old son to sleep on (thus the requirement for the cot). Door on bathroom doesn't lock. Also, rain shower head in shower with glass only reaching half way across the shower stall opening means that you can't shower without soaking the bathroom floor. Finally, windows don't open very far, so keeping the airconditioning on at night was required. However, aircon was noisy and kept kicking in and out. Restaurant was excellent, best prawn cocktail I've very had! Concierge was extremely helpful with directions, cost of transportation, etc.

review.title: would definately stay at this hotel in the future!
review.reviewText: It was our 20th wedding anniversary and the expedia agent that helped us put notes in our reservation re: this and requested room upgrade for us. When we arrived we were more than satisfied, we felt that the hotel went above and beyond to make our stay special! Thank you expedia and Hyatt hotels:-)

review.title: Convenient, Classy and Considerate
review.reviewText: Excellent service and location. Restaurant in hotel wasn't what you would expect at a Hyatt, however. Other than that, everything was exceptional.

review.title: Would stay there again. Staff is great. Very accomadating. Great location.
review.reviewText: Everything was great with regard to the room, staff, cleanliness, parking, convenience. Restaurant was good too.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf is a clean, quiet hotel in a great location near major tourist attractions. It offers convenient public transit options, including nearby bus and cable car stops.

review.title: Pleasant Experience
review.reviewText: We actually stayed at the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf for our honeymoon. After doing extensive research for reasonably priced locations in San Francisco, my fiance and I decided upon this Hyatt. I'm glad we did. We had a fabulous honeymoon without emptying our bank accounts. The staff went out of their way to make sure we had a wonderful honeymoon stay at their hotel. I'd give them five stars on cleanliness, but I'm exceptionally picky about hotel cleanliness and I'm not positive they changed our sheets and pillowcases every time we wanted them to. For breakfast- you HAVE to go across the street to the Hollywood Cafe. (Of course, this is after you've tried brunch at Mama's near Peter and Paul Cathedral.) It is much cheaper than the hotel's brunch and is at least as good if not better. The eggs benedict and fresh fruit were amazing. From this Hyatt a lot of the touristy sites are walking distance (from Ghirardelli Square to Fisherman's Wharf to Pier 39). It's a bit of a walk, but you could even walk to the Alcatraz ferry. Several bus and cable car stops are around the corner that will take you straight to Golden Gate Bridge or Chinatown. The Legion of Honor takes two transfers on the bus, but is well worth it.

review.title: Very nice!
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt. It was so comfortable, clean and most of all-quite! The Hollywood Cafe across the street was the best! I do recommend this for your breakfast option. We would and will stay at the Hyatt again.

review.title: Would recommend to others
review.reviewText: The beds were very, very comfortable. The lobby personnel were also very polite and helpful.

review.title: September 2009
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location on Fisherman's Wharf. Easy walk to attractions and local restaurants. Fisherman's Wharf is always busy and noisy, it was nice to come back to a quiet hotel. Onsite parking is easy, a valet parks and returns your car - nice feature.

review.title: One move, wrong beds, made things up with service
review.reviewText: We arrived late on the Thursday before labor day for a long weekend in the San Fran area. There were double beds in our room when we made a special request to have 1 King or Queen bed. There were bugs (mosquitoes, moths) near the bed and in the bathroom. After moving to another double bed room we went to sleep and went out for the entire day on Friday. When we returned that night the hotel manager called us to say that in another day they may have a single bed room available but that was all they could do at the time. After informing them that I have Diamond status with Hilton and Platinum status with Marriott they offered a bottle of wine which was appreciated. For the remainder of our stay we did not have any issues and if we had avoided the bug/wrong bed issues in the first place it would have been a great stay.

review.title: GREAT PLACE---EXCELLENT PRICE
review.reviewText: EXCELLENT CONDITIONS...CLEAN AND UPDATED...LOVELY DECOR...GREAT LOCATION TO MAUN TOURIST ATRACTION...GREAT PRICE....

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. Clean and comfortable room. Great service and a fabulous location. We walked everywhere. Planning to go back and stay there again.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel! Good service, friendly staff, and comfy bed... Close to everything. Cannot wait to go back! Only down fall is that you have to pay for parking which is $50 a 24hr period.

review.title: Loved every minute of it
review.reviewText: Was very pleased with the staff, very friendly and eager to help. The restaurant was also good the staff was also very friendly, the prices were a little high but San Francisco is not a cheap city.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is close to everything in Fisherman's Wharf...within walking distance to Ghirardelli Square and the waterfront, with easy access the cable car F line. The hotel had a nice pool and hot tub, and was a very comfortable place to stay.

review.title: Will definitely stay there again!
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time in San Francisco and loved staying at the Hyatt at Fishermans Wharf. We had a great corner room that was spacious and very comfortable. The concierge was not very helpful and a little less than knowledgeable, but we can overlook that as the rest of the experience was so nice.

review.title: Will definitely go back!
review.reviewText: We were surprised as to how nice the hotel and room were for the price we paid (expedia package). We were down the street from the wharf and pier 39. We were walking distance from all of the necessary transportation. The only negative thing is that the pool closed at nine pm was not heated. We didn't use the gym but it was open 24 hours.

review.title: Good place to stay and nice location.
review.reviewText: Location was great. The service of the hotel was good...Check in was slow. The rooms are clean and interior is updated. This was a girls weekend vacation and the rooms were shared with other women and it was hard to get us all dressed and out the door quickly because the only mirror was in the bathroom. But other than this minor issue I would stay here again!

review.title: Nice Hotel Location!
review.reviewText: Location was nice close to to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square, Cable Cars, Trolleys and more, but don't take your laptop or a car because parking overnight cost more than the car rental @ $45.00 per night, we turned ours in early after traveling to Miur Woods. Internet Access was an additional $9.99 per day! Starbucks is around the corner just use theirs. They put their thermostats for AC on the same wall as the AC so it reads 62deg when it's more like 81deg in the room and 62deg is as low as it will go! Staff is friendly No stairs Elevator only kinda wierd.

review.title: Great location!!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel location is fantastic. The front desk staff was very helpful with suggestion for restaurant and travel directions to Sonoma Valley. Rooms are very nice, bathroom are very clean and overall great service. We will come back to this hotel, Thanks Charlotte, NC

review.title: Labor Day Trip
review.reviewText: We arrived at the hotel and were greeted immediately with friendly smiling faces. The hotel has a great location very close to the wharf but also to the mass transit stations. Knuckles (attached bar and restaurant) has a great happy hour.

review.title: Excellent Staff
review.reviewText: The few times my wife and I had questions about directions or needed some sort of assistance the staff was wonderful in helping. They were very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Great location, nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Location is fantastic- near to Fisherman's Wharf, and North Beach is walkable or you can take a cable car which is just around the corner. Only complaint: hotel charges a daily fee ($9.95!)for internet access which in this day and age is outrageous. Complained to front desk and was told they were trying to make other arrangements in near future so they could provide free internet.

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf Best
review.reviewText: Very convenient location. Friendly staff and very helpful for tourist. Rooms clean and large. We would stay here again & again.

review.title: Very Happy with The Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Customer service excellent, comfy beds, lots of pillows, and close to everything that we wanted to do.

review.title: nice price,nice location to the water
review.reviewText: helpful,friendly staff. Concierge could have bee n more knowledgeable of the buslines. The bed was as comfortable as any 5-star-hotel.

review.title: Nice place if a bit over priced.
review.reviewText: We were here for 10 days and the lack of room amenities became an issue as our stay went on. Only a single cup coffee maker, no refrigerators or microwaves available made for a more expensive stay as we had to eat out every night. Aside for that the room was nice and clean as was the rest of the hotel. The pool and hot-tub were a god-send.

review.title: Best of the not so good
review.reviewText: This was definatelt one of the nicest hotels in this area but lacked a few key things that would have made our stay great. First, there are no microwaves, fridges, or dining table/chairs in the rooms. So if you are looking for a place to stay where you can bring back a meal you need to look elsewhere. Secondly, all the king rooms have huge showers and the queens have tubs, so depending on what you are looking for this may present a problem for you. Overall it was in a good location which was close to the tourist attractions and was clean.

review.title: Very convenient location - pretty clean-easy check-in and out
review.reviewText: Great convenient location! Excellent and affordable breakfast and lunch cafe directly across the street - The Hollywood Cafe!! Clean and private hotel even within the busy Fisherman Wharf area. Pool area very clean. Asked for mini-fridge upon arrival. It did not arrive on the first day. Asked again on the 2nd day and it was delivered within 10 minutes. Shower water pressure, so-so. Only real complaint is that the AC did not work that well at night, and the room was a bit stuffy for sleeping. Otherwise, it was a pretty nice place to stay overall. I would recommend it, especially if they improved the air cooling and ventilation system. Would consider staying again if I return to the area.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: good location - good service - good price

review.title: Best Place to Stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Hyatt was conveniently located within walking distance to transportation, activities, shopping & great restaurants. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Our room overlooked the courtyard and we had no noise problems. I would definately stay again and would recommend to others.

review.title: Great location!!!
review.reviewText: Great location for accessing the wharf restaurants and our CitySightseeing open top bus pickup point. Also, only a block from the wonderful Boudin Bakery.

review.title: Great hotel! I would certainly reommended it to my friends.
review.reviewText: Comfortable, accessible and the concerige was helpful and knowledgeable. Breakfast was great and they packed our left overs. I would certainly recommended it to my friends who want to stay in the Fisherman' Wharf area.

review.title: Near the Wharf
review.reviewText: Nice, clean place. A little pricey, but good service. Close to Pier 39.

review.title: Anniversary trip
review.reviewText: All in all a great hotel very clean, our first room didn't smell very good like a wet towel but they moved us right away and the second room smelled amazing staff was very helpful

review.title: No Problems
review.reviewText: Althought we didn't spend much time at the hotel, it was very clean and the staff was courteous. Conveniently located and surprisingly quiet. A refrigerator mysteriously appeared in our room the last night?. Would have like to have that the whole time! Overall, I would stay there again.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is in such a good location only a short walk to a ton of shops and restaurants. We had an issue with our room the bed was extremely uncomfortable but as soon as it was mentioned to the hotel staff they immediately moved us and this room's bed was way more comfortable. I wish I would have said something sooner. The hotel management felt so bad that they had a bottle of champagne sent to our room that day with a note apologizing for this room not meeting our standards.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: The Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf was wonderful. The location was absolutely perfect. The room was great. The food in the restaurant and room service was some of the best in San Fran. My youngest daughter especially liked the pool. Not too many hotels had outdoor pools, so this was an attractive feature. There is a cable car stop right around the corner that had no lines! You can walk everywhere from here or grab a bus, cab or trolley. There is a terrific sightseeing double decker bus depot right across the street and I highly recommend it. You get a great tour of the city and can hop on and off at major stops. Wish we would have done that earlier!

review.title: would stay here again
review.reviewText: our only complaintabout this hotel is that they dont use fitted sheets on the beds....they tuck top sheets, and every night when we woke up, the bed was a mess, and the bare mattress was exposed....other that that was a great plave to stay, and would recommend it

review.title: Great Place, Convenient location
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel. The people were helpful and accommodating. It was in a great location, close to the Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, Lombard St, several Bus stops and even the Trolley! We had breakfast everyday at the little cafe across the street and it was dee-lish!

review.title: Good Value, Great Location
review.reviewText: Headquarters for the family vacation to SF. Worked out great. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Great location and the price I got through Expedia was very reasonable. Pool was a little small but did the trick. Bring sweaters! It cools off at night at the wharf. Hotel limo to the airport was as cheap as a cab. You don't need a car as parking is very expensive and there's great public transit. Plenty of car rental agencies in the wharf area to rent a car from for the day trip to Napa etc.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were extremely nice and very helpful. The hotel is is in a great location....good walking distance to many of the great sites of San Fransico.

review.title: Pleasant Say at the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf,
review.reviewText: As stated in other reviews, the hotel room was clean and comfortable. The entire staff was helpful, polite, and cooperative. You had easy access to the bus and trolley cars. The hotel was very close to Pier 39 and other attractions. The neighborhood was safe and well maintained.

review.title: Close to the action
review.reviewText: Enjoyable stay and we were in the quiet room overlooking the pool. Great beds and we found all of the staff very welcoming and willing to please. Decor is on the "cool" side and we did not try the pool - SF in August is coooool! Fitness room has all you need to enjoy a work out. Hotel is close to the Wharf and tour bus/trams, so a good location. Knuckles the restaurant was much better than we had expected and we eat their 2 of 5 nights.

review.title: Loved San Fran...the Hotel was OK
review.reviewText: The Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf was nice. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I think the rooms, especially the bathrooms and hallways could use better lighting. The hotel is built around the pool so if you're room is not near the elevators it can be quite a hike getting to and from the hotel entrance. The location to the Fisherman's Wharf and the Trolley Cars was great! I liked it, but I'm not sure I would stay there again.

review.title: Very comfortable, good location
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, comfortable and centrally located in the Fisherman's Wharf area so getting around was easy. I was disappointed that the hotel did not offer a small coffee service in the lobby during the day. It would make for a nice amenity.

review.title: Excellent hotel!
review.reviewText: Very good.

review.title: would definitely stay at this hotel again
review.reviewText: great location-right in fisherman's wharf

review.title: Nice hotel on Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel room was nice and conveniently located. Biggest drawback was that there was not a refrigerator in the room. The concierge was useless, however the hotel/front desk staff was always ready to help.

review.title: Loved the location and I felt very safe.
review.reviewText: Staff were friendly and helpful.

review.title: Would stay here on my next visit
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, staff was friendly, and it was located in a great spot. We stayed in a large king room, which was very comfortable and nice. The rates were very reasonable too.

review.title: Definitely go there again!
review.reviewText: Location is great. Within walking distance to all the attractions. Cafe across the street serves wonderful breakfast. Beds are ultra comfortable and clean. Would recommend to anyone.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Room was clean, they will provide a refrigerator if you ask, they cannot provide rollaway bed due to fire codes. The beds were so comfy, lighting could be better. The location is great, close to Fishermans Wharf, cable car, Starbucks, Walgreens, Trader Joes and Safeway supermarket. No need to rent a car. Staff was friendly. Hollywood Cafe across the street was great for breakfast. Boudin Bakery on Jefferson Street is great for lunch or dinner. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Close to area attractions
review.reviewText: easy to get around by walking, trolly or bus line.

review.title: Comfortable and centrally located
review.reviewText: Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf was comfortable and centrally located to most of the activities we planned for our family. The down side is that outside the hotel it was "tourist ville". It was difficult to find a decent restaurant and experience the "true San Francisco".

review.title: pleasant and convenient
review.reviewText: My daughter, granddaughter and I had a great stay. We especially liked the convenience to the activities at Fisherman's Wharf as we had no vehicle. The staff was very helpful with any questions we had about the area or how to do what we needed to do (taxi, etc.) The reviews online were helpful as we were choosing where we wanted to stay and also gave us info about where to eat, things to see, how to get around the city. We would stay again.

review.title: One of the nicest hotel experiences.
review.reviewText: We had an early flight and got to the hotel about 11:15 am. What nice surprise our room was ready. Nicely decorated on the top floor. Everyone,including housekeeping,would always say hello. Ask is their anything I can do for you. We would certainly stay again.

review.title: try somewhere else
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were abrupt and appeared annoyed at having to deal with customers. Cleaning staff often left the room in no better condition than they found it (other than making the bed and changing the towels). The concierge(s) gave conflicting information from each other and were unaware or unable to find out what the previous concierge said.

review.title: Overall good experience
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Hyatt for 4 nights. Overall it was a good experience except for the following: there was a weird antiseptic smell once I got off the elevator and it extended all the way down the hallway and even into my room. Also, the shower doors did not close. It was just a glass enclosure that extended halfway around the shower and that led you to spill water all over the floor. The sink was really shallow and more often than not, I spilled water all over myself and over the counter. Another thing I didn't like was the extravagant parking fee and the wifi fee. Other than that, my room was very clean and everyone who worked there was very helpful. The hotel was close to everything we wanted to see and do as well as close to the cable cars, which was a big plus. I did not eat at Knuckles, so I can't comment on that restaurant. Overall it was a good experience, but I would probably want to try out other hotels in the area before I went back to this one.

review.title: would stay here again in a heartbeat
review.reviewText: "We completely enjoyed every bit of our stay here. What we loved was that this hotel is within walking distance of just about everyting that you could want to do. Fisherman's Wharf/Pier 39 etc. are only 3 blocks away. Many great restaurants w/i only a couple of blocks. Also, public transportation is very easy to use, so you don't even need to rent a car. The hotel staff is very friendly and extreemly helpful. Would absolutely reccommend this hotel. It made our experince in San Francisco very memorable.

review.title: Average experience
review.reviewText: It was an average experience there - the room wasnt as big as I had expected. I had requested a fridge in my room which was initially approved and then later on, I was never provided with one. There were hptel staff asking for boycotting the hotel right outside the door (some contract issue). The room service was ok.

review.title: Great Location, nice pool, a bit loud
review.reviewText: The walls/design/whatever allowed a lot of outside noise into the room. Not street noise, just noise from other rooms, the hallway, etc. Other than that, it was great.

review.title: Convenient for staying on Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf is a convenient hotel if you are enjoying activities around the Wharf. The hotel people were nice and efficient. The hotel seemed a bit small. We had breakfast in Knuckles and everything was yummy. Our room was nice. When we wanted a refrigerator, they brought one up free of charge. The lighting in the bathroom was very poor. And $45 to park your car overnight? Outragious!

review.title: Comfortable but a little worn
review.reviewText: The hotel was perfectly located. Room was a good size and clean, but it smelled as if it had been a smoking room at one time.

review.title: Great Trip
review.reviewText: Convienient Location . Purchased a City Pass and was able to get to everything by walking or taking Trolly cars or Busses or Cabel Cars.

review.title: Awsome
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Close to everything at Fishermans Warf. Only thing was no fridge in room. Otherwise it was good. Would definitely go back.

review.title: Overall Great Stay
review.reviewText: We arrived in San Francisco and went straight to the hotel around 2:00 (check-in is 3:00). Our room wasn't ready so we gave them our cell to call when ready. We went to Fisherman's Wharf and walked around to pass the time. Never heard from them so we went back around 4:30 to check. Room was ready then. While walking and checking out the room, we found fresh blood on the bedding. They were very apologetic and asked if we had a car parked there(We didn't). I guess they were going to offer free parking to us. We went to bed the first night and heard the people next to us until midnight. They wereso loud. Our room had the door to adjoin to the room next to us. The doors must be very thin. The beds were comfortable. The most comfortable hotel bed that I ever slept in. The rest of the stay was great. Every worker very friendly and willing to please. In walking distance to most tourist attractions that we visited. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

review.title: Extremely friendly
review.reviewText: Every person we encountered in this hotel was beyond friendly. Our room was very comfortable! We ate several meals in the hotel restaurant and experienced the same great service there as well. Breakfast was wonderful! The location is close to everything...we'll definitely be back!

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: I expect more from the Hyatt branding. The coffee and condiments were not replenished sufficiently; the shower cap was not replaced even when thrown away; used cups were not changed; and the biggest grouse was that there was not a single free channel on TV, making the TV essentially useless unless you pay. The mattress on the bed was too soft.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Walking distance to all - hotel bar/restaurant is nice

review.title: Would stay at the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf again in a heart beat.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, friendly/helpful staff, and great beds. Location to the Wharf, tour bus and cable cars couldn't be better. I traveled with my 11 year old grandson so the swimming pool was a plus. Not easy to find a hotel in the areas I wanted to stay with a pool.

review.title: Would have liked to have a room with a view
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful and friendly. Our room was nice,but when we opened the shades all we had was a view of the roof top. That was a little disapointing.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: You probably won't need a car for mostof your warf vacation if you stay here.. nottoo far from anything including car rental if needed. Cable/trolly cars are less than 3 minute walks and a Starbucks right around the corner...life if good!

review.title: Getaway with Kids
review.reviewText: This is a great place to stay, great location, great personel. The only problem was with the credit card we used for amenities. We used a bank card to pay for the trip through Expedia and my wifes bank card to hold for amenities. Since the Hyatt put a hold on each card for 500+ $ our bank card was over what we had in our account. Therefore we had to use our A/E card to hold the room. We lukily had cash for transportation to the Airport but the Hyatt and our bank took a couple of days to staighten out the confusion. Other than that we would stay there again in a heartbeat.

review.title: Definite recommendation
review.reviewText: The Hyatt is close to all attractions / tourist hot spots and is within walking distance to many of them - such as Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 and Ghiradelli Square. Access to public transport is just around the corner from the hotel. Great places to eat nearby the hotel too. The staff are extremely helpful, the rooms are kept very clean and I would definitely stay there again. (However, please note not to use the telephones in your room as I had a nasty shock when I received the bill!)

review.title: Clean & freindly
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean, staff was friendly. The bed was very comfortable, one of the best beds we have slept in ever while traveling. Hotel was close to everything on Fishermans Warf.

review.title: Excellent location & best bed around
review.reviewText: This hotel is two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. There is a cable car terminus around the corner and another within a few blocks. Staff is very helpful and there is a great concierge service as well. We were able to check in early and get settled and they held our bags after checkout until it was time to leave. The bed is one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in, so good a friend who'd previously stayed here called back to get the brand and bought it locally.

review.title: I loved it and it was so close to everything. Great staff..
review.reviewText: The staff was so nice and accomodating. I really enjoyed staying at the Hyatt. I would definitely go back.

review.title: Not for people who want sleep
review.reviewText: The housekeeping staff at this hotel is very inconsiderate every morning. Starting at 8 a.m. there's a party in every hall while they get their supplies and start cleaning rooms. Also, there are a lot of roudy guests and management seems to ignore the problem. Bring ear plugs! Also, don't expect a nice view from your room window.

review.title: I will always stay @ the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf when in San Francisco..
review.reviewText: The hotel was in close proximity to Wharf, Pier 39 and other attractions. Footsteps away from the "F" line and Muni Transportation that took you anywhere you wanted to go. The reception staff was professional and very helpful. LOVE IT!!

review.title: Highly recommend this hotel!
review.reviewText: Clean, recently updated, very close to attractions and the consierge (sp?) was extremely helpful!

review.title: Great Location for San FranciscoVacation
review.reviewText: The Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf is convenient to so many SF attractions. Fisherman's Wharf,Pier 33 for Alcatraz tour, Pier 39 to see the sea lions,Pier 41 for ferry boat to Sausalito, Ghiradelli Square, and the cable cars to go to Chinatown and Union Square are all within walking distance. Concierge is very helpful in suggesting tour companies for side trips. We enjoyed Muir Woods, the wine country, Yosemite and Monterey and Carmel.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: This is very nice place to stay for business or pleasure. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The the food and service at the restaurant was excellent.

review.title: Good service i will recomended to friends
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpfull all the times, excellent service, I will stay in the future again

review.title: Would stay here again.
review.reviewText: This hotel was an excellent location and very nice. The concierge was helpful but busy a lot of the time. I don't know about the street side rooms but I was amazed at how quiet our room was (we were courtyard side) for the location of the hotel.

review.title: Loved it!!
review.reviewText: Great location, easy to walk to the wharf and Pier 39. Cable Cars across the street. Hollywood Cafe across the street had the BEST breakfasts in town and great service. We had a great trip. Everyone at hotel was kind and helpful. Highly would recommend.

review.title: Great place to stay!!
review.reviewText: We stayed for two nights and loved this hotel. Close to the Wharf and all the fun San Francisco has to offer.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: the rooms were very nice. the staff was very accomodating and the location was excellent. the only downside was the parking, it is not free or cheap.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: The Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf is a great hotel with good service. It is in a central location that is located close to all sight seeing attractions. Rooms where clean and beds were very comfortable. If you plan to visit San Francisco, I definitely recommend this hotel!

review.title: Would stay here again.
review.reviewText: Our stay here was perfect--beds were comfortable, all our requests were met, the concierge was helpful, the staff was friendly and the adjacent restaurant was a little pricey but had delicious food.

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: Perfect location! Would go back to this hotel in a heartbeat.

review.title: Excellent value
review.reviewText: Excellent value for money in the hart of San Francisco's tourist area.

review.title: Pretty good over all!
review.reviewText: We went to San fran with my folks and got a great deal on rooms and a rental car. Our room was very nice. The bed was very comfortable. Tuesday morning (our first morning) we were woken up by a loud protest at 7am. There were ex-staff picketing the hyatt shouting "Check out of the hyatt, labour dispute in progress..." I can't remember the rest of the rant, but they were shouting it through a blow horn. This lasted about an hour and they circled the building about 20 times. This was the only day they botherd us. Happy hour at knuckles was awesome. $2.50 pints 4pm-7pm. The pool was nice but pretty small. On a nice day there were about 20 kids in there screaming and splashing. Hot tub had people waiting almost all the time as only 4 people can fit comfortably.

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay. The room was very quiet, even with it being across from the laundry/snack room. Comfortable beds. Wonderful service for breakfast and the food was delicious and fresh. Super location to the wharf and other tourist areas.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: Close to Fisherman's harf and activities

review.title: Great location, very comfortable
review.reviewText: We were able to check in two hours early and leave our bags at the hotel after checkout. This was very convenient for us. The room was clean and comfortable, and the location was great for Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, and Alcatraz, and convenient to public transportation.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: its not high quality hotel at all,not the Hyatt's you know.Poor place,very expensive valet parking,(more thene a car rental cost).its like a joge to call this place even 2 star hotel.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Good location, comfortable bed. Nice pool, good breakfast.

review.title: Would stay there again
review.reviewText: We had a very nice time in San Francisco and part of the reason was because we had such a nice hotel. It was clean and updated. The room was small, but we didn't care because it was so comfortable. Great location, we didn't need a car. We would definately stay there again.

review.title: Super experience
review.reviewText: Wonderful service. Great location. Extremely QUIET! despite being right on the Wharf. Great fitness room/pool/hot tub. Would definetly stay here again

review.title: Clean & Comfortable
review.reviewText: We only spent one night there and during our stay we were completely satisfied.

review.title: Location is great.
review.reviewText: Location is great for getting around the city. Could work on cleanliness an upkeep. hallways seemed a bit dirty. Also service at the wine bar was not the best. Visited on a Monday night and sat there for about 20 minutes before someone came out.

review.title: Would definately go back
review.reviewText: We spent the night in San Francisco with our 2 kids (8 and 6) and we loved the hotel. The front desk people were very helpful and the hotel was located near all the attractions that we came to see. We walked everywhere, so it was nice to leave the car parked. Though you are going to have to pay for parking everywhere, you didn't need to look for a spot because the valet took care of it. They were very helpful and directed us on where to go and mapped it out for us. It was quiet, staff was friendly, and we would go back and stay again.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: My kids and I really enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt. The location was central to all we wanted to do and see in San Fran. The room was very clean and comfortable. We would visit there again!

review.title: Nice hotel in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel right in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf. Not to close but a few blocks away from all the main attractions. Hotel was comfortable and the staff very accomadating.

review.title: would go back,very convienant
review.reviewText: Rooms were comfortable,service was good.Also the management was very accomadating to our needs.The next time we go to San Fran I will stay her again.5 block walk to pier 39.

review.title: Perfect hotel and what a location,
review.reviewText: Hotel was recently updated and it was very nice. I would recommend to all. Quiet area and within walkin distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Ferry to Alcatraz Island, China Town, Downtown, Cable Cars, The Buena Vista and we were picked up at the hotel for a day in Napa Valley. We never even rented a car. This hotel was a great starting poing for all our vacation plans.

review.title: location is great!
review.reviewText: The Hyatt was clean, comfortable and relaxing. Very close to all the attractions that are around the area.

review.title: Nice hotel - great location?
review.reviewText: If you plan on staying at Fisherman's Whart - this is the hotel to choose! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and the rooms were the quality I have come to expect from a Hyatt. The hotel is a 2 block walk to all of Fisherman's Whart and about 10 min walk to Pier 39.

review.title: A very nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is extremely convenient to Fishermen's Wharf and a short walk to views of the bay. The pool courtyard was a little loud when kids were playing during the day, making it hard to take an afternoon nap, if you are so inclined (I was on the fifth floor and you could hear them easily). The rooms were decorated more contemporary, and there was a nice glass shower, but no bathtub. Otherwise, the hotel was nice, in a great location, and the staff were very accommodating.

review.title: Excellent Staff and Great Location!
review.reviewText: The location is within super close proximity of the Wharf and one of the cable car transit centers. The staff helped with directions, opinions on things to do, and had an overall pleasant attitude. The $45/day valet charge seemed a little excessive but parking in the wharf is extremely limited so it was worth it to have peace of mind for the car. They also have a heated swimming pool and jacuzzi so you can still go swimming while fighting off the chills from those Bay breezes. Another great thing about this hotel is the Hollywood Cafe across the street. We ate breakfast there every morning of our stay. If I ever decide to visit SF again I'd be eager to stay at this hotel.

review.title: Wonderful Location in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Ideal location to stay in the Fisherman Wharf area. Real close to getting the best Dungeness Crabs. Go to Nicks Fishmarket and tell them to spice it up with garlic and extra spices.

review.title: Wonderful bed, terrible food
review.reviewText: My toddler son and I joined my husband on a business trip. On the positive, the staff was very useful, assisting us so we could get attached rooms so the little guy could have his own room. The concierge and front desk staff were helpful to me, even referring me to a nearby local nail place so I could get a manicure as the little guy napped in his stroller. Downside, in our room, there was a sliding door to the bathroom that didn't lock, so it became a constant game for our 18-month old to open and close the sliding door. Also, the food at the restaurant was really fast-food, fried and terrible. Could not believe this was California! Thankfully I found a nearby Trader Joes to get a few things for the baby during the day. Neither room had a refrigerator, so I kept the baby's milk in ice buckets. A fridge would have been useful. But all hotel staff I interacted with were very great, very friendly. Oh, and the beds were exceptional.

review.title: Amazing hotel
review.reviewText: The service at the Hyatt was top-notch, and the location was very convenient to Fisherman's Wharf/Ghiradelli Square. The hotel room was immaculate and very stylish. The only flaw was lack of a fridge in the room. Otherwise, everything was great! I'd definitely go back.

review.title: best hotel i ever stayed at,going back in nov.
review.reviewText: The only thing i don't really like is $45 a day for car parking i think a lil too much ,maybe next time when i go there in san francisco is not to rent a car.

review.title: Good for the area
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in the Fisherman's wharf area. Nothing special but no disappointments. All staff that I dealt with were VERY friendly and helpful. Special request was handled prior to our arrival.

review.title: Great hotel!!
review.reviewText: It was my first stay in SF. The hotel has a great location. It is about 2 blocks in from the main water where everything is. The staff were nice, helpful and provided excellent service. Rooms were very clean, comfy, and modern. Didn't use it this time, but it's nice they have room service as an option. Can't wait to stay again!

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf Weekend Stay
review.reviewText: We had decided last minute to take a weekend trip with the family. Nice hotel, very friendly and very helpful with directions and suggestions on where to go and what to see. We took a taxi to/from the airport, but local transportation is great and within walking distance to everything near Pier 9, only blocks away, no taxis needed. Very nice.

review.title: Couldn't have been better!!!
review.reviewText: My two teenagers and I took my father on a vacation to San Francisco to add to his "bucket list". The Hyatt was perfectly located and added to our perfect stay. Room was a little small for the four of us, but the beds were wonderful after a long day out exploring. It was very nice not to hear the people in the next room. Very quiet. Service and staff were very accommodating.

review.title: Great hotel and location
review.reviewText: Was very satified with the hotel and location, however this time we traveled with our daughter and had to stay in a room with two beds which only came with double beds (didn't have queen size beds) which was very very uncomfortable for my wife and I.The last time we stayed there we had a king size bed and it was wonderful.

review.title: Quality all the way.
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, very clean room. Great place to eat at Knuckles(nachos with the steak, awesome). Looking forward to staying there again.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: The hyatt hotel was a great choice for our trip. The hotel was beautiful and had a great restaurant in the hotel. The location was perfect near fisherman's wharf, but not too busy. It was within walking distance to everything. The rooms and the entire hotel itself were modern and clean. We would definitely love to stay again.

review.title: impressed
review.reviewText: great customer service in a well maintained atmosphere w/in hotel

review.title: A great base for a great holiday
review.reviewText: The Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf is a great base and is perfectly located for visitors who want easy access to the Wharf and all its attractions. The city centre is a short walk away and bus/cable car services are minutes from the door. Although heavily used to host conferences, the hotel staff are friendly and happy to help with queries and requests. Te hotel has a modern feel and the rooms are nicely finished and well maintained. Knuckles restaurant and sports bar was a surprise hit considering it owned and managed by the hotel. It stands up as a restaurant and bar in its own right service good affordable food and a decent selection of beers and cocktails. Ideal after days spent walking around the city when the convenience of a quick ride down in the lift is just too tempting.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay here and would definitely stay here again. The food at Knuckles was delicious

review.title: pass
review.reviewText: this hotel is the 'ghetto' of the san francicso wanna-be upper class hotels. $50 a day for parking, which they don't mention ahead of time, be warned. the room had the loudest toilet i've ever heard, no fridge, broken desk chair, one hook in the bathroom to hang towels, etc. won't be going back.

review.title: Great location, clean, comfortable room.
review.reviewText: Very comfortable beds. Location was perfect with the cable car just around the corner, and a short stroll to the wharf. Room was clean and staff were courteous.

review.title: Definitely statying here when we go back!
review.reviewText: Upon arrival, our room was facing the courtyard. The Hyatt offered us an upgrade which we gladly took. The room was on the top floor overlooking the Wharf. It was wonderful!!! The restaurant located at the hotel had some of the best food we experienced in our 7 days in San Francisco. The service was excellent, from the front desk to the valet! I would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend it to ANYONE!

review.title: Loved San Francisco and a week was a perfect time to see all that we wanted to.
review.reviewText: The Hyatt was so very quiet and this was bliss. It had been recently renovated and was very comfortable, but grey paint in the rooms??? We had been allocated a room with a king sized bed by Expedia but when we arrived we were told that we had two queen sized beds but for an extra $20 a night we could 'upgrade'. We looked at both rooms and decided not to bother. We had read the reviews about the dodgy walk-in showers! We felt that $10 for wi-fi was a rip off as you could walk into small cafes nearby and use the internet for free. Also $5 dollars for a bottle of water in the room (unchilled as there is no fridge) was also a bit steep.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: I stayed with my two kids, ages 7 and 8. We loved the room, the pool and the location. The service and staff was great. We had one small problem getting towels at the pool one evening, but they eventually came. And there was a lot of party noise outside at 2 am, when the bars closed. I imagine it is the same at all the hotels in this neighborhood. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Uncomfortable beds
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed at numerous Hyatt's throughout the years and have always been impressed with the accomodations and the friendliness and helpfullness of the staff. But this hotel needs some more comfortable beds!

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: The biggest problem? My kids didn't want to leave the pool, we might has well have stayed in our own town!

review.title: Will be back again!!!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: Good location expect nothing to view cause it's only 5 storey building.

review.title: Our 2 Day Trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel was everything we expected it to be. Before we booked this hotel, we read the reviews of other people. The location of this hotel was amazing, it's a short walk to all the sights, sounds and wonder of San Francisco. The room rate was amazing as well. Our room was facing the pool and you could hear all the kids yelping and screaming from our room (the fourth floor). Try to get a room away from the pool

review.title: Excellent service!
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful experience at the Hyatt. From the moment we reached the registration desk to the day we checked-out everyone treated us like VIPs. Our only concern was the service at the valet. For example, when we arrived, the gentleman working at the outside valet desk made no effort to approach our car as we were trying to decide where to park our vehicle while we checked-in. The poor service we experienced at the valet was even more disheartening after we learned the high rates we were paying per night to park our vehicle at the hotel. At those rates we should have been treated much better. Overall we enjoyed the hotel and appreciated the great service while inside the Hyatt. Next time we will probably find another place to park our vehicle.

review.title: Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf SF
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and conveniently located. The breakfast buffet was really good and perfect for kids.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel was close to everything, just a short walk to all restaurants and the wharf. Hotel was extremely clean and the staff was great. The restaurant in the hotel was good and the bar even better. I would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great Location!!!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hyatt for 3 nights. It was comfortable and our bed was heavenly. I could have slept all day if we didn't have anything planned. It was close to transportation and we were able to get around the city quite well. Staff was friendly and helpful. The shower would be the only thing I would complain about. It only had one glass door that was sealed permanently shut so you had to get in the shower in order to turn on the water and when the water hits you its freeezing and since its an open shower water tends to get all over the floor. Other than that we had a great trip!

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: We could walk everywhere we wanted to go or take a double-decker bus or cable car. Everything's "pricey" in that area, but service & cleanliness were great! Never felt unsafe either! Wish there would've been a refrigerator & microwave in the room.

review.title: Close to the Wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean. Continental breakfast was very good. A couple blocks off the wharf! There was no outside noise heard. The bathrooms are a bit odd since the doors don't lock and a slit is left in the middle once closed which is directly infront of the toilet. I wouldn't recommend it if travelling with others your not that close too.

review.title: nice hotel but...
review.reviewText: we needed a rollaway - they said it couldn't be done due to fire restrictions, even though we had requested it. No queen beds, just doubles making it tight for family of 4. Parking is $45 per day...really good location and near the wharf, etc.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel is not even close to the class that is suppose to represent. Did not enjoy my stay there and I'll never go back.

review.title: Good Hotel, well located
review.reviewText: Good food at the Knuckles Sports Bar in hotel. Although we didn't use it (we didn't have car), the Valet Parking charges were HUGE - $45/night

review.title: Hyatt at Fishermann's Wharf
review.reviewText: Disappointed with location. In SF a couple blocks or accross the street is the difference in your views, there are no views, it is interior to the wharf. This is more of a business hotel. Roomservice is great. The decor is very modern minimal, did not appreciate shower stall with overhead rain spray too difficult to wash off. Bed super comfy. Room too minimal for my taste. Walk to wharf just two blocks. Parking 45$ per day! That was a bit much for this little hotel.

review.title: Most comfortable hotel bed
review.reviewText: The hotel had one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. The room was very clean and tastefully decorated. The staff was helpful and friendly. I feel we got a great room for the price. It was also conveniently located to many of the things we wanted to see and do. Public transportation was avialable and the hotel staff was extremely helpful with giving directions.

review.title: it was a good hotel
review.reviewText: it was close to a lot of things to walk to. The cafe across the street was wonderful, Hollywodd Cafe. They served the best breakfast and very inexpensive.

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: The room was great! The beds were comfortable. The room was very clean and staff were very nice. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Hotel was okay
review.reviewText: The Hyatt was clean and fairly convenient to Fisherman's Wharf. Parking is expensive and because of the layout of the hotel, the walk to our room from the elevators was long. The breakfast buffet at Knuckle's was good.

review.title: Lovely hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf. It is a beautiful hotel with great amenities. The restaurant has been newly remodeled, and the food was great. We also had so many options for good meals in the neighborhood. Within walking distance to both ends of the Wharf, close to our favorite restaurant - The Blue Mermaid. There is also a nice little cafe across the street for a quick breakfast or an afternoon smoothy. Half a block to the cable car, easy walk to the streetcars that travel the wharf. Both Trader Joe's and Barnes & Noble are across the street. Very lively neighborhood, but the hotel itself was quiet. We enjoyed the heated outdoor pool and spa even on chilly days, since they are enclosed in a courtyard out of the wind. The staff was so helpful and the concierge service was very good. I look forward to going back.

review.title: Loved the place
review.reviewText: Great hotel, would definately go back again, Knuckles bar and staff great, great service. Only disappointment was having to pay for airport shuttle, would have thought this would have been complimentary.

review.title: great place to stay close to everything!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice. Very clean and people that work there were very helpful. The one thing that wasn't good was Knuckles restaurant, food wasnt good besides that I would go back.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf is convenient to many of the top San Francisco locations and the cable cars. The rooms were comfortable, priced right, and the heated pool was a hit. The hotel's restaurant serves very good food in large portions at very reasonable prices.

review.title: Wouldn't change a thing
review.reviewText: This is a hotel with upscale quality without the upscale price. In 8 days we never had a noise disturbance. The rooms are top notch as long as you don't mind a large shower as there is no bath. The clientelle seems like mostly tourists and conference people without so much of the party crowd. The attached restaurant has a breakfast buffet which is not cheap but worth every penny Only complaint is that local calls are not free. Handy to many tourist attractions and cable car to downtown. Would gladly stay again.

review.title: great deal
review.reviewText: cool

review.title: Great Location.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were very pleasant to deal with. Very helpful. Rooms we're clean and decor is modern. Lighting could be better a bit to dim for my taste. Very quite place to relax. Excellent location walking distance to the Piers, Ghiradelli Square, Lombard Street. Cable Cars/Trolleys. Cant wait to go back to stay there.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is situated just right for walking to everything, it was quiet and clean and I would stay here again. All the staff was very helpful and friendly as well.

review.title: If I go back to SanFrancisco, I would not hesitate and would most likely stay at this hotel.
review.reviewText: The room was excellent and clean and made up before lunch each day. All the staff weather it be cleaning, at the front desk or at the bar/restaurant were all very courteous and helpfull and pleasant(great job). The hotel is well located to all the tours and fisherman's wharf

review.title: Would love to go back!
review.reviewText: The location was great, the beds were very comfortable, rooms were very clean and staff was very friendly and helpful. Would stay there again.

review.title: great experience!
review.reviewText: great hotel with great service!!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Hotel very clean, room a good size, staff helpfull.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: We booked and paid for this hotel in Sept 08 for our trip in Feb 08. All that we requested was a room with a view. we were put way in the back of the hotel miles away from the elevators and when we looked out our window all we could see was a dead end. Also we paid for the Hyatt name and parking was an extra $45.00 per nite. Felt very unwelcome. As I said everything was paid for months in advance... We will never stay at Hyatt again

review.title: Well located
review.reviewText: The room was beautifully decorated, however did not feel comfortable to stay in. We would have like to have a small table and a couple of chairs to sit to converse and have a glass of wine. There was a chaise lounge, but awkward for two people. The lighting in the bathroom was horrible for makeup etc. and the blinds on the windows were sheer so the street light shone in our room. The bed however was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept on and the rooms were very clean.

review.title: Would stay there every time!
review.reviewText: We were thrilled with our stay here. I happen to HATE all hotel rooms because I am very picky about cleanliness. This hotel was wonderful! The rooms were impeccably clean and spacious. The hotel staff was like no other. Always a smile and a " How can I help you Mrs.L..". I was extrememly impressed and delighted to stay there!

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is very clean, very modern and updated which was nice. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. The only thing is the bathroom is so futuristic, that it's not very comfortable. The shower has only half of a door, whcih was a little wierd to me. But I am sure it's cutting edge decor that I am just not hip to. Overall, great hotel in a great location and we had a fantastic time in San Francisco overall. What an amazing city!

review.title: will go back to hotel again
review.reviewText: we were very pleased with this hotel: very neat and clean, larger room, good location, and great staff. Ivy esp. at the front desk made our anniversary trip special. Thank you, and we'll stay with you again.

review.title: great time and deal
review.reviewText: great clean room; loved the rain shower and king- size bed

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: Good location for getting around San Francisco. Lots of activities within walking distance. The hotel itself has lovely, modern rooms and very quiet. It was ideal for our visit to SF.

review.title: Worked out well
review.reviewText: This Hyatt itself was your typical nice hotel, but it's location was amazing! You're within easy walking distance to the wharf, Pier 39, the Powell Hyde Street cable car pick up and the first stop on the F-Line street car. You can take the F-Line a many other areas of note and to any bus station around. It's so simple. It's also a very safe feeling neighborhood. I was traveling with only one other woman and we felt perfectly safe walking back to the hotel at night after dinner and drinks.

review.title: Fun time for family.
review.reviewText: Clean, large room with great location two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. Pool was perfect for the kids, but shallow (3.5') for adults (my 7 yr old LOVED it).

review.title: a little disappointed
review.reviewText: Visited in early January. Very well located, right in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf but I was generally disappointed. Turned off by the $5.00 price tag on bottles of water that were left in the room for us (Aquafina water that has been proven to be no better than tap water). Also by the $7.00 price tag on 15 minutes of internet use when the hotel across the street offered free internet. My friend accidentally selected a pay movie on the tv and tried to cancel it but the second you select something, you can no long "deselect" it. That cost us almost $15.00 and I was charged approximately $10.00 for a long distance call that took no longer than one minute. I had read on this site that the staff was so friendly but frankly I was not impressed. The concierge was alright but was not particularly generous with his time. I wasn't expecting him to spend hours with me but when I asked one question, I felt like I was imposing to ask a 2nd question. Another thing I didn't like were the dark hallways. It seems that a couple of lights would make it a bit more cheery. On the positive side, the rooms were very clean, the beds were extremely comfortable, and the gym, although much smaller than I'd been led to believe, was still pretty serviceable. I would recommend this hotel, due to the location, cleanliness and reasonable price, but would caution people to prepare for the way they try to grab you for every extra dollar that they can.

review.title: Excellent Wharf Hotel worth a visit.
review.reviewText: Fantastic wharf hotel. I stayed here over the New Year and I would recommend this to anyone. Heated outdoor pool and terrace. Rooms, spacious, clean and good complimentary toiletries. No charge for freephone telephone calls. Beds are over-sized for anyone from the UK and very comfortable. Free business centre for on-line flight check in etc. at reception. Knuckles restaurant was closed due to renovations, however I have eaten in there before and I would definitely recommend it. Overall a pleasureable stay that makes me want to keep returning.

review.title: Great location, great service
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel. My only complaint was there are no towel racks in the bathroom. That and the $45 a night charge for the car, but you can't get around that in SF.

review.title: Worked out great
review.reviewText: Very classy hotel. The one thing that bothered me was that the parking is $40 a day to park. Other than that, it was an awesome hotel and the staff was very accommodating. Also, we didn't get the voucher for our continental breakfast until the 4th day of our stay.

review.title: An excellent Hotel Close to Everything
review.reviewText: The Hyatt Fisherman's Warf Hotel was clean, with all services available and excelent attention. In additon, its proximity to the warfs made our tourist activities magnificent and pleasant. We'll soon return.

review.title: more than impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel staff went out of thier way to be helpful especially Mark. Hotel was in an ideal spot central to everything Would definately stay there again

review.title: very nice, very friendly and helpful staff
review.reviewText: Rooms are modern and very nice with plasma TV, beds are very confortable, good choice if you want to be in this area, (there are many hotels nearby) cable car one block around the corner, many restaurants are close and your are walkin distance from Ghirardelli and the fishermans Warf

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: A last minute reservation which turned out to be very pleasant. Not cheap, but you get what you pay for. A clean and well run establishment: staff were friendly, courteous and helpful. We originally did not plan to hire a car, but had to, to meet with our plans, and then encountered difficulties with parking. It is expensive at the hotel and takes a bit of juggling to get parked at a reasonable rate - can be done with a little investigation. Sadly, the "Knuckles" bar was closed for renovation - this looks to be a good feature. The gym is to be recommended too.

review.title: Wow! $49 Overnight Parking
review.reviewText: Wow! $49 Overnight Parking

review.title: Great location, great service, great price
review.reviewText: The hotel was located right on the wharf. The staff was very helpful with all request (giving out directions, even pointing out an alternate location for parking that would be more economical). The room was very clean and very well decorated. I was very satisfied with my stay.

review.title: Would highly recommend
review.reviewText: Great location as a home base. Close to many attractions within walking distance.

review.title: Hyatt Fishermans Warf - Nice hotel but beware of parking rates
review.reviewText: The hotel was top notch! Friendly, accomodating staff, nice room, good location. The only "problem" (but it's not necessarily Hyatt's fault) is the 'out-of-touch' parking rates for the area. We had to pay $!!.!!/day for valet parking.(They said don't use actual dollars) The hotel says it's the going-rate for the area (and to be fare they took 1 night's parking off when I complained). In a time of the worst recession since the 1930's, and tourism about to take the hardest hit, I think parking for a week should be less than airfare from the east coast.

review.title: Best Home cooked food at Fishermans Wharf, in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt, at fishermans wharf in San Francisco. excellant service.

review.title: Great Location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I had never been to San Francisco before and was not sure of which hotel or area to choose. I could not have been any happier with my selection to stay at the Hyatt in Fisherman's Wharf. Great location for walking and catching local transportation. The hotel was immaculate, and the staff could not have been any nicer.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: The hotel was close to most of the major attractions like the pier, Ghiradelli and the Cannery and best of all the trolley service!! The restaurant/bar had a nice relaxed atmosphere and it was very spacious and bright where you couild see the action outside.. Staff was very friendly and helpful and the room service was prompt and dependable.. If you are goingto spend time in San Francisco, this is where you want to be!!!!!!!!!!

review.title: Its was mostly all good
review.reviewText: Great location. It the middle of all the action. Room was very nice with a couple of exceptions. The first thing that I thought was terrible was the cost of parking. It was as much as the room. Also, got some kind of bite in the room that has lasted 2 weeks is still there. That could be coincidence but it is not nice. Everything was great. The near perfect vacation

review.title: PERFECT HOTEL
review.reviewText: PERFECT HOTEL, I THINK THE NICEST I'VE EVER STAYED AT AND CLOSE TO EVERYTHING. YOU REALLY COULDN'T ASK FOR MORE. THE TROLLEY'S RIGHT ACROSS THE STREET, AS STARBUCKS, BUS LINES, THE WHARF IS RIGHT THERE, EVEN WHERE YOU GET ON THE RED TOUR BUS STATION IS RIGHT THERE. EVERYTHING IS ONLY A FEW BLOCKS, IT'S GREAT.

review.title: Great holiday trip
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely nice, very helpful, especially the wait staff at the restaurant. They recommended lots to do for the Thanksgiving holiday, place to eat, to do, etc.

review.title: Great location with excellent restaurant service.
review.reviewText: Very convenient location. The restaurant service was excellent.

review.title: Warm Staff. Nice hotel. Very clean.
review.reviewText: The staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. The rooms are very nice and clean. I took my niece to Fisherman's Wharf for her 13th Birthday. It was her first time to San Francisco, and she had a great time. I recommend this hotel if you are looking for something economical, without sacrificing cleanliness or great service.

review.title: Great Location!!
review.reviewText: Comfortable, clean, quiet, central location, couldn't have had a better stay.

review.title: GOOD OPTION IF YOU TRAVEL WITH CHILDREN
review.reviewText: for the price that you pay is ok.

review.title: Nice and Convinent
review.reviewText: Hyatt at the Fisherman's wharf was a nice moderiniezed hotel with it's own seasoned bar. Very close to the Piers and the rooms are fairly comfortable. It has everything you need, except for a bath tub in the upgraded suites. overall it was worth the $$.

review.title: Would stay at this hotel again!
review.reviewText: Great location! Great hotel!

review.title: E xcellent location close to many sights
review.reviewText: Hotel is ideally located to many sights and pick up points for bus tours.

review.title: Great Stay!!
review.reviewText: Great location, we were able to get anywhere we wanted easily by walking or public transportation. Had a great time, even in the rain. Can't wait to go back. We will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Added to our perfect trip
review.reviewText: The rooms were great! Comfterble, clean and cozy. Hotel was nicely remodeled. Good service! It was nice having a bar/reastaurant with a pool table in the hotel. THe hotel had a great location. Right in the heart of the Fishermans Wharf. Great for going out for strolls or out to eat. Also close enough to Union square. Trolly right in front of the hotel. Good value for the quality. Will defenetly recomend to others.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: We were in San Fransisco for a long weekend. Had rented a car to attend sporting events. Other than going to those events, the car was not necessary. We were able to take in plenty of sites with the transportation provided and so many of the things we wanted to enjoy were within walking distance. Had a great weekend in spite of the rain!

review.title: great location, nice hotel
review.reviewText: The Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf is a great location for tours and only a few blocks from the beautiful bay views. The area is clean and safe. The rooms are spacious and the beds are the most comfortable of any hotels we have visited. Staff is friendly and very helpful with transportation if needed. It was nice to use the hot tub after long walks around the area.

review.title: Great hotel in lots of ways
review.reviewText: After spending long hours trying to choose a hotel for our stay, we opted for quality over location. However we need not have been worried about compromising location, the numerous means of transport meant that the city centre was so accessible and we actually preferred being in a quieter neighbourhood than central. We stayed for 5 nights and the room was huge and luxurious. My husband spent many hours relaxing in the hot tub after long hours walking, and I enjoyed the gym (cold wet towels provided for after your work out and complimentary headphones!). There was really nothing negative to say about the hotel, even their restaurant which had been reviewed as expensive was great quality and had a nice atmosphere and we found to be no more pricey than others for evening meals. Although hotel charges for the internet it wasn't unreasonable. Milk not provided for coffee was the only negative I could come up with, but that was easily resolved by a trip to Safeway!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is only a block or so from Fisherman's Wharf. It is exactly what I would expect from a Hyatt - the staff were very friendly and the service was exceptional. The rooms are well appointed, 'glossy' and very clean. I didn't eat in the hotel - there's so much choice in the area! There is a coin operated laundry in the hotel which is handy if you're away for awhile. This area is very safe - even at night.

review.title: Great hotel in San Fran
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel in the heart of it all.

review.title: Nice Place - with drawbacks
review.reviewText: The location is great, right by the Warf. As very frequent travelers, we appreciated the hotel's layout, the charm of the staff and the auto valet service. The hotel eatery could have ben better, but there is so much good food in SF that it was not an issue. The bed was large and comfortable. The gripe we had (and it's a big one) is that the shower was AWFUL. The head was on the ceiling and impossible to poaition. There was no shower door, just a walk around, and this made the shower cold and not very user friendly. Furthermore, the bathroom double-pocket doors did not shut fully, making bathroom privacy impossble. We would recommend this place if you can overlook the bathroom, however, we will stay at another hotel when we go back.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Would stay again. Close to the wharf etc. Very helpful staff. Also great little breakfast place across the street. Meals named after famous actors and actresses.

review.title: Would stay here again.
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is convienent for everything. The hotel is well maintained. The fitness room has excellent equipment. The pool is nice. THe staff is very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Hotel with no view
review.reviewText: The hotel was extremely clean and the staff was very helpful. The only drawback was that we asked for a room with a city (exterior view) was given a room with a view of another room across the roof. Good central location but there are many other hotels in the area that offer the same no view, and quality service for a lot less money.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Great

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would stay here again if we visit SF. The service was great, friendly staff and they even offered us a room despite being 6 hours early for check in. The room was excellent (no noisy fridge) and bed very comfy. The location at Fisherman's Wharf was also great, close enough to all the attractions but far enough away from the noise. The food is pricey, but recommend the buffet breakfast in the restaurant.

review.title: Just Great
review.reviewText: The hotel is well located near Fisherman's Wharf and the end of the local cable car line. All the staff were friendly, helpful and very knowledgeable. Recommendations on great restaurants were right on. The adjoining Sports Bar/restaurant was a bit pricey and rather inpersonal. Right across the street is a little restaurant called "The Hollywood Cafe" that was terrific and became our daily destination for breakfast. I would also recommed anyone in the area to take in the show "Beach Blanket Babylon" it is a short walk from the hotel and is one of the most entertaining shows I have ever seen. We will definitely stay at the Hyatt if ever in San Francisco again.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Hotel has a great location, it is only 2 blocks from the waterfront and is centally located along the water front.

review.title: Friendliest Hotel Staff!
review.reviewText: The Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf has the friendliest staff I've ever encountered. The Concierge was always helpful and informative, Room Service Personnel made sure we got everything we wanted, and the Valet and Maid Service were extremely nice. The entire staff welcomed us every time we entered the hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: Would always stay here
review.reviewText: The location, employee efficiency of this hotel made our stay most enjoyable. The sports bar attached had great food, and the tours we booked with the hotel concierge were great.

review.title: Next time in San Francisco, I will definitely stay here again.
review.reviewText: For many hotels of the same class, this hotel has the most comfy bed I have ever slept in. We woke up with no itchy skin that we sometimes get from staying at some hotels. It is neither the most expensive nor the cheapest hotel but the bed comfort was worth every penny. Excellent location. The Powell-Mason cable car is right at the SE corner. Very convenient if you dont mind waiting in line for 0.5hr to get on it during peak hour. There are many bus/streetcar stops within 1 blk. Before we arrived, we have heard of many shower room story from web-reviewers. But it turned out they gave us a room with bathtub so that was even better! There was no bar fridge in the room. We asked and they put a complementary bar fridge in the room at no charge. They would charge you heavily for the bottled water though (a bottle cost $5). But we get around it just fine by stopping at Safeway or Walgreen to buy water (1.5 blks away). And even if we did not stay at this hotel, we would have done the same anyway. At night I could not hear any street noise. The only thing you could hear was the AC unit turning on/off by the thermostat but it was not bad. They never give you enough sugar for the in-room coffee or may be most people do not need more than 2 packets per cup? But we found that the staff responded promptly to our request. When asked for more sugar or more towels at the pool, the staff would come by in 5 mins. Given the location and comfort of this hotel, I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Absolutely perfect hotel
review.reviewText: I can't rave enough about this hotel. It was not only the perfect location but had a great restaurant, very clean and nice to come back to everynight. I had my wallet stolen by a pick pocket halfway through our trip and it was one of the worst experiences I ever went through. The staff not only helped me with calling all my card companies, they helped me file my police report with a very helpful and kind demeanor. They followed by calling me to see if I was alright, gave us a free breakfast and sent wine and cheese to our room. They did everything to try to make the rest of our trip enjoyable. I will never forget their kindness. Truly beyond the scope I would have ever imagined.

review.title: Over Rated
review.reviewText: The hotel was average. We were disapointed that the room did not have a small refridgerator. The bathroom shower looked nice but when one showered the water would go all over the bathroom floor and not enough towels to dry with and mop up the floor too.

review.title: Great hotel for family travel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf is an excellent choice for tourists to San Francisco, especially families and those who like to walk, as it is close to many of the city's tourist attractions. The hotel is stylish and well maintained, plus the beds are great!

review.title: My 9 day stay
review.reviewText: This great hotel made our long vacation in San Francisco even more enjoyable. It is modern, yet very comfortable & the 24-hr gym is fantastic! The staff was extremely friendly & helpful & the convenient location is hard to beat. My only complaints are the extremely high price of parking (&40 + $5tax per night!!), the seemingly unnecessary $1 charge for EVERY local phone call, & the high price/low quality of the food from Knuckles. We work in the restaurant business & we don't mind paying a lot for a good meal, but the food was not very good & way too expensive. Other than that, this hotel rocks. It was our 5th trip to S.F., & it was our best hotel experience by far!! :)

review.title: Great Stay
