review.reviewText: Very accommodating with our room change requests, although turned out that the area is very very quiet at night so road facing room is not a big issue. Did not use pool as it [weather] was too cold; would not really make this a #1 priority for San Fran. Lots to do at your doorstep, and all the tram stations minutes away. Rooms are modern and functional. No inter-room noise that we were aware of. AC is noisy (but they all are in US ... at least you get them unlike UK !) No tea bags and kettles in room for UK morning tea fans, so bring a travel kettle or buy one when you get here. No room fridge. This seems to be standard in US now as well. Great place to stay.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay. The hotel had an absolutely perfect location. Service was great, staff very friendly, and the room was very clean and comfortable. Only suggestion, coffee should be available all day long as a guest service,free of charge, not for just a brief period in the a.m. Will definitely go back in the future!

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: Great staff, clean rooms, couldn't ask for a better location!!!!! Great job, Hyatt!

review.title: Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: OK place, very pricey for room service. Great location for tours, cable cars, stc. Room we had was very small.

review.title: Comfortable, good location.
review.reviewText: This hotel is well located, close enough to walk to fisherman's wharf, 2 cable car lines, pier 39 and boat transportation around the bay including Alcatraz. The room was nothing special, roomy enough and the beds were somewhat firm. Room service, house staff very good and friendly.. Good deal for the price.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Location was excellent, they beds were very comfortable. Furniture needed better dusting, and they kept forgetting to leave an extra set of towels for the my daughter. Overall very good.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: We could walk to everything we had on our list to see ... the cable cars, fisherman's wharf, pier 39 and the sea lions. We even walked to Coit tower and Lombard Street.

review.title: Excellent hotel and excellent location!
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 3 nights and it was such a brilliant hotel!! It was clean and the rooms were lovely. Staff were very helpful and gave great advice on where to go!! Good hint is to book Alcatraz before you get to San Francisco!!!

review.title: We had a great stay!
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel due to its great location and it has a swimming pool. We were not disappointed. The room was terrific - staff very helpful and friendly. Only one minor gripe - the wireless internet could have been free. We stayed in cheaper hotels and motels that all had free internet access. If you want to be in the Fisherman's Wharf area, stay here!

review.title: Well Centered Hotel
review.reviewText: From a native San Franciscan: Well centered in terms of location and quality of staff. Rooms offer clean quiet comfort for a good night's sleep.

review.title: Great Experience, would stay here again
review.reviewText: This hotel was wonderful. The staff was exceptionally polite and curtious, our room was very modern and clean. I do agree with the other travelers (and I think this is going to be with all the hotels near Fisherman's Wharf) is that you can hear the traffic outside your room at all hours. This hotel is in walking distance to almost everything. There are two trolley car turn arounds that are very close and so is the street car pickup. There is a Denny's one block away, there is a Walgreen's two blocks away. We would definately stay here again.

review.title: Good Location--Modern Furnishings
review.reviewText: Good location. The Wharf is a tourist trap-no doubt. The Hyatt is two blocks from this fray. Nonetheless, many tourist activities depart from the Wharf (Alcatraz Tour, Bat City Bikes, Trolley Tour) so it is nice to be close to the Wharf. In short, this hotel is far enough away, but close enough too. It is also a short walk from all the Italian resutaunts and pastry shops on Columbus Street and a block from the F Line. We also liked the modern furnishings: walk in, rain shower; beautiful tile; flat screen TV; and modern decor with an Asian flair.

review.title: Very nice hotel with very good service
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I spent 5 nice there in July 2008. The hotel is located within walking distance (2 blocks) of Fisherman's Wharf, lots of good restaurants and activities nearby. The hotel staff were very helpful, curteous, and friendly. We would definetely stay there again. One minus is valet parking $39.95/day for hotel guests.

review.title: Fabulous Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Everything was top-notch! Friendly, professional and accommodating staff. Room service was terrific - the food very good. The location is so close to the Wharf and cable cars; this made getting around a breeze and is what sold me. I would definitely stay at this Hyatt again!

review.title: Good experience and comfort
review.reviewText: On-line access limited to Nextel accounts. Don't count on using your computer with easy access point. For what you pay you should be able to access the internet with a simple access code for each customer. If Starbucks makes it easy the Hyatt can make it easy. Otherwise, our stay was very comfortable.

review.title: Clean, Comfortable, Convenient
review.reviewText: comfortable, clean, easy access to cable cars and buses to all areas of SF

review.title: Great family hotel
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel for families. Great location, extremely friendly and helpful staff.

review.title: Fun City
review.reviewText: Hotel was swanky in decor, but smelled cigarette smoke often in our room through the vents. Unsure if folks smoked in the stairwell or it came through an open window to the front enterance on the 2nd floor where our room was located.

review.title: Great Fisherman's Wharf Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel location. Staff was extremely pleasant. Close proximity to the Wharf and tour bus locations.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We extremely enjoyed our 5 nights at the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco. The staff was very nice and accommodating. I have allergies and after finding we had feather pillows(they were great) I asked for other pillows and poof, they were there. We didn't ask about or for anything that we didnt receive. As an extra, when we took our tours, we were usually the last ones dropped off so we got a free tour of the city every night.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Easy walk to all the Wharf attractions and lots of restaurant options.

review.title: A wonderful hotel at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Even though we did not have a "room with a view", We had a comfortable space to rest after our long visits all around San Francisco Area. The location is magnificent! We were close to a lot of San Francisco's attractions, as well as many caf√©s and restaurants. The personnel is extremely kind, usually greeting us as well as helping us in all our needs. The room was spacious enough to be "at home", with enough commodities for our pleasure. We only missed not having a fridge in our room. The bed was really comfortable, as well as the pillows and the comforter. The bathroom is ample, with a good shower and small toileteries from a spa. I really enjoyed our stay in San Francisco and I would like to stay there in a future visit.

review.title: Great Place To Stay In San Francisco
review.reviewText: My husband daughter and I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Hyatt and was VERY pleased with everything. The restaurant at the hotel is very OVERPRICED but the Hollywood across the street is very good for breakfast. They ae only open for breakfast and lunch and we wished they were open at night when we returned from our day trips. The hotel staff were very nice and helpful. IF we go to San Fran again, the Hyatt would be our place to stay.

review.title: A Great Hotel in a Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel was clean, had great service, and was close to everything! If we needed a car, the staff was quick to hail us a taxi so we could be on our way!

review.title: Understated quality
review.reviewText: Pleasant atmosphere and good service. Ideally situated for trams and Pier 39 but set back enough to avoid the noise. Suited us nicely.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice - recently updated.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: the hyatt fishermans wharf is a great hotel. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful.The room always looked great. The location was excellent, it was right beside the trolley car turn around.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel, great location! The staff was very friendly, they knew who we were, even individually. Just an overall great experience.

review.title: GOOD EXPERIENCE
review.reviewText: NICE HOTEL & PEOPLE F&B DEPARTMENT AWSOME!!! THE LADY IN CHARGE OF THE RESTAURANTS AT BREAKFAST IS REALLY GOOD AND POLITE. GIVE HER A RISE!!!. CONCIERGE CLERK NEEDS TO IMPORVE MANNERS WITH MEXICAN CUSTOMERS, WE HAVE MONEY TOO AND NOT EVERYTHING YOU SEE ON TV IS TRUE. ROOM SERVICE IS VERY EXPENSIVE, BUT THANK YOU FOR YOU HOSPITALITY, WE WILL BE BACK!!!!!!

review.title: No Complaints - does exactly what it says on the tin
review.reviewText: Stayed for a week in may 08, found staff very helful and friendly in all aspects and services provided. Hotel close to everything and is ideally located. The pool and hot tub were a bonus which the Kids enjoyed every afternoon Only slight complaint was that the breakfast service in the morning was a little relaxed !

review.title: Great time!
review.reviewText: The location was great, we only had to walk two blocks to get to the Wharf, everything was within walking distance. The staff was great, everyone made the extra effort to say "hello" or "good morning". The desk staff would even say hello to us by name. We had an excellent time and the hotel was great! Cant wait to go back.

review.title: Walking Distance to Everything
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfect. Thanks to reading previous reviews we went to the restaurant across the street every morning for breakfast and it was great! The concierge was fantastic giving us tons of ideas and booking us for everything we needed. The hotel was clean and comfy and every time you came back to the hotel the staff greeted you with "welcome back" it was so nice. I liked that we could walk pretty much everywhere! It is in a great location!

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is an easy walk to Fisherman's Wharf and the Embarcadero. It is also close to the cable cars. The restaurant is limited to a sports bar but it serves all meals. Parking at the hotel and everywhere is expensive!

review.title: Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf is Excellent
review.reviewText: The rooms are modern, clean, and nicely appointed. The staff is excellent - very helpful and friendly. Breakfast at Knuckles (the attached dining establishment) seemed abnormally pricey for what you get, even for San Francisco -- but that's easily remedied by eating outside the hotel. Overall, I'd recommend the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf as a great place to stay.

review.title: Vacation Stay at the Hyatt
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful and very clean but the overwhelming thing that would make me stay there again was the efficient, professional, and very friendly service I got from everyone I encountered. Service level is a huge deal to me and the staff at the Hyatt has definitely got it together!! Great job! Great experience!

review.title: I'd definitely make this hotel a repeat experience!
review.reviewText: From early checkin to arrangements for departure the staff made every effort to accommodate us. I met my daughter and family in San Francisco and we were given rooms across the hall from each other. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet every morning. Easy access to the Wharf for dining and attractions were our primary goals, but we also frequented nearby Starbuck's, Barnes and Noble, and trolley car to Union Square. We agreed we would certainly make the Hyatt our place to stay in the future.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: We stayed two nights and it was wonderful. slept good and were treated like royalty. it was a good experience. Only one problem-we reserved a car to take us back to the airport and when it didn't come we checked with the desk and someone had put down the wrong date. However the hotel got a car and we made it on time.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Very friendly staff. Nice, clean and well decorated. Only problem... the hot tub closes at 9:00 PM

review.title: Great stay for San Fran
review.reviewText: great stay, very centrally located to all attractions, very helpful

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Hotel more than met our expectations. Perfectly placed for many attractions with easily accessed transport availability. Staff in hotel were very helpful and friendly and contacted us twice to make sure we were enjoying our stay.Housekeeping was very good and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Hotel facilities were well maintained and resourced. Would definitely recommend this hotel and return again.

review.title: Great place to stay...
review.reviewText: This was our second stay and we were once again very pleased. Staff is friendly, bedding is very comfortable, and a great location. Close to everything. Tour agency across the street. Would recommend some local restaurants for breakfast / lunch as much cheaper. Great restaurant one block away, "Pescatores"

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The location was perfect. The hotel employees were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfect in everyway. The location was great, the staff couldn't be more helpful, the rooms where spacious and clean and the bed's were unbelieviably comfortable. I would also recommend the attached sport's bar which serves really good and reasonably priced food.

review.title: The Best service I've ever experianced in America
review.reviewText: I stayed in this hotel for a period of two weeks with my fiance and recieved an amazing service troughout our stay. The staff were both very friendly and helpful. The facilities within the hotel have been updated since our last stay there and if you want to keep fit the hotel gym is well presented and maintained with a wide variety of good quality equipment. The rooms were spacious and very modern in appearance. The knuckles bar was both served nice food in a relaxed enviroment and was reasonably priced.

review.title: Will Stay Here Again.
review.reviewText: Very modern hotel with excellent staff and located right in the Fisherman's Wharf area. 5 minute walk to all area attractions and restaurants. Couldn't be better located. Good restaurant and bar in hotel (Knuckles) but as everthing in San Francisco it's not cheap but it is good.

review.title: will stay at the Hyatt on our next trip
review.reviewText: Service was excellent. The staff was very helpful

review.title: No Parking
review.reviewText: Had we known that there was a Hertz car rental just a block from the hotel, we would have waited to rent our car until after our stay. After getting a deal through expedia for our stay, discovered that it was $39 per night to park at the hotel + taxes. Hotel was great though. We stayed 2 days and were within walking distance from everything at Fisherman's Warf. Sorry, don't plan to go to SF again. Too crowded for our taste. Would definitely go to a Hyatt again!

review.title: Enjoyable Time
review.reviewText: Hotel was good and close to all the activity of the area however the toilet height was for kids (maybe some rooms are for seniors) and the shower was definetly different and no towel racks. A small refigerator would be handy.

review.title: Way above expectations
review.reviewText: Fisherman's wharf usually means a certain degree of waear and tear on hotels in the area, but I was pleasantly pleased with the decor, cleanliness, and qualioty of service at the Hyatt. I would certainly stay there again and again.

review.title: Great Location--Lots to do nearby
review.reviewText: Great Location near Fisherman's Wharf and Ghirardelli Square. Near Public Transportation and lots to do. Outdoor Heated Pool and Jicuzzi were a plus as well.

review.title: Comfortable and Stylish
review.reviewText: We loved our stay, the hotel is very stylish and comfy. We traveled with our 3 month old baby and had no problems with the room or larger hotel.

review.title: Excellant Service
review.reviewText: The employees went above and beyond to make certain everything was okay and extended numerous perks to us. I will definately stay there when my wife and I go back to San Francisco. We were greeted and thanked for staying there numerous times during our stay. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone. It is in a great location. It is less than a block from a cable car and a block streetcars. It is only two blocks from Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: Great hotel in convenient location
review.reviewText: The Fisherman's Wharf Hyatt is conveniently located just a couple blocks from the Wharf. Public transportation stops nearby as well as bike rentals, numerous restaurants (including a sports bar/restaurant in the hotel)and even a Safeway. Nice (contemporary) rooms have coffee makers and comfortable beds. Helpful staff.

review.title: Perfect!
review.reviewText: I can't say enough good about our stay. The staff were very helpful, friendly, and responsive when we needed anything. The location is great also! Definitely would stay at the Hyatt again if ever in San Fransisco.

review.title: Great spot on the Wharf!
review.reviewText: This hotel was great, nice and clean, really great staff, they were all so friendly and helpful. The pool was small, but nice. The one thing we didn't really like was the lack of a mini fridge in our room. Other than that, it was great!

review.title: Great hotel and location
review.reviewText: Great place to get away for a weekend. Use the cable cars righ behind the hotel, no line ups. Bring your winter gear. San Fran is the coldest place we have ever been and we're from Canada.

review.title: hotel in good area for sightseeing
review.reviewText: the hyatt in my opinion was well situated for first time visitors as we were near a lot of the attractions that we wanted to see and an easy walk to the cable car etc.we didnt eat in the hotel as there were plenty of places local to try.we were only in san franisco 3 days but would love to go back and would go to hyatt again.

review.title: Great service, very impressed
review.reviewText: This hotel is very clean, well maintained and the staff are exceptionally friendly and professional. Highly recommended

review.title: Great Service
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. A little noisy since we had a room overlooking Bay St. but overall a great place to stay. Hotel management assisted immedately in resolving leak in bathroom that caused water overflow. They called to check in on us to make sure all was well after leak repaired. Great location and all staff very friendly.

review.title: Cant be faulted
review.reviewText: Stayed 5 days in an extra large room with king bed.No probs.Well positioned for a short walk to Fishermans wharf.Friendly neighbourhood.Use the Hotels own sports bar where the food is very reasonably priced,service good and whilst tips are expected from you...it is up to you how much you leave unlike other pushy restaurants in the area who expect 20% whatever the service.

review.title: Really convenient location and comfortable bed!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was extremely attentive to every request. They were more than happy to make suggestions and give directions whenever asked. The bed was soooo comfortable compared to others I've experienced. Overall, great experience with this hotel.

review.title: Great place to stay!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel was very nice. The service was great and the location couldn't be better.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in the perfect location, walking distance to a lot of the sights. My only quarrel is that the concierge was a bit rude when I asked for help with shuttle transportation back to the airport. I couldn't finish a sentence without her interrupting me. Maybe I just caught her on an off day? Take note that there isn't a complimentary breakfast.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: A comfortable, relaxing retreat after a busy day of sightseeing.

review.title: An ideal location
review.reviewText: The Hyatt made an ideal base for our trip to San Francisco (my husband's first). It's convenient location two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and all the cable cars, tour services etc; two blocks from a Walgreen's with photo service and snacks; two blocks from the end of one of the cable car lines; and across the street from a great little breakfast cafe made it very easy to go without the hassle and expense of a rental car. We appreciated the friendly and prompt maid service as well.

review.title: Was a nice place to stay
review.reviewText: The location was killer, the room was very clean and a paper every morning. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The only issue we had was that the beds had flat sheets as bottom sheets and very soft pillows. My husband was not happy sleeping on the bare mattress. All in all I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Very nice and comfortable stay
review.reviewText: Its a very nice hotel with very good attention of the employes. The rooms are very comfortable and clean

review.title: Friendliest Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We arrived late in the evening and unfortunately our room was a smoking room. Too tired to change the room, we waited until the morning to request a non-smoking room. The front desk was terrific in their response. They immediately gave us a different room, which was non-smoking and quieter. That evening they also surprised us with a complimentary bottle of wine and hors d'oeuvres and a lovely card apologizing for the mix up. Throughout our week long stay the front desk went out of their way to help us with booking sight-seeing tours and ensuring that our stay was enjoyable. They even helped us with a medical emergency and were extremely helpful when we had to go to go to a hospital. Room service was fantastic although a little pricey as was the bar. Food was your typical bar variety and breakfasts offered just cereal and toast instead of the eggs, bacon etc... Location of the hotel was great - right down in Fisherman's Wharf and very central. Supermarket, drugstore and restaurants all within walking distance.

review.title: Close to Fishermans Warf & Trolley's
review.reviewText: A comfortable hotel room. The Activity Personel helped with all our requests.

review.title: Fantastic service and location
review.reviewText: The hotel is wonderfully located about 3 blocks from the bay. The staff was extremely helpful. We had staff members introduced to us which we would have had no contact and given business cards in case we had a problem. I would highly recommend the Hyatt and cannot wait to go back.

review.title: Great location, comfy beds.
review.reviewText: Good location, comfortable beds, rooms clean. Standard size rooms with two very confortable double beds, loads of pillows. The bonus was the iPod docking station. The toiletries were really nice - ask housekeeping for the shower gel. The bar does reasonably priced meals but could be a little noisy. The bar staff were very friendly, the pool table and shuttle board kept the kids amused while we had a nice cold drink. The pool was pretty cold but the hot tub nice. Buy your water etc at the local Safeway or 7Eleven - and ask to have a fridge put in your room.
review.userLocation: A Kiwi based at Fort McMurray, AB .

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: The room was great, the staff were all extremely helpful. The bed was very comfortable. The only thing that I wish would have liked more is if the hotel had offered complimentary wireless internet service.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: We were very happy with the staff and our room. The staff was very eager to accommodate our needs (rollaway bed) and type of room that we wanted. The beds were very comfortable. Loved the outdoor hot tub & heated pool (even in March). Also, used the fitness center every day and enjoyed that.

review.title: We will definitally stay here again!
review.reviewText: What a great hotel! We were impressed from the minute we walked in. Very unique lobby with people always there to say hello and ask if you need help. The concierge was very helpful and had great tips on what to do in town. They have a complimentary luggage hold which was nice when we checked in early, and when we checked out but still had time to shop. The bed was so comfortable as well as the room itself. Very cozy and warm. It could use better lighting in the bathroom especially. We loved the "To-Go" cups coffee maker, very nice for early morning brisk walks. The restraunt was quite pricey so we avoided eating there. My husband used the fitness room and was impressed with the equipment they had. We will definitally recommend and stay at this hotel again!

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: The hotel was wonderful and the staff were very helpful!

review.title: wonderful stay, small details
review.reviewText: I contacted Expedia/the hotel about trying to ensure a rollaway for our room, which I couldn't do on the website, but was able to request an ADA room. This room was "semi" guarenteed over the phone, but I had a slight issue on arrival: they may not have it available and with whom did I speak? Their ability to work out details efficiently was quite commendable and we stayed comfortably. The only complaints: The pool was a little cold---my heated is not their heated (which is somewhat subjective), the restaurant was a little pricey (I know, welcome to vacation!) and we found out our room phones weren't hooked up at midnight when we tried to call for a 3am wakeup call to catch our AM flight(luckily, the alarm clocks worked!) but all in all, a great experience with Hyatt. The staff was courteous, the room clean, comfortable...everything we've come to expect from Hyatt!

review.title: Convenient Location, Contemporary Style
review.reviewText: We loved the contemporary feel of the rooms. The pillows and beds were the best I've experienced. The bathroom was in very good shape, clean and modern. We enjoyed the spaciousness of the rooms. The down side to the hotel was having to pay an exhorbitant amount per night to park my car there. I thought that was extreme and totally taking advantage of people staying there. The price should be included in the cost of staying......it is costly enough.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: Overall this hotel was great; the service, location, service. Everyone was helpful and friendly. It's in a great location; close to the Pier 39 and things to do.

review.title: would recommend to everyone
review.reviewText: a very nice place to stay

review.title: Sittin' on the dock of the bay!
review.reviewText: This hotel helped to give me a wonderful San Francisco experience. The room and amenities were what I would expect for the price. What made it so great was the staff and the location. We were there for four nights so we requested a minifridge, which we got without hassle or delay. The location was superb. Two blocks from the seafood market and sourdough central. One block from the Powel-Mason Trolley turn-around. Everything we wanted was either a short walk away or there was a method of public transportation right there. The staff and concierge were so knowledgeable and helpful with any and all requests. He even was able to figure out how to tell me to get to a sushi restraunt that I vaguely remembered and was all the way across town.

review.title: Wonderful experience...
review.reviewText: The hotel was very accomodating and helpful. Knuckles a fun little bar within the hotel.

review.title: First trip to San Francsico
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel because it was recommended by Expedia members.They were right.It is clean, modern, excellent rates and the best location.We walked everywhere.

review.title: Good hotel for siteseeing locations
review.reviewText: No complaints. Great location for seeing the Wharf attractions. Cable car located at back of building. Restaurant is just OK. Hollywood Cafe across the street, however, is excellent! Great food at great prices. Breakfast is exceptional!

review.title: Can't wait to go back,
review.reviewText: Extremely satisfied with this Hotel.

review.title: Best SF Hotel I Have Stayed In
review.reviewText: From check-in to check-out my stay could not have been better. We used all the services from front desk, valet parking, room service, etc and everything was 5 Star. The staff are professional and friendly and everything requested was on-time and as requested.

review.title: THE STAFF THERE WERE THE BEST WE HAVE ENCOUNTERED IN THE U.S. WE WOULD RETURN THERE WITH OUT A DOUBT
review.reviewText: GREAT LOCATION. GREAT STAFF. COMFORTABLE ROOM. BEST PLACE WE HAVE BEEN IN THE U.S.

review.title: Right were everything happens
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay. Everything was a few blocks away, and if I needed to travel a longer distance, the cable car is just around the corner, so you can get everywhere and enjoy the ride at the same time. I definitely recommend it.

review.title: Very nice and clean hotel; the service was superb
review.reviewText: Very good experience.

review.title: Wish i was still there
review.reviewText: First class service and faciltites. Nothing was to much trounble and the satff could not have been friendlier

review.title: Loved It!
review.reviewText: I have absolutely no complaints this hotel it was exellent for my short trip. I would definatly recommend to others.

review.title: Great location, great service
review.reviewText: We actually had a long stay and the hotel made it great. Perfect location between Fishermans Wharf and the cable car - easy access to everything (restaurants, shops, transport, entertainment) yet nights were lovely and quiet. Room was comfortable and all we needed. Staff were great - friendly and helpful.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We had adjoining rooms which was a perfect set-up for our family. The location was very convenient. Easy access to Fisherman's Wharf, Alcatraz, bus tours and Cable Cars. It was easy to walk to almost everything we wanted to see and do.

review.title: Friendly staff and beautiful room!
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf; the hotel is located in an excellent location to major tourist spots. We had a blast and a wonderful spring break!

review.title: excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf for 3 nights. The hotel room was fantastic, with a nice view. It was clean, modern furniture and my attraction was the LCD tv. There were lot of closet space and also a safe which was real convenient. Bed was really nice comfortable, with extra throw... The staff was polite, curteous, and very helpful. We didnt expect California weather to be wet, so the hotel lent us two sets of umbrellas throughout our trip. The bell staff was really helpful and arranged for a hotel car to drop us back to the airport. Overall very satisfied and would definitely come back to this hotel.

review.title: Lovely room
review.reviewText: Spacious, comfortable and lovely room. Lobby was very small and differenht from other hotels, but okay.

review.title: Was a nice hotel close to the wharf.
review.reviewText: Very quiet hotel that was in a very busy city. The only problem was that they do not have enough elevators for the number of rooms and floors that they have.

review.title: I left my heart in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and experienced. The location was amazing and I look forward to visiting again!

review.title: excellent hotel
review.reviewText: very pleased with the hotel. ideally situated

review.title: service overload
review.reviewText: This hotel is a top 5 pick. Above and beyond on service.

review.title: Great location - car rental or public transportation within a block!
review.reviewText: This hotel is close enough to the cable car, car rental agencies, and nearby food/entertainment to make it easy to get around. Really big rooms & bathrooms. Well appointed. Quiet. Would definitely stay here again - luxury at a great price.

review.title: Great staff
review.reviewText: Helped with every need and did it with a smile.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel was fantastic! The food was a bit high priced, but all in all a fantastic stay!!

review.title: Loved this Hotel
review.reviewText: I did like this hotel a lot, you could tell that it had been renovated recently and everything looked very clean. The Hotel was near Fisherman's Wharf, and in my opinion was is the perfect spot. The only complaint i have is that the parking is WAY TO EXPENSIVE!!! But great Hotel overall.

review.title: Prime location.
review.reviewText: The Hyatt was a great choice for us. It was very clean and had great service. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who asked for a recommendation. It was in walking distance to almost everything we wanted to do. We were able to walk to all of fisherman wharf and see all of the great views only 2 blocks from the hotel. This was our first time to San Fransisco and the hotel staff was able to direct us to wherever we wanted to go. They even guided us on how to us the public transportation to get into downtown and to the zoo. They were alot of help and took the time to walk us through where we were headed on the great city maps they gave to us. A++ for their great staff.

review.title: Ideal
review.reviewText: Location was perfect and was the most important factor in selecting this hotel. We were within two or three blocks of the Wharf, the Cable Cars and all our tour bus starting points. Staff was friendly and knowledgable and even had postage stamps for sale when we wanted to mail postcards back home. The related Sports Bar was convenient for breakfast and late night drink or snack.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel is ideally situated, modern and clean. However my king room overlooking the pool was noisy in daytime, due to swimmers, and at night due to the proximity of the external air-con unit. The bathroom was compact, though the shower stall was spacious. Unfortunately the fixed glass screen was inadequate and water spilled onto the floor. The shower head was located high in the ceiling - not female friendly. There was no bar refrigerator.

review.title: What's Important?
review.reviewText: Never been to San Francisco, so booked this name brand hotel because of location and the fact that they had a "heated" outdoor pool for my 7yo. Got there and found several hotels within two short blocks of this one. The pool was freezing so down time in the pool was not an option. Also, no continental breakfast offered (not good when you want real milk for your morning coffee) and no free wireless internet - something I must admit I did not take into account before going and will never overlook again. Couldn't help but acknowledge all the other name brand hotels that did offer these amenities! Staff was nice, decor was nice - but this didn't make up for the extras I had to pay for.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel and excellent location. It is very close to Pier 39, close to many restaurants, shops and cable car. Service is also excellent. I really enjoyed my stay at Hyatt.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Centrally located to lots of fun activities

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Close to attractions and transportation options. It was a very quiet hotel, clean. We loved the courtyard pool and spa. Kid friendly but very nice. The bar is great! Our only real complaint was that room service was slow. They indicated a 1/2 hour when we ordered and it was an hour before the food was delivered. The staff was friendly.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We were very happy with our stay at this hotel. It has been very nicely re-done and the rooms are well appointed and roomy. The location was great.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: We were about two blocks from Pier 41, and a five minute walk from Pier 39. We also walked downtown and to Chinatown.

review.title: Hyatt at Fishermas Wharf
review.reviewText: We were not impressed with the shower, it would have been nice to have a bath and It would of been nice to have a room that had table and a couple of chairs in it. We found the parking rates for the parking garage to be outrageous.

review.title: Not the best Hyatt
review.reviewText: Hotel was OK. Restaurant was a "sports bar," loud with mediocre and over-priced food.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel is in easy walking distance from Fisherman's Wharf. Was clean and quiet. Would stay there again.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great location and great concierge. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: Very friendly and helpful staff. Clean and quiet. Most comfortable hotel mattresses we've ever slept in! Close to all fisherman's wharf sightseeing.

review.title: Oversized King is the way to go
review.reviewText: We visited SF in Jan 08 for a short 3 day stay at the Hyatt FW. The location was perfect, close enough to all the city has to offer. I would recommend the Oversized King room. Ours was very clean, roomy & oh so comfy. The staff was so helpful & knowledgeable. Will will be going back this summer.

review.title: Worthy of a European Hotel
review.reviewText: I cannot think of ever having such great service in an American hotel before. Every person at the Hyatt in Fisherman's Wharf was helpful, from the moment we walked up to check in to when we left and the taxi that the front desk called for was there and the bellman opened our doors and loaded our suitcases. The sportsbar people were fabulous, the concierge extremely helpful, the maid was friendly. It felt as if everyone was there for us. We're not movie stars. Also, the look of the place is modern and elegant like a hotel I had in London. I'd love to go back to the place.

review.title: it was average - nothing spectacular
review.reviewText: Hotel restaraunt was extremely slow and waiter was very unattentive Room thermostat did not work properly. Room stayed too warm - couldn't rest well.

review.title: It was so perfect for San Francisco
review.reviewText: it was so great & perfect for my trip. location of this hotel is easy to go any attractions like fisherman's wharf, cable car, golden gate and etc. room service is also perfect and all staffs in hotel was so nice and kind. I will stay at this hotel for my future trip.

review.title: Simple, but great
review.reviewText: The Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf was great because it was close to shopping, eating, and sight seeing. I don't recommend eating the breakfast buffet only because it was expensive. I recommend going to the breakfast restaurants across the street on Point. The room's bathroom did not have locks on the door, but that might be okay for some. Overall the room was simple, but it was just what we wanted.

review.title: Great weekend trip
review.reviewText: Great area. We handed the car to the valet and didn't get back into it until we were on our way home. Even though it was a bit rainy, we walked every where. We actually found a bar by chance that had 33 differend beers on tap right up the street on columbus. 2 for 1 pints from 11-11:30! So much fun.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location - close to wharf and cable car. Area was clean and safe.

review.title: Close enough but far enough away
review.reviewText: Hotel location provides easy access to transportation - don't need a car because it will be parked most of the time anyway. Roomy enough for 4, but you really only sleep and change there. Staff is helpful and courteous. Walk to the Wharf, cable cars, or other MUNI transportation and get around easily and without the headache of finding a parking space.

review.title: Close to ALL
review.reviewText: This hotel is within walking distance to the wharf, little Italy, Chinatown, Ferry Building and more! You can easily "visit" the City without a car! If you want to visit other parts of the coast, I suggest you only rent a car for a day and return by it by closing time as to not incur the HIGH parking rates in the City. There are not many and they are higher than renting the car!

review.title: Really Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Very good hotel.

review.title: PARKING
review.reviewText: If you plan on parking here its $40.00 a day, other than that it was a good experience.

review.title: small smelly hotel
review.reviewText: The room has strong odor from the moment you get in, carpet feels moisturized. Far below my expectation from Hyatt. Room is a bit small too. Hotel attendent has no bad service however I do not live at their smiles but in the room.

review.title: A weekend getaway
review.reviewText: The Hyatt was a splendid overnight on Fisheerman's wharf, just hte right amount of new and old. Easy to access the sights of the area, excellent amenities

review.title: Great Hotel and Service
review.reviewText: We just spent a week in San Francisco, and could not have picked a better hotel. The location and service was top notch. I recommend this hotel 100% and will definetly stay there again. The personnel was the best by far.

review.title: Great stay on the Bay
review.reviewText: The hotel has a great location,wonderful spacious room,lovely lobby,sports bar to die for!!!.Within walking distance of geat restaurants,sights and shopping. Room service was excellent,front desk staff friendly and helpful.We were very pleased with all the services provided by the hotel staff. Highly recommend. We will definitely go back.

review.title: Nice visit
review.reviewText: good value

review.title: good location and comfy!
review.reviewText: THe front desk clerk was extremely helpful! Very pleasant. Very good location, so close to trolley stop. New modern decor, great place!

review.title: Great Location/Easy Access to all of S.F.
review.reviewText: Hotel was in great location. Easy to get to two of the Cable Car lines which made it extremely easy to get from Wharf to Union Square which has most wonderful shops. We got extra large room and it was very inviting. Definitely would recommend this hotel. Decor was on the modern side and bathroom was extremely clean.

review.title: cant wait to go back
review.reviewText: doudle beds are a little too small. other than that room is great.

review.title: My new S.F. favorite. Ultra modern
review.reviewText: Very helpful staff. Great location. Ultra modern design. Every amenity. I would definately stay there again.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: The room decor was very contemporary and tastefully appointed. I slept like a rock. Staff was helpful and friendly. Location was central to Fisherman's Wharf activities.

review.title: So comfortable....
review.reviewText: The beds are so comfortable at this hotel. The only downside was that we had a room with a pool view and it was a bit noisy early in the morning and into the night hours. Other than that our stay was great.

review.title: Enjoyable Stay But......
review.reviewText: Impressed by the hotel, Reception staff,Cleaning Staff, Waiters in Knuckles & room was very nice, though Bed a little small. Unimpressed by Room Service trays left overnight and collected late morning next day.

review.title: Nice place to visit
review.reviewText: The Hyatt was a pretty nice place. They have a sports bar called Knuckles that had a bunch of t.v.'s with football games and a full bar so spent some time there. They have a gym ,pool and jacuzzi to hang out in but it was kinda cold and foggy so didnt stay there long. We had a rental car and to park it there it was $39 so that was kinda expensive.Anyway the staff was friendly and we had a good time.

review.title: great hotel.....great location
review.reviewText: friendly staff..a great hotel...and a great location, make the Hyatt at fisherman's wharf a destination point when travelling to San Fran

review.title: Beautiful rooms, small closets
review.reviewText: Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf is a beautiful, convenient, very well decorated hotel, with an intimate lobby, yet it's elevators could be updated and a little maintenance could be done to some furniture in guest rooms (wood panels where a little bit scratched) and storage space in rooms expanded (no place at all to place empty luggage). The beds are amazingly comfortable, the iPod station is a real luxury, as well as the flat TV, and I must recognize I took with me all the Portico bath amenities (they smell great)

review.title: Nice hotel but no extras or special attention
review.reviewText: Hyatt was nice overall, centrally located, clean. It did not have much atmosphere either in the main hotel or the room. It's not that the service was bad but it was pretty much inattentive once you checked in. Restaurant was good, menu could be larger. Two concierges were not very knowledgable and didn't listen to our input for dinner recommendation so we ended up somewhere which had all "game meat" on the menu when we asked for a steakhouse or American cuisine. We had to leave the restaurant and go elsewhere. Rooms were very clean although sparse and barren feeling. Valet parking service was excellent.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: One employee at the Hyatt definitely stands out - Jorge. He was very friendly and informative and made our stay even more enjoyable.

review.title: Would stay there again
review.reviewText: The hotel was close to very thing we wanted to see. It was two blocks from the wharf and close to pier 39. We didnt rent a car we walk everywhere.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: the staff was very professional and helpful.

review.title: Very professional and friendly staff. Pleasure to be there
review.reviewText: "Everything" was great. Professional staff was friendly and helpful. Short walk to cable car turnaround.....Just a really nice hotel

review.title: Not worth the money
review.reviewText: This hotel is most definitely overpriced! This place is not actually that close to Fisherman's Wharf, either. There is only one place to eat and it was loud with horrible wait service. Parking our car cost a large fortune. The person who was registering us spoke broken English at best, and was very difficult to understand. Room was very small, no bathtub in bathroom. Not everyone wants to take a shower!

review.title: Comfort on the Wharf
review.reviewText: As a mid-sized tourist/business hotel at Fisherman's Wharf, The Hyatt was very good. The room was modern, clean, quiet and comfortable. Service was pleasant, helpful and courteous. The location is close to the major wharf attractions and to transportation for tourists. The hotel offers no dining other than a busy sports bar and room service. Given the location, however, there are many, many nearby dining options. This was a very enjoyable week and we would return to this Hyatt in the future.

review.title: Great location for tourists
review.reviewText: Great location - close to restaurants, taxis, cable car, bike rentals and Fisherman's Wharf. Super in-room tourist guide

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and the personnel were very friendly. Many attractions were in walking distance of the hotel. Would stay at this hotel again if visiting the area in the future.

review.title: I plan to stay in this hotel again
review.reviewText: The hotel was near all the major attractions/sights of SF. Plan to stay there again.

review.title: Great vacation
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, staff was extremely helpful and friendly. We called and asked for extra towels and within minutes we had them! They gladly gave us directions and tips each day and the hotel was conveniently located near everything. Alcatraz was amazing - we took the night tour and the Exploratorium is not to be missed.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This was a wonderful hotel, the people were very kind and helpful and the beds were very comfortable; the first time I can say I slept well on vacation away from home!

review.title: Ideal location for sightseeing
review.reviewText: We love our own bed but found the Hyatt's bed extremely comfortable, albeit quite high. One critism about the amenities in the room - there was no kettle but a small (one cup)coffee/tea maker with disposable cups. Not ideal and not environmentally friendly.

review.title: Great location and facilities
review.reviewText: Great for families

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: (visited the last week of August, 2007) Nice hotel, not spectacular, but very nice. We had a room with 2 doubles. Typical hotel room, but with VERY comfy bedding! A little tight, with limited storage for clothes, for this family of four, staying a week. Hotel well-categorized and described in the Expedia website.

review.title: Excellant
review.reviewText: Great service.

review.title: Very pleased
review.reviewText: The service was excellent.

review.title: great hotel close to fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel was better than expected. Everyone working there was friendly. Highly recomended!

review.title: Hotel Review
review.reviewText: Good service and location

review.title: Great ubication
review.reviewText: This hotel is well ubicated in the fisherman's wharf and is comfortable

review.title: Excellent location and friendly staff
review.reviewText: This is an excellent hotel. All staff were friendly and courteous. Room was clean and in excellent condition. Location is perfect, close to the majority of tourist destinations. Only issue was the pillows - they were awfull, but I find that when one person dislikes a pillow another person will love the same one, so not a big deal.

review.title: Excellent hotel.
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a good location to the wharf and access to the trolley. It was very clean with an exceptional and helpful staff. I would definitely go back again.

review.title: Good hotel, great location
review.reviewText: The Hyatt is a typical business hotel, modern with a franchise feel but the rooms were a good size for our family of 4 and were clean and well furnished. It is placed just a block awat from the centre of Fisherman's Wharf and from the Powell - Hyde tram station. Would recommend.

review.title: Excellent Accommodations!
review.reviewText: Extremely pleased with our hotel, both it's location to Fisherman's Wharf and the cable car system. The room was immaculate and the bed - the best ever!!!! Will definitely be telling my friends! The hotel staff was most helpful in our search for attraction locations.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Great handy location and easy acces to all attractions

review.title: Great job
review.reviewText: We had two small children with us who pretty much destroyed the room each evening with food and toys. Every morning I was very impressed with how well it was cleaned and maintained. Thank you!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Very short walk to Fishermans Wharf the cable cars and plenty of choices for dining. The entire stay at the Hyatt was what I would expect. The only negative was the pool was closed a bit early (9PM)

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location for many different attractions. The hotel was very polite, and helpful.

review.title: Beautiful room & the bed was fantastic.
review.reviewText: Very nice & quiet. 1 block away from Fisherman's Wharf & easy walk to Ghiredelli's.

review.title: we would go back in a minute,very happy
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with our stay at the Hyatt @ Fisherman's Wharf. The only problem we had was the first day when we checked in to our room, the toilet had been used and not flushed. We did not complain to the desk, as it didn't seem like that big of a problem. They were always courteous and friendly. Every day we went out and about, and always returned to a clean room. We felt very safe. It was an overall wonderful experience. We would go back to the same hotel in a heartbeat!

review.title: Great time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel was ok. Would have been nice if there was a small frige in the room to keep water and soda in it. Room was too warm and didnt cool off even when the thermostat was lowered to 65.TV in the room had limited channels. Would have been nice to have a wider variety of channels while relaxing in the room. Hotel parking was outrageous.....$39 per day

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel based on what I thought would be a convenient location, and it was. The employees of this hotel were first rate as well as the accomodations. You can not go wrong with this place, and my family and I are quite picky when it comes to hotels.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Excellent location for seeing SF. Transit is close and easy to get to by walking. Easy walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Comfortable room and good hotel service. Would stay there again.

review.title: it was a gift to my daughters
review.reviewText: i purchased a trip to san fransico for my two daughters, they were really excited and loved the hotel, the fire engine tour i arranged through expedia. the entire experience was great for them. I contacted expedia by phone on small matter and the person on the other line was helpful and friendly. I work right next to a travel agency and when i contacted expedia, it was like i was calling my own travel agent. the whole experience was great

review.title: Hotel was great, hotel restaurant poor at best!
review.reviewText: The Hyatt at Fishermans Warf is a very good place to stay while in San Fransico, here it comes..............the hotel restaurant "Knuckles" has the absolute worse service I have ever experienced, the wait staff is absolutely the worse. We went in twice seated ourselves, as the sign said and failed to be waited on. We walked out both times. Beware!

review.title: Outstanding
review.reviewText: Better than expected. The customer service was incredible.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotels location allowed my wife and I to walk everywhere and see all the sites etc.. that we were interested in.

review.title: Very Professional Staff
review.reviewText: This hotel was wonderful - great staff - very accommodating and helpful. We enjoyed our stay and it is very close to Fisherman's Wharf, cable cars, lots of fun things to do.

review.title: Very Comfortable Hotel
review.reviewText: This was our first trip to San Francisco. We found the hotel staff to be helpful and the hotel is conveniently located. The workout facilities are very nice, although too warm!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location to do and go anywhere you want to go, The hotel is great and great service, very friendly people.

review.title: We loved it
review.reviewText: This was a perfect hotel choice. We were traveling in honor of our kids' graduations from college and grad school and wanted a family vacation for 4 adults. We got adjoining rooms, which were spacious, modern and comfortable. The service was impeccable and courteous. Many attractions were within walking distance. Several little breakfast cafes are located directly across from the entrance, and provided a pleasant beginning for long days of touring.

review.title: Amazing!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel has been recently renovated, the beds were spacious with pillowtops and big comfy pillows. The alarm clocks had an iPod attachment, and the TVs were nice flatscreens. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, and it was right at the edge of Fisherman's Wharf. My friend and I were immensely satisfied with our experience there, and if I go back to San Francisco, I will definitely stay at the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf again. It was a great package deal with the flight, we couldn't believe the luxury we received for a very reasonable price.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel was one block from the cable cars and walking distance to the fisherman's wharf. Great location. The rooms were clean and had a cool modern design, flat screen tv, funky bathrooms. The staff was very friendly.Had a great stay at the hotel. Will definately stay here again.

review.title: Over size king was a small room
review.reviewText: For a Hyatt we were dissappointed. The room was very small for an oversize king.Window shade controls were very difficult to reach(behind furniture) and the air conditioner is set so that the room stays 70' plus. No fan in bathroom and Ground floor rooms open to pool area so leaving the window open at night is not an option. Many hotels are within a block or 2 and might be more comfortable. Service was excellent!

review.title: Hands-down the best hotel in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights, and had the time of our lives! The rooms are absolutly gorgeous, the bed was ridiculously comfortable, the staff were all beyond friendly and helpful, and the times we ordered room service, the food was amazing. The hotel itself is literally a block from one of the major cablecar turnarounds, and there are a few good restaurants in Fisherman's Wharf (Cioppino's and Boudin were our favorites!), and the Ghiradelli chocolate shop and soda fountain is just a couple blocks over (and a MUST-VISIT for anyone in the area!). We had an absolutly fantastic trip, and when we go back, we will undoubtedly be staying at the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf - I wouldn't consider anything else!

review.title: Good hotel at great location
review.reviewText: Overall, I liked this hotel. My only complaints concerned the internet service and the exercise room. The Hyatt offered only wireless internet service. If your laptop is not configured for wireless, then you are out of luck. The exercise room was large with nice cardio equipment, but had no weight machine.

review.title: Terrific Hotel!
review.reviewText: Close to everything. Excellent service, very friendly staff and helpful, knowledgeable concierge. Rooms were immaculate and well-appointed. A lovely hotel all the way around! We will definitely visit again.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice clean hotel that is within walking distance of many attractions.

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: Location for all the things we wanted to do in San Francisco was excellent. Bed and pillows are the best I have ever slept in away form home.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Everything is rather close by. Although clearly a summer spot, the sports bar in the lobby and its proximity to downtown make it an all year round standout.

review.title: Good hotel, good location
review.reviewText: The Hyatt on the Fisherman's Wharf is a very nice hotel, with large, clean rooms, and comfortable beds! It's also in a good location, close to the wharf, within 5 minutes walking distance.

review.title: Great SF Location
review.reviewText: Hotel is in perfect loacation, ideally placed for public transport to explore the city. Great place for breakfast just accross the street - Holywood Cafe

review.title: Great hotel and location
review.reviewText: The Hyatt looked like a brand new hotel. Everything was beautiful and so clean. The staff was ready and willing to do anything to make our stay the best. Check-in and Check-out was flawless and fast. At check-in we were given a map of San Francisco with the Hyatt clearly marked. We would stay here again!

review.title: would definitely return!
review.reviewText: Great location, very comfortable room and extremely quiet. Our 4th floor room overlooked the pool area, and it was very quiet at night. Heard nothing from the hallways or adjacent rooms. Restaurant on ground floor added to the convenience ... very good food. All staff extremely friendly and very helpful.

review.title: great hotel and location
review.reviewText: Clean, friendly, well situated to Wharf and Bodin's sourdough bread. Would return anytime. Only less-than-positive note is that I would not rely on hotel concierge for assistance on restaurants, tours, shows, etc.

review.title: Too dark and noir for us
review.reviewText: Problem with room. No ice bucket, very limited toiletries. The location was fine, but this place is not for someone who wants to go for some personal time-out. A business traveler would be better served.

review.title: cant wait to go back
review.reviewText: Great hotel....excelent location...frendly stuff...Recommend this hotel!

review.title: Very Nice Place
review.reviewText: location was great, we walked everywhere

review.title: Very good locaton, easy to find.visit major attractions. very good public transport links
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel, recently re-furbished. Rooms are clean and spacious.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a good location. My room was pretty big and the decor was modern, with a flat panel tv.

review.title: Great Trip!!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very convenient to everything is the Fisherman's Wharf area. The people at the hotel were extremely pleasant, and very helpful. The sports bar at the hotel had very good food, and a great atmosphere. We don't usually eat at the hotel when we travel since there are always so many great restaurants to try. But on several occassions we returned to the hotel late and were tired so we just decided to eat there. We were very pleased every time. We had a great time!

review.title: Nice Hotel, Very helpful staff, Room cleaning daily could have been a little better.
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay. The staff was extremely helpful. The maid service could have been a little better as our room was left a little messy a couple of times. Great location, easy access to cable cars. Thanks for a great time.

review.title: Confused by Showers
review.reviewText: The hotel is located close to everything you want to see as a tourist, the beds are very comfortable, and the rooms are immaculate. A very nice place to stay. Down sides?? The shower is stupid, it is impossible to turn on the shower without standing directly under the shower head so you get shot with COLD water. Also, the lack of free internet access (wireless or in the business center) in such a High End name as HYATT is just silly. They charge $9.99/day for wireless and $6.99/15minutes in the business center.

review.title: Perfect location!!
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly. The location wsa wonderful. Gave us the opportunity to walk all around Fisherman's Wharf and still stop in to rest, change shoes, drop off packages, with no inconvenience.

review.title: Great Location, great hotel, but what's with the parking?
review.reviewText: Took my 2 boys, 9 and 11 on their first trip to San Francisco. Arranged the trip many months in advance and thought it was all paid for. Rented a car because we had family to visit in Tiburon. Boy was I surprised to find out that I had to pay for parking every day! Apparently that's how it works in the city, I just wish I would've been warned. My only other complaint, is when I asked the concierge for directions, she charged me. I thought that you tip a concierge, not get charged. The hotel room itself was nicely decorated. The beds were very comfortable. The boys loved the plasma T.V. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Loved the restaurant and the little game room. There were 2 pool tables and a shuffle board game. Location was great. In walking distance to the embarcadero to take the Alcatraz cruise. Right down the street from Ghiradelli Square and Fisherman's Wharf. A cable car turnaround was one block away. I would stay at the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf again.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is clean, very modern and 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. It's also 6 blocks from the ferry to Alcatraz.

review.title: A good experience
review.reviewText: The Hyatt at the Wharf lived into its description. It was easily within walking distance of needed transportation in the trolley and street car services. It was also minutes away from the wharf and of bike rental shops which helped in the short ride over to the Golden Gate Bridge. Also, It was only a 15 minute walk over to the ferry landing for the Alcatraz tour. Lastly, the rooms were very comfortable. It was also nice to have the workout facilities for early risers.

review.title: Great hotel but....
review.reviewText: Hotel was great, and its location perfect for us, but felt it was let down by the quality of its restaurant. The breakfasts were good, but other food mediocre at best. Luckily there are lots of alternative places to eat.

review.title: Simply the best!
review.reviewText: We had such a hassle-free and comfortable stay at the Hyatt. The location is wonderful, the staff overwhelmingly courteous and helpful, and the room was very comfortable. We stayed in the oversized/double queen room. The oversized part is an extended room that contains a small living room set. This extension eliminated any sense of claustrobia one might feel when you are staying in one room with your whole family. It was perfect!

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Great location Excellent service VERY helpful staff

review.title: Hotel is in a great location
review.reviewText: The hotel was perfect for our tour needs.

review.title: Nice, but not perfect
review.reviewText: No bath tubs in any room, so traveling w young children may be problem. Though they had recently remodeled and the rooms sported down comforters and beautiful flat screen TVs their bathrooms needed some work. Were booked in to a Handicapped accessable room initially and the shower was impossible. Drain was slow and water all over floor. Handle fell off when my husband tried to turn off water. MAnagement was gracious and changed our room immediately, but new bath (though looked great) was not much better. Shower had only one side glass enclosed and spray located in middle of ceiling. Made taking showers cold (no heater in bath, I was surprised) and rather uncomforatable since you couldn't really direct spray. Bar attached is sports bar and everyone is friendly. Drink prices did not gouge. Nice walking distance to wharf.

review.title: Great beds!
review.reviewText: VERY Comfortable beds. Staff very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Nice Hotel in Great Location
review.reviewText: The people at the Hyatt were friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean. Also, this hotel was in a great location for walking to most everywhere on the Wharf.

review.title: Great Rooms - Great Location
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed the new design of the rooms - very New York sleek! The staff was wonderful about granting our request for a good view and they were all very helpful. The only things I missed in the rooms were bathroom robes (and bathroom fan) and a mini bar - but that was probably a good thing! We will return to the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf again and will recommend it to our friends. Thanks Hyatt and Expedia!

review.title: Great Location for SF Get-away
review.reviewText: Great rooms, nice modern design. Location is 1 block from the cable car so it is very easy to get to from SFO. Several bus lines are also within a block of hotel. Staff was excellent and rooms are 4 star quality. Nice pool and fitness room. Plenty of coffee houses near by.

review.title: convenience
review.reviewText: hotel is in walking distance of fishermans wharf.food is not to good and service was average.

review.title: good place
review.reviewText: Great location, clean rooms, helpful staff( with the exception of the concierge) Very sarcastic and downright nasty to a lady in front of me! Rent bikes and bike over the Golden Gate bridge. It is GREAT!!!!

review.title: nice but bland
review.reviewText: Nice but low keyed. Rooms on the small side.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Parking difficult and expensive. Front entrance/front desk areas a hastle while checking in and out.

review.title: Beautiful room and professional staff
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very professional and helpful with smiling faces. The hotel was very clean and cozy.

review.title: very nice place to stay
review.reviewText: very nice rooms, clean,nice part of San Francisco to stay. Be careful of airport (lories) shuttle. they droped of at the wrong hyatt even though it was written right on our pass had to take a taxi to get to the right hotel

review.title: One of Fisherman's Wharfs Best
review.reviewText: Clean and well presented, highly recommended. At no time during our stay when we either walked or caught municipal transport did we feel threatened in anyway.

review.title: Very nice, modern
review.reviewText: Hotel was modern and in a great location!

review.title: We're going back for a romantic getaway!
review.reviewText: I would highly recommend this hotel! It is centrally located near everything in the Wharf. Beautiful interior with a great staff! My husband and I are already planning to go back for a quick romantic weekend!

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: The room was great - the beds were super comfortable and everything was immaculate.

review.title: Wonderful choice
review.reviewText: Actually, the exterior was not what I expected. But the interior was excellent, and the room was clean and fancy. The staffs were also very kind. I'm confident that I will stay here if I would have to visit San Franscisco someday.

review.title: Hyatt@Fisherman's Wharf We'll Be Back
review.reviewText: Something for everyone. A great pool and whirlpool for any age. Clean and stylish rooms. What a comfy bed. The hotel rest. was a little overpriced for breakfast. Walk to everything or take the cable cars. The front doormen were wonderful, even used the concierge for recommendations.

review.title: Great Location and Superb accommodation..
review.reviewText: Great Location, based in the middle of the bay area, close to all local piers with attractions and dining, all tours are easily reached from this hotels position, massive rooms with massive widescreen TV, very comfortable extra large beds, and Bar and Resturant located inside the hotel, location is ideal when visiting San Fran as the Cable Car Terminus is right behind hotel giving great links into the City Centre at all times. Very recommended Hotel...

review.title: I would stay there again
review.reviewText: Great service. Beautiful and cozy rooms. I would stay there again. Great breakfast right across the street.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a perfect location! We were able to walk just about everywhere (Pier 39, Geiradelli Square, Union Square, Chinatown, etc.) The hotel was being renovated, but it was still beautiful.

review.title: Worth every dollar
review.reviewText: My wife and I went to enjoy our honeymoon and we were shock to find such a great hotel with great guest service and the location, wow the location was perfict right down the street from the cable car stop, short walk to every main event, show, or shop in S.F. I would say anyone who wants to go to a great hotel and not have to worry about anything but enjoying themselves this is the hotel for them

review.title: Very clean...But you have to pay for parking
review.reviewText: Clean hotel with an excellent gym. Paying $38 a day for parking was a little steep, however this is in San Francisco.

review.title: pleasantly surprised
review.reviewText: you never know what to expect despite all the research you do when booking on line but having gone through expedia ; given the info you have at the time you go with what you think was the best choice. after all, it really isn't the final destination but the journey itself. having said that , the hyatt at the fisherman's wharf was convienent to everything. resteraunts/coffee shops/transportation. the room pleasing in its decorations was big enough for 2 adults. comfortable and very quiet despite the convention that was going on downstairs. front desk would always greet when coming or going , the conceriege was available for any questions and they even have a computer where you can preprint you boarding pass. all in all having never spent any time in san francisco or a hyatt i would definitely go back

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with the Hyatt. We were met in front of the hotel and were checked in quickly. Everyone was helpful in providing information about the city as well as making sure we were satisfied with our rooms. During our stay, only one elevator was working. This created a problem because stairs were only for emergency exits. This was only a maintenance problem and I am sure it has been corrected. I would definately stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: Good place to stay. Centrally located. Easy walk to wharf and to the cable cars and public transit. They had very comfortable beds with the feather comforter and feather bed. Nice lobby area with cozy fireplace. Quiet rooms. Once in lobby they were always greeting you and directing where to go. Maid service was quick and room was ready to go when we came back to the room after a busy day touring. We would re-visit again.

review.title: Nice place.
review.reviewText: Newly remodeled with modern fuurnishings. Great location.

review.title: Comfortable and well-maintained
review.reviewText: Overall very nice though with a few negatives. Positives: - Very comfortable bed - Very clean, nicely decorated, comfortable room - Friendly staff, quick check in/out proceedures Negatives/Areas for improvement: - Though the staff was very nice, they could do more to ensure your satisfaction and provide that extra level of service - Fees for internet access are passe for many business users, especially in San Francisco. Hyatt's policies on this matter are antiquated. - The restaurant next door was weak compared to the quality of the hotel itself.

review.title: Would go back tomorrow
review.reviewText: Very pleasant hotel. Service from staff was excellent. Room was very clean and everything is new. I would stay there again and recommend to others in heartbeat. Not impressed with the hotel restaurant. Breakfast (only meal I had there) was expensive, food and service not impressive. Great smoothie though. I'm sure there are better places around.

review.title: will recommend this hotel to anyone
review.reviewText: this hotel was very comfortable with a pillow top mattress on the bed and down type comforters. It was very close to Fishermans Wharf and there were great places to eat breakfast across the street. We will definately go there again.

review.title: Clean, Comfortable Room
review.reviewText: The room was exceptionally clean. The beds and pillows were the best I've ever slept on in a hotel. My sister and I will definately re-book at the Hyatt on our next trip.

review.title: Fisherman's Warf
review.reviewText: Overall satisfaction of this hotel was well, it was a clean facility but I found that the employees lacked customer service skills and were not knowledgeable about the town, directions or information.

review.title: Outstanding value for money
review.reviewText: I can't recommend this hotel highly enough. It may be boring from the outside but the rooms are as chic and stylish as any boutique hotel, spotlessly clean and the bed was like sleeping in a cloud. Don't be put off by the touristy location at Fisherman's Wharf - the hotel is seconds from the cable cars and trolleys, minutes from the pier for Alcatraz (that trip also highly recommended) and you're on the right side of town for a walk up into lively North Beach and on to Union Street, Pacific Heights and other beautiful residential areas full of gorgeous victorian houses. It would have been cheap at twice the price.

review.title: We would be happy to go again.
review.reviewText: Our room was quite and the bed was very comfortable. The people at the desk and those serving us in every way were very polite and helpful.

review.title: Pleasantly suprised
review.reviewText: Having stayed at other "tourist location" hotels, I was pleasantly surprised to find a clean, nicely appointed hotel. Furniture, carpets, fixtures didn't look worn out or overused. The staff was friendly and courteous. I recommend the concierge for planning sightseeing itineraries & tickets (especially in the summer). We were in easy walking location to major attractions, and to transportation. For our 2 full days of sightseeing a car was unnecessary.

review.title: Excellent location, excellent hotel
review.reviewText: The location is perfect, a lot of walking distance points of interest. I think is one of the best locations in SF. The hotel is clean and modern. I went with my aunt and my mother (I'm 25) and we had a blast. Very confortable and helpful people...

review.title: sure, I'll go back
review.reviewText: We arrived at noon, and they were ready to check us in so it was reassuring. Also we were able to borrow a nice umbrella when it started raining all of a sudden. Overall, we had a great time staying at this hotel.

review.title: Decent rate and quality for location
review.reviewText: Overall, this hotel was ok. The location was great as we were two blocks from touristy Fisherman's Wharf and two blocks from the end of the Powell Trolley line. As far as the hotel itself, we were travelling with our ten year old so we had specific ideas in mind. For instance, this hotel advertised a children's video/play room, but there wasn't one so this was pretty disappointing. You could rent video games for 2 hour blocks from your room, but we don't like for him to play video for that long and the whole point was to let him get out of the room for a few minutes and develop some independence in a safe environment. Also, the bar and bar food were ok, but nothing spectacular. The service was slow, but polite. The rooms were nice, but the beds were a disappointment. The hotel should turn the matresses because there are troughs in the beds. Overall, based on location and price, we would stay here again without our son. However, there are other better choices if you have children along.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: I had a wonderful time at the hotel. The room and bathroom were extremely comfortable, modern and well designed. Its in a great area!

review.title: A home away from home. Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf has all the comfort of home.
