review.reviewText: The hotel was quite accessible to places of interests and was a short walk to the cable car station at Mason Street. Our room was exceptionally maintained and clean, giving us a good night's rest after a tiring day of sightseeing. Hotel staff were helpful though they need to smile more often. Our stay at this hotel made our visit to Frisco more memorable.

review.title: would love to go back.....
review.reviewText: our whole experience at the hyatt was great. would recommend it to anyone. great place and a wonderful time.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: This hotel has recently been updated and is a great place to stay close to Fisherman's Wharf. The most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in! The only thing that would have made our stay better would have been a better view.

review.title: Good Service
review.reviewText: We are the foreigners who are not familiar with many things in San Francisco.. People work for Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf are very kinds to response many questions to us with patience.

review.title: A great place to stay!
review.reviewText: The hotel was great! The only thing we didn't like about the hotel room was the shower in our bathroom! There was not a bathtub and in the shower the water faucet was in the ceiling so I couldn't reach it to turn it. I didn't like that at all, but otherwise it was a great place to stay and such friendly people!

review.title: Nice place, helpful staff
review.reviewText: The room was very nice, and the bed was very comfortable, however we were surprised when we noticed the room didnt have a mini fridge. also i wasnt a big fan of the showers that dont have a door that closes all the way. everytime i showered water got all over the bathroom floor. these are minor things though, it was a nice hotel and a short walk to fishermans wharf.

review.title: best on wharf
review.reviewText: close to all actives in the area with little treffic almost no hill aroun wharf, easy walking

review.title: Room was very comfortable
review.reviewText: The room was great, and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in. Staff was very pleasant and concierge was very helpful. Would certainly reccomend.

review.title: Not as expeted...
review.reviewText: Hotel's room condition is okay but we have to request for new towels every time since they have a note in the room that they will only change your towels and linens every three days. Although they have a note there to call if you do not want to participate, i think that this is a hassle since i would think that every customer wants theirs towels fresh and clean every time they are going to use it. every morning before we leave, we would request for room service, we would put our stuff on the chairs for cleaning, BUT when we come back, the carpet floors are still dirty :-( will not go stay again in this hotel...

review.title: Excellent vacation to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel was great but parking in the hotel was a bit expensive ($38.00 a day). You can try and find street parking to save money if your lucky enough to find parking. But everything is within walking distance.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is within walking distance of the wharf, the electric street cars, the cable cars, etc. The parking was a bit steep, but the valet service was very quick.

review.title: SF Better Hotel
review.reviewText: Service here was very good. The A/C in the mondern style room didn't work very well (return air filter was plugged and never got changed). The housekeeping staff was rather slip-shod, things didn't get refurnbished as they should have been. Basically, though, the room was O.K. and the hotel staff and the location was great.

review.title: I left my heart in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff and in a wonderful Wharf location.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We loved the location of the hotel. It was in a quiet location but still only a few blocks from many tourist attractions such as Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Pier for Alcatraz Ferry, Ghiradelli Square, Trolley Car stops.

review.title: Good hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, within short walking distance to all the tours and attractions at Fishermans Wharf. Staff were very helpful and the rooms are clean and comfortable (have flat screen TVs). Knuckles Sports bar is excellent. Would stay here again.

review.title: Quality facility and friendly service at a great location...definitely recommended.
review.reviewText: We experienced friendly and attentive service from our check in through check out from all staff. The hotel has been recently renovated and is very stylish and very comfortable, very clean. Vey nice amenities. Good food at associated/adjoining sports bar and restaurant. Location for Fisherman's Wharf and surrounding area access is great. Somewhat limited parking if you arrive by car. Highly recommended.

review.title: Right in the middle and excellent stay!
review.reviewText: The hotel was excellent, accomodated a late check-in, and was prompt with everything. Within seconds of pulling in, our doors were being opened by the valet, who swiftly removed our bags, and took care of the vehicle, upon walking in the door we were immidately greeted by the front desk staff. After a quick a trouble free check-in we were on our way to the room. This is the only downside I found, we were not informed at check-in that our requested single King bed had been substituted to two queen beds because they were out of King-equipped rooms. When we called the front desk to clarify they were "matter of fact" about not having any single King rooms. Other than this everything else during our two night stay was wonderful. Super comfy beds, nice view of the cable car turn-around, and just blocks from everything!!

review.title: Would love to go back
review.reviewText: Excellent location!! Walking distance to many places of interest. Helpful front desk tips on where to go.

review.title: great location and family friendly
review.reviewText: We visited with 2 kids. The kids loved the mini entertainment area next to the restaurant and the check in area (foosball, pool, a couple of non-violent games). It felt very safe. This was worth something to us because it allowed our kids to roam around without us being concerned. We loved the location, close to the wharfs. Easy to rent bikes or to run to the Golden Gate Bridge in the cool mornings. There are several other hotels close by that look very suitable from the outside. If you are price-sensitive (and who isn't?), and the difference is significant to you, you may want to go for the lower cost. One critique - people tend to leave their room-service dishes outside the room and they do not seem to be picked up in the evening so they are there in the morning (I got up at 7 am). Not a lot of it, but noticeable. Ask for breakfast buffet coupons. We did not have them (booked as part of an Expedia package), but a lot of other people did. Car parking is expensive and thus, if you do not think you will need a car, better not get one or rent for the day.

review.title: San Francisco's Greatest Comfort
review.reviewText: This hotel was well worth the price of admission! We paid a little more than we originaly budgeted for, but the service was uncanny. The staff are all quick and willing to meet your needs. You'll want to take the beds home with you. The rooms have all been redecorated and reflect a mix of elegance and modern deco. The flat screen TVs are a plus also. The staff in charge of the wake up calls don't miss a beat! Also, the hotels dining was superb. If you're staying in Fisherman's Warf, this is the hotel to be in. Your close to everything and you can count on excellence!

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Great, newly renovated rooms, extremely comfortable bed, great television, nice bathroom. Hotel staff very accomodating. Location great, everything walking distance. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Forget the rest- the Hyatt's the best!
review.reviewText: We've been to countless hotels all over the San Francisco area- The Hyatt had superior beds, a great location, competetive rates, and the most courteous staff we've had the pleasure of encountering. Everyone was eager to assist. This hotel is a WINNER!

review.title: Great Hotel in Fantastic Location
review.reviewText: Location fantastic, 200yds from Fisherman's Wharf. Hotel modern, clean, fresh, rooms well appointed and roomy(LCD TV's). Knuckles bar for breakfast is a must.

review.title: Great Time
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time, everyone was very helpful.

review.title: its ok, good location
review.reviewText: the hotel is fine. room service could be better... not as clean as would have hoped. beware hotel parking is valet and quite expensive.

review.title: Staff was great
review.reviewText: The staff at this hotel was always very helpful. The men at the valet would not hesitate to give you information or help. Overnight parking at the hotel was a bit pricey, but that seems to be common in that area. I still would go back. The rooms were very nice and the beds extremely comfortable.

review.title: very accomidating
review.reviewText: great location, very clean. Accomidates the handicapped in all aspects.

review.title: Friendly & Welcoming
review.reviewText: The hotel was SUPER clean and comfortable. Great breakfast and lunch menu in the restaurant, "Knuckles", along with friendly service. Very helpful and pleasant staff. Would definitely stay there again!

review.title: perfect hotel for fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: the service and hotel staff were great. the restaurant was a very good place to eat. the location was the best part. we walked to all of the fishermans wharf attractions.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel, terrible food!
review.reviewText: Overall, this is was a great experience, as long as you don't eat in the hotel (one restaurant only). The quality and service of food was not impressing being in the one of the finest cities of the US!

review.title: cozy beds
review.reviewText: A nice clean hotel that is in a good location, right in the fisherman's wharf area. The beds are the best feature in this hotel. They have this soft cushion on top of the mattress that lets you just feel like you molded right into it. It just took your tension of walking around all day away. The pillows were wonderful also. The best sleep I ever had at a hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: This recently renovated hotel should be 4 stars, not 3 and a half. The room was beautiful, clean and comfortable. Everything seemed brand new. It was easy walking distance to Ghiradelli Square, Fisherman's Warf and Pier 39 and all the tours. It was way better than I expected. The restaurant in the hotel "Knuckles" is very good and casual.

review.title: Great Place - Parking Is A Bit Expensive
review.reviewText: Great Location: Wonderful Service from Employees: Excellent $38 A Night to park my rental: Absurd!

review.title: Very nice, would like to stay at the Hyatt again next trip
review.reviewText: Great location, within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardeli Square, and numerous fine restaurants.

review.title: Location is great. Would definitely stay there again.
review.reviewText: Quite comfortable - easy to walk to all Wharf attractions. Room was clean and comfortable. Concierge was knowledgeable, friendly and courteous.

review.title: Noisy/underconstruction
review.reviewText: We went for a weekend fun. We understood it is being remodel, but I wasn't expecting the hammers banging at 1:p.m. till 3: p.m. No Nap time. It will be Great once the remodeling is done.

review.title: Okay accomodations, but so-so service
review.reviewText: We reserved and confirmed a king bed in non-smoking room, got two queens and the room had smoking odors. The staff was friendly but wasn't very competent.

review.title: Renovation and Location Makes a Great Place to Sleep
review.reviewText: Our room was recently renovated with all new furniture, a plasma tv, marble bathroom, and Aeron chair. If you need to stay in Fisherman's Wharf, you cannot beat the price, location, and comfort. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: My wife and I enjoyed our stay Hyatt because of its great location. We enjoy urban hikes and from the Hyatt we were able to walk to the Golden Gate Bridge, Union Square, North Beach, and along the Embarcadero. In addition, the hotel staff were very helpful in advising us about the virtues of using the F line for local transportation to several places of interest to us. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Nice Location
review.reviewText: Convenient to tourist areas....Very expensive for 1 night parking, ask in advance about the cost...may be better off at lot down the street & breakfast was a bit pricey ... these other costs sneak up on you! Nice pool & exercise area. Convenient game room.

review.title: Would recommend with specific reservations
review.reviewText: Hotel has a great location. Service was good. Two reservations include the following. First, valet parking was full and we had to park about two blocks away - however, they referred us to the parking garage, and the daily parking rate there was cheaper as long as you didn't take your car out. Second, the rooms smelled of smokers. The first room was unacceptable to us. They offered us a second better room, and explained that the building was purchased by Hyatt and had not been fully cleaned of cigarette/cigar smells except for few rooms (two?). Small details: no coffee pot in the room, but complimentary coffee was available in the lobby from 5:30 - 9:00 or 9:30 I can't remember. No mini refrigerator in the room.

review.title: Outstanding Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean, furniture very comfortable, and staff very accomodating. The hotel is located just 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf (Pier 39) where there are outstanding restaurants, tourist attractions, etc. I would strongly recommend the hotel for families or couples.

review.title: Quite nice
review.reviewText: I stayed in a standard king room, which had a HD plasma TV and a very nice large bathroom. The room was comfortable and clean. As were the steam room, workout room, pool and spa. I really cant complain and the location was just lovely. One thing though. Everything from the Elevators to the TV made the most annoying musical chime. Aside from that everything was fine.

review.title: Looking to return for another visit
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, clean & comfortable rooms, great location.

review.title: New Rooms are wonderful
review.reviewText: I stayed in a recently refurbished room with modern, understated decor and a lovely comfortable bed. The room was quiet, even though it was above the street. The rest of the hotel is obvoiusly undergoing work, although it was not obtrusive. For a business trip the room was a perfect respite from busy days.

review.title: I recommend this hotel 100%
review.reviewText: We visited San Francisco over Christmas. The hotel was very nice, in a wonderful location. We bought a "City Pass" and for seven days could ride cable car and Muni, also included several Museums. It saves a bundle. Two blocks away we found a "Trader Joe's", (it's a grocery store) and a Safeway.

review.title: Place to stay if going SF & Fisherman's Warf
review.reviewText: Great hotel with excellent location. We had three rooms & everthing exceeded our expectations.

review.title: Awesome!!
review.reviewText: THE best bed I have ever had at a hotel. Great location 2 blocks from the Wharf and 1/2 bock from a cable car station as well as one bock from a about 6 major bus routes. Exceptional service from all staff. Highly recomended.

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf's Finest Hotel
review.reviewText: I was extremely pleased with the service and cleanliness of this hotel. Food and Beverage services were excellent and reasonably priced, location approx. 2 blocks from the waterfront was perfect. Perhaps the only sore spot was the parking situation. All parking was Valet only, and I felt that the $32.00 per day charge was a bit steep.

review.title: Love it!
review.reviewText: great location hotel for staying on the warf

review.title: Would possibly go back
review.reviewText: I was a little disappointed when I got to the hotel. I had reserved a king size bed in a non smoking room and was told that all they had were two double beds. Since this was my first time in this hotel and I had already paid for my reservations requesting a king size bed I was not happy with their answer. A convention in town did not give them the right to give up my room reservation.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: good location for attractions on Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Convenient to all the wharf attractions. Got great service and attention for tickets to local shows and events.

review.title: Expected more from a Hyatt Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was outstanding. This hotel facility needs to be refurbished. The rooms are dark and need to be redone. I observed a mouse running down the hall.

review.title: fun weekend away from wife.
review.reviewText: very satisfied with hotel. service was excellent.

review.title: Great stay in San Fran!
review.reviewText: My husband and I went to celebrate our anniversary and had a wonderful time. However, in June it was cool during the day and even cooler at night. The hotel staff was very kind and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. The hotel was in a very convenient location in Fisherman's Wharf. We did a lot of walking. Actually walked to Union Sq, Chinatown, and Presidio Park. Bring comfy shoes b/c there are lots of hills! You must take a trolley ride!! Would definitely stay here again!

review.title: best location for warf attractions
review.reviewText: unless you plan on shopping everyday the warf is the place to be. we had debated on a few hotels in union square, but, ultimately decided on the warf. glad we did. hyatt has a great location with very helpful staff. the rooms could use a little updating, but, they were comfortable and roomy. there is a great sports bar/restraunt in the hotel. which turned out to be a added plus. overall the hotel was enjoyable, and i would recommend it.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: We spent 4 nights at the Hyatt's Fisherman's Wharf Hotel and were very satisfied with our stay. Our room was clean and comfortable and the outdoor pool and hot tub were heated and well kept. It was an overall nice hotel. The best part of this hotel was the location! It was within walking distance of everything to do in Fisherman's Wharf and walking distance of the city's quite intricate transportation system. It wasn't a true "Hyatt" standard hotel, but it was nice in a great location.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: The Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf was a clean and comfortable hotel. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Answered questions about bus lines and cable cars and tours available. Only down fall was that the room we were put in was at the end of a hall by the stairs and we heard some stair traffic. Overall a good experience, and close to the famous Pier 39 wharf.

review.title: I have grown to expect more from Hyatt
review.reviewText: I have always expected a little more from Hyatt but the service was quite good and the location was great

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: room was right above the bar,very noisy til 2 in the morning. if you choose this hotel request away from the bar. everything else was standard and satisfacory.

review.title: Relaxing vacation in a great location by NH traveler
review.reviewText: This hotel is exactly what we were looking for in San Francisco. The room was quiet and beds were the most comfortable we have found in a hotel. The only possible negative was that the room felt a bit small, but we were there to see the local sights which we enjoyed immensely. The employees at the concierge desk recommended great tours and restaurants, and their recommendations were just great!

review.title: Very Pleased
review.reviewText: Great location and hotel.  Friendly staff and the building was well maintained.  Definitely would go back!

review.title: Definite Referral
review.reviewText: The staff was helpful and polite.  We loved the complimentary coffee service on our floor for morning coffee.  When we go back to San Francisco, the Hyatt will be our hotel of choice.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Many great resturants and places of interest are witin walking distance of thr hotel. The Hyatt is very clean, well maintained and the staff is very courtious and friendly.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Poor quality services and hotel for the Hyatt brand.

review.title: nice place good valet
review.reviewText: nice place - good valet service for New Year's Eve, however, I recommend that they change the parking enterance.  It is very hard to get in and out of and it is hard to find.

review.title: Eh...I've had better
review.reviewText: On a trip to San Francisco, My companion and I stayed at the Hyatt Hotel. I believe we paid too much for the services we had received. Even though the staff were kind and friendly, the room left much to be desired. The bed was quite hard and the reception on the television was poor. The cleanliness of the room was poor as well, due to the fact that dirty glasses were left in our room more than once during our stay there. I would not stay at the Hyatt again if I had a choice.

review.title: Location, location, location!
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a perfect location for exploring SF.  The valet parking needs to improve.

review.title: I will stay there again!
review.reviewText: Great hotel.  People were friendly and could help us with any thing we needed.  I really liked the idea of them taking your luggage out of your car and bringing up to your room while you checked in.  And what a great deal for parking.  The price was little high for me, but you did get the in and out without a fee thing.  And that is the added bonus.  The pool and spa, great.  Excercise room, excellent.  The sauna was quite nice too.  Controls on it were set perfectly.  Very friendly staff.  I will stay there on future visits to San Fransisco.

review.title: Great location, Great hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a very convenient location and is very reasonably priced.  Only drawback was that we had to walk quite a ways to our room once we got off the elevator.

review.title: location, location, location
review.reviewText: Easy access to fisherman's Wharf, Cable Cars, Ghiradelli Square - all within walking distance.  the area felt safe and secure even late at night.

review.title: Best location and friendliest staff
review.reviewText: The hotels location is ideal.  You can walk 2 blocks and be to everything. There is never a need to rent a car when staying at this hotel.  The staff was very courteous and most helpful.  The hotel could arrange for any sightseeing tours you would like to have.  I would definitely go back to San Francisco for another trip and I would absolutely stay at this hotel.

review.title: Terrific vacation
review.reviewText: Everything about the hotel was wonderful.  The rooms, the staff, the location, the adjoinging restaurant were all terrific.  I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to others.

review.title: Review of Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: I thought it was a little pricey for the accomodations, but all in all, I was satisfied with the hotel.

review.title: Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf, San Francisco , Ca.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, needs cleaning of the rugs and curtains in the hotel. The Staff was well trained and wonderful.
